Description:

Every year NYC hosts Summer streets events to promote healthy life for New Yorkers. You can dance, play, run, walk, zip-line and bike ! 

Take the chance to learn some salsa with Salsa New York, and enjoy a professional performance !!

-Date/Time: August th (Sat) 11:00AM

-Where: Midtown Rest Stop, 25th and and Park Ave

-Subway: 6 train to 23d street or N, R train to 23d street and Broadway

-Fee: FREE

-Clothes: Any comfortable clothes

-Event website: click here
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Summer streets sign !
results.name: Summer streets 2015: Free Salsa class  and professional performance !

results.description:
10-a-side. 2 teams, 60min+ game. Pls arrive early, to warm up and be ready to start at 10.45am.



ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.

If we have extra players we'll sub, or play 10v10. It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.


• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.


•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.


• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.


• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


The payment goes toward field permit, equipment and meetup fees.


See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Saturday Soccer 10v10 @10:45am Pier 5- Full-size goals, 75min+

results.description:
Lets get going... I can host every other weekend... We'll need additional people to host, or else I'll switch the meetup to every other weekend..
We usually play at the field with the running track around it and we usually start by 11am... It's pick up football(soccer)- we like it competitive but please- no slide tackles and overly aggressive play... Bring a dark colored shirt as well as a light colored t-shirt, I didn't bring pinnies with me...
results.how_to_find_us: Comment board
results.name: Saturday morning game

group.name: MANHATTAN SOCCER - COED SOCCER IN NYC

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday-@west 134th Street Field - 10:45am

Our staple monthly event - Coffee and Conversation - for August, will be at TOAST in Montclair! Hosted by Tiffany. Hoping to change up the location each month (please feel free to suggest coffee shops!)

Join us to start your Saturday off right! Grab some coffee, sit down with the group, chat, and then enjoy the rest of your day! :)

Hope to see you there! RSVP's will be capped at 10 people to keep it smaller to better get to know each other. Thanks!

results.description:
The workshop will focus on the art of painting wooden miniatures! From sanding to drawing to painting, this workshop intends to lay the foundations of doll painting, hopefully bringing one full doll to completion. 

 Students choose the design they desire (whether a self-portrait or the portrait of another) and the workshop will explain the structure to make the design a reality. The topics range from how to pick the perfect surface to work on, to the first draft by means of a pencil sketch, to painting the doll, to varnishing.

Date: Aug 8 - 11am - 2hr

venue.name: 77th St. and Lexington Ave Subway Station-no.6  train station.

results.description:
We'll start out from an established subway line, the Lexington Avenue line,. The meeting point is  walk East towards the East River and then make our way West and North while enjoying the old architecture on some of these amazing old masterpieces (a school, a church, 2 libraries and several residential buildings). We'll then walk on second avenue to see some of the new structures that are related to the development of the second avenue subway. We will then stop by the MTA Second Avenue Subway Community Information Center for a short presentation. We'll move onto Third Avenue and then onto 86th St. where we'll pass many large modern residential buildings as well as some new large food chains and large electronic stores. Our final destination will be The Central Park Reservoir which is also known as The Jackie Kennedy Onassis Reservoir which was once known as the Croton Reservoir. I will relay the history of Central Park as well as the history of the Old Croton Aqueduct (as this once was an active reservoir for NYC). We will end up on Fifth Avenue where you can enjoy 3 museums which are FREE/pay-a -yo - wish on Saturdays.

Please note  the $15 MeetUp Member charge per person for this special tour. Discount price for students and senior citizens is offered at $12. This tour's value is actually $250 (for 10 people) as that is my charge for most of my private tours. Kindly provide me with exact payment at the venue.  Like my other walks, I do not plan  to cancel the walk as this is a multi group event.  Also since I set  a 30 person limit, please cancel your RSVP if you decide your initial plans have changed. 
Please feel free to text or call me at[masked] with any questions.


Thank You, Cindy Ladopoulos-NYCindyTouyrs.com
results.how_to_find_us: Meeting Place: 77th St. and Lexington Ave. Subway Station - no. 6 train, Meet at the 77th St. and Lexington Avenue subway station, which is the number 6 train. The group will gather below ground on the Downtown side by the MTA Booth.

results.description:
Do something GREAT this Summer!!


Take Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park
Free Group Lessons Saturdays, May 16th to October 17.


You will learn to read notes, chords and play songs you know and love.  You will have the opportunity to learn:


• Basic info about the guitar
• To read and play chords
• To read and play Rhythm
• Techniques for using the pick
• How play finger style.
• What you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country,
   Jazz, Classical
• Plenty of new songs


Anyone can attend and you don't need to attend all the sessions.  A new breakthrough approach, allows each session to be complete even for people who have no experience playing the guitar. 


And after the lesson (12:30 - 1:30p.m), hang out and network with  people, or go check out the sights in the Park!!

WHAT TO BRING: • Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Bring a portable music stand if you have one
• Also bring a 3-ring binder and a pencil


OPTIONAL DONATION: Recommended: $10 (Or whatever works for you.  Remember--except for your donations these lessons will always be FREE!



IN CASE OF RAIN:
If it rains, or there's a threat of rain (including if there is rain the night before or in the early morning and the ground is left soggy), we will have the meetup at an indoor location; check the meetup group announcements for update if looks like rain...the alternate location we will meet at is:

The Sony Public Atrium (pictured below)
550 Madison Avenue, NY, NY  10022
Enter on 55th Street, and look for the guitars gathered near the Starbucks to the right of the entrance.

Remember: please update your RSVP if your plans change and you are unable to make it.  If something changes the day of the meetup, please let me know by phone or text at[masked]-1031.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park - Free!!

results.description:
**SIGN UP LINK BELOW**


Your job has you feeling stuck, frustrated, overwhelmed. Been there!

You're aware of what you don't want out of your career, but you’re not getting closer to figuring out what you do want.

To give you a BIG push in the right direction, and to help you avoid the potential pitfalls of pursuing the wrong path, BOULD is partnering with Clarity on Fire to share THREE major things people get wrong about finding their passion. Learn what they are, how to avoid them, and get some burning questions answered, like:

• How do I set goals that will actually get me closer to where I want to be?

• What do I do if I feel paralyzed by all the options that exist?

• How do I get clear on what I want, versus what other people want for me?

Sign up now. Create a career you love.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/get-clear-on-your-passion-tickets-17785596197

____

Follow the conversation on Twitter with @BouldCo and @clarityonfire with #BeBOULD #ClearOnPassion
results.how_to_find_us: ONLINE WORKSHOP **sign up through eventbrite link below**
results.name: Get Clear on Your Passion! (ONLINE WORKSHOP)

group.name: Bould: Leading Young Women to Success in NYC

results.description:
**Please click here to RSVP through our website (MANDATORY)**

use promo code: bp-save for 10% off General Admission

What you will learn:

• Learn to design, implement, publish, and maintain a newly created website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

• Become familiarized with content creation tools, management tools, and digital media.

• Evaluate code to ensure its sytax is properly structured Learn to address all browser types


Schedule:

Part 1: An Introduction To HTML

• A Brief look at html in your favorite sites

• Basics of HTML: Syntax & Semantics 

• Best practices for writing and debugging HTML

• Building a small site with the HTML we know

• Discussing some of the new tags in HTML 5

Break  

Part 2: Applying Styles To Our HTML

• Basics of CSS: Structure and implementationCSS with the popular boostrap framework

• A brief explanation of javascript and what it can do


Small Break

Part 3: Mobile Responsive Views

• Learn to use media queries to target devices

• Learn how to make CSS responsive for all devices 

Part 4: Getting Your Code Online

• Getting your code on a hosting server like Godaddy

• Adding version control to your code and putting it on github 

Conclusion:

• Additional resources to continue learning

You must bring the following along with an eagerness to learn :) 

Requirements:

• No prior programming knowledge required

• Please bring a laptop with internet capabilities

• Please download and install Sublime Text here

<a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/"></a>

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult soccer lesson with Coach Moe. All skill levels are welcome. Bring a ball if you have one.


We will be practicing a variety of skills including dribbling, passing/receiving, feinting, shooting, ball control, positioning, tactical training, etc.

Skill exercises will be alternating with strength/agility exercises.

Small sided games

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE START TIME!


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will email you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

results.description:
Hi ladies!

We love to enjoy a good brew, so it's time we learned how to make one. A good friend and seasoned home brewer of fellow meetup member is offering up their expertise and apartment for us to experience the process.


We'll be hanging out all day so feel free to come for as long or as little as you like. Feel free to brings some beverages and snacks share. There is a backyard to hang out in during the down time and we'll have plenty of good conversations to go around.


Below is the basic itinerary for the day:
11am - Main event begins, start heating water

12pm - Mash in1pm  - Sparge (transfer from cooler to pot for boil)

2pm  - Boil

4pm  - Transfer to fermenter, aerate, move to fermentation chamber (kegerator)

5pm  - Complete

Apartment is at420 Bloomfield St #2Hoboken, NJ

results.description:
Beautiful summer days - we should be out on the water. I love to kayak. Overpeck park offers reasonable kayak and canoe rentals. It's around $15 per paddler for two hours. Website says no solo paddlers, but I'll talk to them and see if we can get around that.

After that, we can go somewhere for a late lunch, there's plenty of korean fried chicken places in the immediate area, or habit burger in Hackensack or Five Guys in Fort Lee.

This is in the new section of Overpeck park. If you're on Degraw Ave going East, you make a right turn into Overpeck park to reach the roundabout circle, and then head over the nice looking bridge, and right around there is where the Hackensack Riverkeepers keep their kayaks and such.
results.name: Kayaking/canoeing at Overpeck park

venue.name: Benches just outside the entrance to Fort Tryon Park at 190th St. & Fort Washington Ave. on Margaret Corbin Circle.

results.description: About 2-3 miles at a very slow (1.5 mph) pace, but including a substantial hill in Inwood Hill Park (hence the name). Take the "A" train to 190 St. and then the elevator up to Fort Washington Ave. -- or take the #4 bus directly to 190 St. and Fort Washington Ave. Meet 11 a.m. by the benches at the entrance to Fort Tryon Park on Margaret Corbin Circle. We'll take a look at the Heather Garden, the largest public garden in NYC. Then we'll visit Linden Terrace -- the highest point in Fort Tryon Park and the second highest natural elevation in Manhattan, with great views of the Hudson and the city. We'll have lunch at a viewpoint over the Hudson (bring lunch and beverage), just before a visit to the Cloisters, where we can take a look at the famous Unicorn Tapestries, and/or anything else people might want to see (admission is "pay what you wish" -- $1 is fine). Afterwards, we'll walk through Inwood Hill Park, the largest forested area still remaining in Manhattan, and the only entirely undeveloped park. For those who wish, there is a possible early out after Fort Tryon Park by taking the A train, at Dyckman St., or by taking the #4 bus directly from the Cloisters. The walk should end around 4:30 with a pause for refreshment at the Indian Road Cafe on 218 St. (near the 215 St. stop on the #1 subway). Call or email me to make sure that the walk is on, to let me know that you are coming, and if you have any questions. Bob Susser[masked]; [masked].
results.name: Fort Tryon & Inwood Hill Parks, with a visit to the Cloisters

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
Howdy Benders!  Hope your week is productive.  Sending out a reminder about our session this Saturday same time same place. As the weather changes, it is the perfect opportunity to drag yourself out of bed and unto your yoga mat. When I first wake up and my bed feels so good I have trouble getting out of bed. But then I remember how stressful by my work week was and how imperative yoga is to detoxing my body and aligning my mind and spirit. We owe it to ourselves to feel great! Start investing in yourself by treating yourself right. I can't tell you how many times I didn't feel like doing yoga but how great I felt afterwards.

Think about how you have an opportunity to do yoga in a community setting, meet like-minded people, and support a local business at the same time!

I would like to continue the yoga and would love to see more benders. Please take advantage of this opportunity because it may not be here for long. See you on Saturday. Namaste.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T. )

(Co-Leader- Jefferson)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Yoga day at the beach, what does that mean?

We will have a beautiful yoga day at the beach. Beach season is here! No need to spend hours commuting to the beaches in Long Island or New Jersey for a nice day at the shore, sleep in a bit and let's spend the day with swimming, yoga, picnic and playing in the sand of one of NYC's little known secrets -- Rockaway Beach Park 

We will kick back and relax here under the Summer sun, go for a swim, do yoga and just hang and converse or play a game or two. 

Where do we meet and where is this beach ?

Rockaway Park Beach, walking distance away from the last stop on A train. We will meet at the Flight 587 Memorial Park  and find a spot on the beach.

How can i get there ?

You can google "Rockaway Park Beach – 116 st" and drive there or you can take Brooklyn bound A (Rockaway Park Beach) train and get off at the Beach 116 st stop which is the last stop. There are two A trains. One is Far Rockaway another is Rockaway Park Beach. Although they go to the same direction, they split after Broad Channel stop. You can take S shuttle train to the 116th or Rockaway Park Beach after Broad channel . Once you got off at the last stop and leave the station, turn left and walk straight. You will see the park at the end.

This sounds so cool. What the day will be like ?

I know. There is no strict schedule but we will try to follow this:

-12.00 PM - We will meet in the park at 12.00 PM and go to the beach.

-12.30 PM – 30 mins of stretch and basic asanas 

-Free time – Sunbath, swimming, reading etc.

-2.30 PM – 30 mins of Energy levels & Gunas class, Questions and answers.

-3,00 PM Picnic/Lunch - You can always bring a sandwich, snack, fruits, nuts etc.

-Free time – beach games included :)

-5.45 PM Sunset Chakra Class


How does the picnic work? 

Just bring whatever you like and share with others. i.e. 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26163153/?success=uploaded#[masked] 

How are we not going to end up having so many of the same foods/snacks or let's say few people brought cake and juice, how are we going to make sure we will have disposable plates, forks, cups etc. for everyone ?

well, Just let us know through comment section what you are bringing (including plates, forks etc) so we will know what we are going to have and what we will need.

I didn't get it. can you give me an example ?

Ok, let's say you are bringing apricots and strawberries. You will just comment here as " I'm bringing apricots and strawberries" That's it.

Is there a grocery store or restaurant around?

Yes, there are many restaurants and grocery stores. There is actually one fruit market which is recently opened. They always have fresh fruits and nuts there.I love that place. They are all in walking distance to the beach.  

Is there a shower or bathroom ?

Yes, there is a shower and bathroom within walking distance.

I'm a beginner can i still join ? 

Definitely yes. We always have beginners in classes and in fact %40 of the people in classes are beginners. They are all encouraged to join the group and discover many benefits of yoga. Check out  group reviews

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/about/comments/?op=all 

I did yoga for a few times and it's been a while.Can i still catch up with the postures do you think?

Instructions during the classes are very clear and easy to follow. Even a small child can follow the class. No flexibility or strength needed.

What are the things we can do during those free times?

Anything you usually do at a beach. Sunbath, swimming, chatting, reading, being a kid again :) Group members are super positive and friendly people and you would feel very comfortable around them.

Can we also play games ?

Absolutely. We are open to all beach-games. Feel free to bring a frisbee or volleyball. Again, we are going to have a beautiful beach day. If you need to come late or leave early, that's OK, too.

Will there be a yoga mat for me ?

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 

***Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Cool, What should I bring with me ?

Your towel, yoga mat, picnic goodies :) maybe a book and your positivity :)

I'll be there for sure!

Great, we will see you there

Peace and Love!

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME EXPLORATORY SINGLE-TRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING AT LIPPMAN PARK.

Please arrive by 12:00pm at the Parking Area for Lippman Memorial Park to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 12:15am.

Length/Configuration: 14 mile network of interconnected loops.

Terrain/Surface: Flowing dirt singletrack through woods. Man-made features include log skinnies, raised boardwalks, bridges, jumps and bermed turns.

Technical Difficulty: All MTB skill levels from beginner to advanced

Elevation Change: About 1500 ft. of elevation gain over entire trail system. Some long climbs on individual trails.


GENERAL DESCRIPTION


Although relatively small in size, only 175 acres, Lippman Park makes optimal use of its open and woodland areas. It is owned and maintained by the Town of Warwarsing, NY for recreational use by the community. Active recreation activities include soccer, basketball, handball, softball, hiking and of course, mountain biking. There are also picnic areas, pavilions and a pond. With Minnewaska State Park and Mohonk Preserve less than 10 miles away, the Lippman Park mountain bike trail system provides riders with a great alternative to carriage roads and one of the best singletrack mountain biking venues in the Hudson Valley.

The Renegades Mountain Bike Club was instrumental in creating and building the Lippman Park mountain bike trails. From Doug Nikkila, a member of the Renegades MTB Club:

"Back in the summer of 2009 a group of us approached the Town of Wawarsing in Ulster County, NY with the concept of developing a network of singletrack trails in Lippman Park. Since last year, the Renegades has garnered a great bunch of very-involved individuals. This year alone we have put in over 1,300 hours to further the trail system. Our club maintains and builds all the trails through volunteer efforts in cooperation with the town of Wawarsing. The proceeds from our annual "Blue Groove" series of MTB races and events helps towards trail maintenance and development."

THE TRAILS


Lippman Park features over 12.5 miles of fast and flowy singletrack trails with added technical challenges including bermed turns, skinnies, bridges and raised boardwalks. The trail system is a work in progress with additional miles and more fun features being added and planned, including a 60-ft suspension bridge that will span a ravine. The trails are well maintained, hard-packed singletrack with some rocky and rooty sections. With 1500 ft. of elevation gain over the entire trail system, you can expect some long climbs on individual trails. Those that like to get some air under the tires will enjoy "The Viper", a small freeride trail. It's a great place to go mountain biking with kids and have fun while developing and sharpening your mountain biking skills.

Lippman Park offers an equal mix of beginner and intermediate trails with about 20 percent geared for advanced riders. For the most part, the trails weave through the woods, occassionally popping out into areas that offer a view. All the trails are marked with numbered 3 inch white discs and old bike frames indicate trail intersections. Bike helmets are required.

Distance: To be determined

Estimated Bike Time: 3 hours

Difficulty: Rated for Beginner to Advanced. You should probably be at least an Intermediate level rider to enjoy our trip.


Current Weather Forecast: Cloudy with a high of 81 degrees


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Buig Spray, Sunscreen, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

WHERE TO MEET?

Lippman Memorial Park


DIRECTIONS:

From NYS Thruway N and S: Take exit 18 New Paltz, Take Rt. 299 west thru New Paltz about 6 miles. At the intersection of Rt 44/55 turn right and travel about 10 miles to the junction of Rt 209. Turn left and travel approximately 2.5 miles to the entrance for Lippman Park on your right.

From Kingston: Take Rt 209 south and drive about 23 miles to the entrance for Lippman Park on the right.

From Rt 17: Take Rt. 209 north and drive about 16 miles to the entrance for Lippman Park on the left

RELATED MAPS:

Lippman Park Map

MORE INFO:

http://videotrailreviews.com/trails/2013/10/lippman-park-ny/

http://renegadesmtbcom.ipage.com/

http://www.bikekinetix.com/t_ny/ny_county/lippman_park_trails.php

results.description:
Fajing literally means to ‘emit strength’. In this school, we focus in ‘whole-body strength emission’. In the area of self-defense, this is of major importance, since one wants to hit an attacker as hard and as fast as possible, and incapacitate him/her within three seconds, in order to save our lives; while maintaining internal equanimity and control. However, most people respond to life-threatening attacks with only the strength of their arms or legs, as opposed to the strength of their whole bodies. Therefore, our responses to attacks are significantly hampered, and our chances of survival get drastically minimized.

Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Quan System of Fighting and Healing is the system of training created by Erle Montaigue, the founder of the World Taiji Boxing Association, in order to develop true whole-body fajing, the method of movement through which we engage every joint in our body in perfect coordination in an explosive manner, delivering full-body strikes into our opponent (think about how much you weigh, as opposed to only the weight of your arm or your leg). 

This desired response is achieved by accessing our reptilian brain, which has been sophisticated through one’s training, and operate from it in the event of an attack, as opposed to operate from our cerebral cortex/human brain, which processes information slower by trying to understand logically what is happening. Our reptilian brain acts only on reflexes, which are deeply engrained in our nervous system; so our training will come out just as another learnt reflex, like muscle memory.

This ability to fajing will be useful also in the healing arts, by emitting healing energy through the same method, in a soft, non-explosive way (Yin-Yang uses of a core, unique principle).

The training consist on:

- 8 Wudang Stepping Methods

- 12 Wudang Hand Weapons Drills

- Small San Sau Self-Defense Form

- One Hand Yang Style Martial Push Hands

- Entering Methods

- Internal and External Mechanics for Striking/Kicking/Punching

- Wudang Knife Forms

- Introduction to Dim Mak

results.description:
Ever Consider doing a GORUCK? 

I started a team for a GORUCK LIGHT on 8/8/15. There are other dates and different challenges available.  See GORUCK  Website: http://www.goruck.com/ for more details on different distances, events and dates.    

We will have free optional group trainings (all members of this meetup can attend the trainings) to prepare for the event.


Starting Point: Somewhere in Manhattan, to be announced at least one week before the event date. 

Prices start at:

$65 Until 4/10/2015,

$75 from 4/11/2015 to 6/9/2015

$85 after 6/9/2015

GORUCK LIGHT details:

Event duration 4-5 HOURS, event distance 7-10 MILES
Light = Fun on a team. Average completion rate: 100%.

Maybe you’re still not sure about GORUCK yet (what exactly is this, again?) but you want to do something because everyone tells you how great the people are and that it’s worth it. They’re right by the way and welcome to GORUCK Light. It means lighter vibe, lighter loads and less time commitment, which means more time to party with your class after you’re done.

Fun fact: never sign up and you’ll never know. But the average completion rate of those who show up is 100%. If you can do a 5K, you can earn the GORUCK Light patch.

WEIGHT REQUIREMENT
The weight in your rucksack aka backpack makes it rucking. The amount you carry is based on your weight:
Under 150 lbs. - 2 wrapped bricks or 10 lb. Filler Bag
150 lbs. and Over - 4 wrapped bricks or 20 lb. Filler Bag

Montclair Vegans events are a safe haven for vegans. Everyone is welcome, but if you are not vegan, please know that debating veganism is not allowed at our events. Conversely, vegans should not lecture omnivores on what they should or shouldn't be eating. Our events should be fun for everyone. Also be aware that while everyone is welcome at our potlucks, all food must be vegan, which means no meat, cheese, milk, eggs or honey.

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

http://www.google.com/aclk?sa=l&ai=CbT7Qq1BnVanSCc2ApgOT6oD4A5iQss0GiKiB6ZYB4KnK9qMCCAQQAigFYMnGqYvApNgPoAGYyIbYA8gBB6oEJE_QPn_0wVfREaUxHF1zc8Vdfo8WxmTOJWfipIg-LyMa3y2oksAFBaAGJoAH0Lf5J5AHAagHpr4bqAe...

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Sail Newport & Stay on board a Catamaran August 8th Weekend! Take your Sailing to the next level or simply relax and getaway...

Newport, Rhode Island & Narragansett Bay offer some of the best Sailing in the world, it's a great place to vacation! Sail past Sailboats & world famous Yachts then head out past historic Mansions. With a picturesque coastline, Newport offers an unparalleled experience for Anyone that loves to travel ... you do not have to be a Sailor to enjoy this trip!


'Learn to Sail' or just sit back & take in the stunning views! afterwards explore Newport by foot. Overnight & sleep on board a beautiful Catamaran ~

TO ONLY RSVP DOES NOT CONFIRM YOUR SPOT ON BOARD, PLEASE EMAIL YOUR NAME, PHONE # + PREFERRED ACCOMMODATIONS + $150 DEPOSIT REQUIRED WHEN BOOKING.


Itinerary: Saturday, August 8th, 2015 - Arrive in Newport by 12:30 PM


Come aboard & get ready to head out for an afternoon of Sailing 

This is your chance to get hands-on experience as you learn about Rigging, Trimming Sails, Tacks, Reaches & perhaps take the Helm!


Depending on the wind & weather, we hope to Sail for 3+ hours. The Captain will find a great spot to anchor & we'll enjoy a light afternoon Lunch on board 

Sail past Goats Island, Fort Adams, Castle Hill & Brentons Point. We'll keep a loose itinerary and run with the wind ~

After a great day of Sailing, we'll enjoy an evening on board or head out for a fun night in Newport! Admire Historic Houses in The Point, explore the shops on the Wharfs & along Thames Street.

Afterwards, we are back on the boat to share stories, stare at the stars and relax as the waves rock you to sleep!

Sunday: Everyone leaves the Catamaran by 11:00 AM. Feel free to stay & explore Newport on Sunday before heading back home.


DAY SAIL + Light Lunch - ONLY $99 - NO OVERNIGHT


Cost for Sailing + Accommodations + Light Lunch:

Aft Cabin is larger & sleeps 2 together  ~ reduced to $235 per person

2nd Cabin: Small Bunk only $199 or Larger Bunk only $255


Car Pool available or Mega Bus to Providence then local bus to Newport

Sheets & Towels, Basics Supplied. Checklist Details to follow.

Feel free to bring Food, Beverages, Wine ~


To RSVP email now!

Please Email your Name, # and whether you want to Day Sail only or which Accommodations you prefer to:  [masked]

$150 per person Deposit via Paypal to hold your Spot, balance due in full by July 24th. Sorry no Refunds if you cancel.


Join us for a fun weekend sailing! I hope you can make it ~ ~


Camille


  Beautiful Sailboats under Newport Bridge
results.name: LAST CALL - Sail + Stay on a Catamaran Saturday, Aug 8th, Newport, Rhode Island!

group.name: New York Social Sail + Fun Getaways

results.description:
Thinking a quick in and out on the Appalachian Trail this weekend.

We can meet at the AT/road crossing at Rte 17A and hike into Wildcat Shelter, make camp, enjoy a late night campfire and generally enjoy the peace and quiet.

If we're lucky we might cross paths with some AT thru-hikers*.

*I'll likely take with me a small bag of supplies for the thru'ers like hand sannie, baby wipes, sun screen, etc - it's always appreciated.
results.name: Quick & Easy Overnight on the AT: Wildcat Shelter

results.description:
Agora Taverna is located in the heart of Forest Hills serving Greek fare & seafood in white surroundings with a Mediterranean feel & a cozy bar.  Ingredients are fresh and seafood and meat are brought in daily.

On Saturday, they offer a prix-fixe brunch for $15.95.

Brunch includes a Complimentary bellini, bloody mary, mimosa, sparkling wine OR juice: orange, grapefruit, tomato, cranberry, or apple.

Coffee or tea is included as well.


For brunch there is a wide selection of standard brunch options including egg dishes, waffles and french toast.

You may also choose from paninis, sandwiches, burgers and salads.


***All eggs, omelets, sandwiches and burgers are served with home fries and field greens.

http://www.agorataverna.com/index.php?cat=3#menus


Agora Taverna                                                                                                                      70-09 Austin Street                                                                                                        (718)[masked]

*Restaurant is across the street from Barnes & Noble bookstore


*** PLEASE BRING SMALL BILLS  (1's, 5's, 10's) TO LUNCH (cash only) so we can pay easily and quickly.

***I will request 3 checks with 5 ladies on a check.

***You only pay for what you eat and drink + tax + tip.

(Prix-fixe brunch for $15.95+ tax + tip + whatever else you order)


--------------------------------------------------------------


After lunch, we can stroll through Forest Hills Gardens, where you feel like you are away from it all, and check out the wonderful architecture and beautiful homes. 

We can also check out the mom and pop shops on Austin Street, grab a cool bubble tea or a delicious dessert at Martha's Country Bakery or at La Patisserie.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

SUBWAY

***Please check mta.info/weekender for updates/changes PRIOR to Saturday


E/F/R train to 71st & Continental Ave in Forest Hills (Get out on the SOUTH Side of Queens Blvd). Walk one block to Austin Street.


LIRR to Forest Hills Station.  Walk one block to Austin Street.


Bus: Q60 Bus to 71st & Continental Ave. Walk one block to Austin Street.



Parking: Driving on a Saturday in not recommended since parking is difficult. The restaurant is near Forest Hills Gardens.  You are NOT allowed to park in the Gardens without a permit.  If you see GREEN PARKING SIGNS it means the streets are private.  If the 'booters' catch you, they will put a lock on your tires and you will have to pay them $125 Cash to remove it.

***Only park on PUBLIC streets (with WHITE parking signs), preferably on the other side of Queens Blvd  (North Side).


Meetup Fee: $2.00 to help defray the cost of maintaining the group. (Exact Change Please)



Perfume Allergy:  No perfume please. Thank you for understanding.
results.name: Let's do Greek at Agora Taverna - Forest Hills

results.description:
Let's meet in Sunset Park for authentic Mexican food.  Tacos Matamoros serves a wonderful menu of tacos, burritos, enchiladas, as well as entrees, soups, salads and fruit juice drinks.  Prices are very reasonable and the restaurant is casual and clean.


Located on 5th Avenue, one block from the R train subway stop and just under the hill of Sunset Park.

View pics on their Yelp page
results.name: Lunch at Tacos Matamoros

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Level 2 class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

Anyone and everyone is welcome! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of tv production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."
results.name: Intro to Improv [LEVEL 1]

results.description:
You're invited to Broadway's most uproarious family affair, as two very different families come together for a wedding no one will soon forget!

YOU'L LAUGH. YOU'LL CRY. YOU'LL BE HOME EARLY.

The families of the bride and groom square off in a wedding nightmare. With tempers flaring, secrets getting exposed and cultures clashing, it’s hard to believe that love will conquer all in this hilarious, feel-good production that you, your family & friends are going to love!

_________________________________________________

PAY $82.00 NOW, TO RESERVE YOUR SEATS! Payment must be made in advance and is DUE BY JULY 4th. PAY VIA PAYPAL or PAY ME DIRECTLY at an Upcoming Event. **PLEASE NOTE: A $3.00 Meetup Fee is being added, to help with Meetup Costs. If you Pay for the tickets, you are agreeing to this small charge. (Meetup is NOT FREE, THERE IS A COST Involved for me which I have been paying all along.)** Thank you for helping :-)

Go to: <a>www.paypal.com,</a> use the FRIENDS & FAMILY PAYMENT LINK & Send $82.00 to My Email which is: [masked] and then click on SUBMIT, below.

If you need help you can call me at[masked] b/w 9-10 PM on weekdays, or anytime over the weekend and I'll walk you through it. I need your phone # sent to me if I don't have it so we can keep in touch about the show.

We need at least 12 People to PREPAY, to get this Group Rate! Once we reach that amount I will email the group to let you know. If we fall short, your money will be refunded or applied towards an alternate date.
__________________________________________________ COST: $82 per ticket;The seats are in FULL VIEW of the Performance. SEATING: FRONT MEZZANINE SECTION--We should be seated back to back. SHOW BEGINS: 2:00 PM, We must arrive by 1:30 PM.

Your payment will be a 'commitment' that you will be attending. NO REFUNDS: ONLY IF you find someone else to take your place or if we fall short (read above.) MEETING PLACE: At Penn Station in NYC, in front of the Ladies Bathroom around the corner from the INFO BOOTH. My Cell # is[masked]--Pam.

The Show Ends at 3:45 pm--You can then go home if you wish or stay with us to eat dinner out in NYC. More info will be posted as it gets closer to this date!

venue.name: Skudin Surf School at Rockaway Beach

results.description:
Let's go to Rockaway Surfing School to learn surfing. This time we will have 1.5 hours training session to make sure everyone has enough surfing practice.

For the longest time you've been promising yourself, "This is the year I'm going to learn how to surf!" Well here you are about to make that dream come true! Rockaway Beach is about 50 minutes by subway from most parts of New York City, and taking surfing lessons in New York is one of New York's best kept secrets! Keep that promise to yourself and cruise out to laid back Rockaway Beach!! And to everybody else who may have taken a lesson in Hawaii, Costa Rica, California and has caught the surfing bug, you need to get out here and surf in your own hometown! Surfing is a blast, however if you are brand new, we really recommend a lesson or two. That should be enough to get you comfortable with the ocean, give you a feel for what type of board will be best for you, best places for new surfers to practice, purchase equipment etc...

Date/Time: August 8th Saturday; Lesson from 1:30 PM to 3 PM (Please arrive 30 minutes earlier)

Cost: Early Birds $60 for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $70 afterward.

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug082015rockawaysurfing.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Includes: 1.5 hours surfing lesson, board rental, rash guard & wet suits (if necessary).

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, clothes to change, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15 (All 15 surf boards reserved for our group)

Additional Info: 3 to 1 student to instructor ratio.

Refund Policy:
* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund is cancelled 7 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show afterward; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

Transportation:
We can take subway there. Check the direction below.

DIRECTIONS 

Subway: Take the Far Rockaway A train straight to the spot. Note: don't take train to Leffers Blv. You can get off at Beach 60th Street. 
A Train: Link

Google Maps: Link

More Info: Skudin Surf School at Rockaway Beach

Pictures from the previous events
2011: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/2978211/
2012: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/9730972/
2013: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/16095542/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24252362/

Videos from the Previous Events

2011 Surfing Demo: http://youtu.be/zqE3Jnn6_gw

http://youtu.be/zqE3Jnn6_gw

2012 the Last Surf: http://youtu.be/LpiS_4yKgYU

2013 Learn to Surf: http://youtu.be/haHnLwYnbPA

http://youtu.be/haHnLwYnbPA

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
Meetup at a table by the Bryant Park Fountain at 1PM.  Look for me at the table with the blue/white checkered table cloth.  (In case of inclement weather, meetup inside "Pax Wholesome Foods" [corner of 40th St./6th Ave]). Thank you.  http://www.yelp.com/biz/pax-wholesome-foods-new-york-5

Host:  "Manhattan Lectures & Conversations" 

http://www.meetup.com/Manhattan-Lectures-Conversations/events/224152075/ 

************

"How can we discern what is truly wise? 

What are the essential elements for us to discern what is truly wise?

Join us for food, drinks, and discussion. 
Bring your collective wisdom. 
--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Purpose: Work out some practical rules on to how to discern what is truly wise for every life.

Wisdom - http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/wisdom/ 
 Wisdom (sophia) is the ability to think and act using knowledge, experience, understanding, common sense, and insight...as a virtue, it is a habit or disposition to perform the action with the highest degree of adequacy under any given circumstance. 
Reference: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisdom

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY


Agenda  
1:00 - Meetup in Bryant Park by the Fountain.

1:15 - Formal Introductions (1 min each)

1:30   - Together derive a working definition of what is "wise?" What are the key elements? 

1:45  - Together work out rules for "How can we discern what is truly wise?" and test them. 

3:15  - Final Comments

3:30 - Formal end.  Feel free to continue the conversation with the friends you've made.  

(Note - Kindly arrive earlier if you wish to buy food or drinks from the local establishments.)

Suggestions 

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Note – Manhattan Lectures & Conversations (MLC) neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls MLC meetings, and we have no special relationship with the individuals who participate in programs listed in our calendars.  Therefore, please exercise good judgment when attending events.

Note particularly that MLC events are NOT a forum for dating, for employees or independent contractors to introduce, promote, or sell goods and/or services, for organizing social/political action such as demonstrations, rallies, or partisan political campaigns, or for any unlawful activity.  MLC meeting calendars are for posting events located in public areas only.

MLC  hosts, partners, and members are responsible for their own content. They cannot use MLC‘s platform to email (or solicit) members on matters outside of their own specific conversation meetup without prior approval from the MLC Organizer, (of course, logistical details such venue change or date change do not require prior approval).  MLC hosts, partners, and members cannot speak for MLC or commit MLC to any obligations.

Participants are:

– expected to honor other people’s stated boundaries and respect their privacy

– not obligated to provide information or answer any questions against their will

– encouraged to share only information they feel comfortable with sharing

– expected to maintain confidentiality and not reshare personal information without permission from the owner.

– responsible for resolving their own disputes and conflicts as private individuals and not involve MLC, or any non-parties.  

- in agreement with the above terms by attending.


About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and a former educator & examiner from the private and public sector.  Specifically, Yen is a graduate of the U.S. Air Force Academy.  He is a physics major who worked on a SDI project before becoming a Navigator in aviation and operations management with the US Air Force.  After 9/11, Yen planned, trained, executed, and evaluated military operations protecting the National Capital Region and the President to ensure continuation of the government during crisis.  Currently, the Yen is around $[masked] dollar.  :D

results.description:
Let's go to Rockaway Surfing School to learn surfing. This time we will have 2 hours training session to make sure everyone has enough surfing practice.

For the longest time you've been promising yourself, "This is the year I'm going to learn how to surf!" Well here you are about to make that dream come true! Rockaway Beach is about 50 minutes by subway from most parts of New York City, and taking surfing lessons in New York is one of New York's best kept secrets! Keep that promise to yourself and cruise out to laid back Rockaway Beach!! And to everybody else who may have taken a lesson in Hawaii, Costa Rica, California and has caught the surfing bug, you need to get out here and surf in your own hometown! Surfing is a blast, however if you are brand new, we really recommend a lesson or two. That should be enough to get you comfortable with the ocean, give you a feel for what type of board will be best for you, best places for new surfers to practice, purchase equipment etc...

Date/Time: August 8th Saturday; Lesson from 1:30 PM to 3 PM (Please arrive 30 minutes earlier)

Cost: Early Birds $60 for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $70 afterward.

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug082015rockawaysurfing.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Includes: 1.5 hours surfing lesson, board rental, rash guard & wet suits (if necessary).

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, clothes to change, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15 (All 15 surf boards reserved for our group)

Additional Info: 3 to 1 student to instructor ratio.

Refund Policy:
* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund is cancelled 7 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show afterward; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

Transportation (Note location has been changed a bit):

We can take subway there. Check the direction below.

DIRECTIONS 

Subway: Take the Far Rockaway A train straight to the spot. Note: don't take train to Leffers Blv. You can get off at Beach 60th Street. 
A Train: Link

Google Maps: Link

More Info: Skudin Surf School at Rockaway Beach

Pictures from the previous events
2011: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/2978211/
2012: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/9730972/
2013: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/16095542/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24252362/

Videos from the Previous Events

2011 Surfing Demo: http://youtu.be/zqE3Jnn6_gw

http://youtu.be/zqE3Jnn6_gw

2012 the Last Surf: http://youtu.be/LpiS_4yKgYU

2013 Learn to Surf: http://youtu.be/haHnLwYnbPA

http://youtu.be/haHnLwYnbPA

results.description:
Greetings everyone, it's time for our third major Meetup!  First of all, thank you to all who attended our past "Werewolf In the Park" events, they've been great!  For everyone else, it's never to late to get in on the fun -come one, come all, and tell your friends as well.


On Saturday, August 8th, we'll be returning to the event that is not unfamiliar to some of our members: Ultimate Werewolf in Fort Tryon Park. Ultimate Werewolf is a social game in which players are randomly assigned to one of two (or possibly more) teams: the villagers or the werewolves. The villagers must deduce who the werewolves are over a series of rounds using various techniques and social intrigue; this must be done before the werewolves are able to eliminate the villagers. For those of you who are unfamiliar with Ultimate Werewolf, check out Tom Vasel's review at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kr1ZyYycUdQ


Ultimate Werewolf is the perfect game to play in an outdoor setting; just bring a folding chair or a picnic blanket and you're ready to go! All you need is the game (which I will supply) and the willingness to communicate with others. We will also be bringing food and beverages in order to picnic throughout the day, so if that aspect of this event interests you, please bring something to pass (though participating in the picnic is not a requirement for this event). Also, if you do not know how to play Ultimate Werewolf, never fear, it is quite simple and several of us will be able to teach it to you within minutes; don't let that hold you back! We'll be meeting in Fort Tryon park, just north of Linden Terrace. Follow this link for a map:

Fort Tryon Map

We will be in the area indicated by the "meeple". Fort Tryon Park's entrance is located on the elevated street level at the 190th street station on the A-train. We hope to see you there! Message me if you need more information. Beginners and experts welcome; even if you're not sure if you want to play, stop by to observe and introduce yourself!

------------------------------------------------------------------

If you're interested Uptown Gamer Shirts are $20
results.how_to_find_us: Take the A train to 190th Street and enter Fort Tryon Park at Margaret Corbin Circle.  Walk past Heather Garden and through Linden Terrace; we will be immediately North of Linden Terrace (see link to map in details).
results.name: Werewolf In the Park III!

results.description:
We're back for year 3 — of our successful summer workshop series!

Sustainable Flatbush and Sacred Vibes Apothecary team up once again to present FREE community workshops on the use of herbs for health and wellness.

Join apprentices Brigitte and Melissa in our new location Q Gardens, for a special workshop on oral health — Pantry Potions for a Happy Healthy Mouth.

This workshop will focus on oral/dental care using common household herbs and spices. We will make an herbal mouthwash together that you can take home, along with a tooth powder, and a handout with additional recipes.

To RSVP, or for more information, please email: [masked]

______________________________________________________

In many of our workshops we spend time making different herbal preparations such as teas, tinctures, oils, and syrups. If you would like to bring some home with you, please bring a clean 2 oz. baby food jar. If you have more than 1 jar, bring some to share!

It is important to us that our workshops are as accessible as possible. Our outdoor workshops are held in a space with no steps or stairs, however not all walkways are paved. Please contact Kate, If you have any accessibility concerns or needs.

See you in the garden!!!
results.name: Sustainable Flatbush Healing Herb Garden Workshop:  A Happy Healthy Mouth

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
Rosicrucian Principles or “The Facts of Life” from a Rosicrucian Perspective

An Introduction to Key Concepts in the Rosicrucian Teachings

There are many sources of wisdom when we are on the spiritual path. The Rosicrucian teachings, the Holy Books of the major religions, the writings of illumined individuals, poetry, art and many other sources all can serve as important guides. Life also presents each individual with a personalized guide for her or his spiritual development. Life's wisdom is perfectly timed and the exact fit for our stage of evolution. Through this series we will explore how to discern Life's unique wisdom for each of us and how to utilize it to speed our spiritual evolution. 

Julian Johnson has been a member of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC for more than four decades. As a member, Julian has served as a Heptad Master, Regional Monitor, Grand Councilor and Provincial Master in the New York area. Currently, he serves as Treasurer of the Board of Directors for the English Grand Lodge of AMORC. Julian is a senior executive with an educational non-profit organization based in New York City and holds master’s degrees in non-profit management and developmental psychology. He has special interest in the interrelation between mysticism, science and psychology.
results.name: "The Facts of Life” from a Rosicrucian Perspective with Julian Johnson

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. results.description:
Come and join us to see the new movie with Meryl Streep, "Ricki and the Flash" after the movie, we'll go somewhere close by to eat

Ricki and the Flash is the ultimate girl-power flick: It stars Meryl Streep flawlessly rocking out onstage (and getting yelled at by her real-life daughter actress Mamie Gummer), it'll make you actually, you know, want to call your mom, and it's got a kickass feminist message thanks to its kickass feminist screenwriter Diablo Cody. 

Ricki And The Flash - Official Trailer with Meryl Streep - 8/7 ...▶ 2:32www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8PVK6Hky2AMay 6, 2015 - Uploaded by Sony Pictures EntertainmentGet Ready to Roll. Get Ready for Ricki! Watch and share the brand new trailer for Ricki And the Flash which ...

Meryl Streep Singing the Blues in 'Ricki and the Flash' Won't Leaving You Feeling Blue

Kindly pay the $3.00 event fee to Paypal before you RSVP - 
this is to maintain the Meetup site, printing costs,  & group costs, Thank you. If you don't have Paypal, just scroll down to the prompt and pay with a credit or debit card.

We will meet in the lobby at the customer courtesy desk on the left side of the lobby, I'll have a sign & a big smile at 1:45pm and we will wait until 2:00pm.  The movie starts at 2:15pm.  You can purchase your ticket ahead of time online at Fandango.  We're looking forward to seeing everyone.  After the movie we are going to a nice place around the corner that serves a variety of food.

by Rosalyn Oshmyansky  1:15 PM PDT, July 24, 2015 Sony Pictures

We're calling it now. It's time to give Meryl Streep another Oscar.

In this new clip from her upcoming film, Ricki and the Flash, the three-time Academy Award winner sings her heart out on the song, "Cold One," all while strumming on an acoustic guitar.

Streep, 66, plays the part of washed-up rocker Ricki, who returns home after leaving her family behind in pursuit of stardom when her daughter Julie—played by Streep's real-life daughter Mamie Grummer—is heartbroken after her husband leaves her for another woman.

In a comforting scene, we see Ricki sing the blues track to her ex-husband Pete Brummel, played by Kevin Kline, and Julie. The song was written for the film by Jenny Lewis and Johnathan Rice, and Streep's voice sounds absolutely beautiful.

WATCH: Meryl Streep's Daughters Look Amazing In New Fashion Campaign

For Streep, this film wasn't only about the singing (we all knew she could from Mama Mia! and Into the Woods), but it presented her with the challenge of learning the guitar. The film's director, Jonathan Demme, shared with Yahoo Movies, "Meryl has told me that from the time she was a kid, she at the age of seven found herself in front of a radio loving electric guitar and rock 'n roll. She has lived as this kind-of wannabe guitar beast, and this part gave her the opportunity to actually do that." 

WATCH: Meryl Streep Rocks Out With Rick Springfield 

The role also gave Meryl the opportunity to share the screen with her daughter for the first time since 1986's Heartburn, when Grummer was just 20 months old.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby with a Great Girlfriends sign and a big smile:D
results.name: Come & see "Ricki and the Flash" with Meryl Streep - Saturday, August 8th

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, August 8th, from 2:00-3:30 pm for our special workshop on a Immunity Boost: Energize Your Immune System. The event is FREE, so bring your family and friends!

We will explore exercises to boost your immune system; as well as, share tips for incorporating the Solar Body Method for your health, happiness, and peace. 

Why healthier together? 'Together' means the unity of body & brain, individuals and community, and people and the planet. By integrating togetherness into our life, let's create healthier lives, together!
results.how_to_find_us: We are above Prima. There is a parking lot on Cook Ave as well as on-street on Main.
results.name: Healthier Together: Immune Boost

results.description:
We had over 80 members attend our last Scavenger Hunt! It's a lot of fun!

The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL New York. A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package.

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*PURCHASE TICKETS HERE ($25) - <a>https://fareharbor.com/pogoevents/items/5693/availability/5010751/book//?asn=meetupnyc</a>; 

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for a day of walking.  Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will end up all around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP here - <a>https://fareharbor.com/pogoevents/items/5693/availability/5010751/book//?asn=meetupnyc</a>;
results.name: The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

group.name: ! A Fun & Adventures With Strangers - New York

results.description:
Hey all. This month, we're reading Leviathan Wakes by James S.A. Corey. 

Leviathan Wakes is James S. A. Corey's first novel in the epic series the Expanse, a modern masterwork of science fiction where humanity has colonized the solar system.

Two hundred years after migrating into space, mankind is in turmoil. When a reluctant ship's captain and washed-up detective find themselves involved in the case of a missing girl, what they discover brings our solar system to the brink of civil war, and exposes the greatest conspiracy in human history.

Enjoy the book! Hope to see you all there!
results.name: Leviathan Wakes by James S.A. Corey

This is a musical based on historical events, featuring music from the team that created "In the Heights". It starts previews on Broadway July 13th, so let's shoot for the first Saturday matinee on the 18th.  Date is flexible though, if there's a date more people are available. We can catch dinner and talk about the show after.

The details: tickets are $76.95 including fees for the cheapest seats, and we'll have to order in advance.  I'm putting a required deposit of $50.00 for RSVPs, and we can arrange payments for the remainder based on if we want to get better seats or if the price changes. Please RSVP as soon as possible.

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE THE CHANGE IN VENUE. We'll be meeting in a private room at the Grand Central Library on 46th Street. Thanks to David Geshwind for helping secure the space.

Four pieces are presently available for our next meeting on Saturday, August 8. The pieces are available on the File section of the Meetup site. This link will get you there. Note that you have to be logged in or the files won't show. They are, in no particular order:

- "The Pie" by Judith Akullian

- An excerpt of "The Time Stone" by Jeffrey Estrella

- An excerpt from "The Strickland File" by Jeffrey Baer

- Two chapters from "Time Hackers" by Devin Cole

Please read these pieces in advance and be prepared to discuss them at the meeting. If you have any trouble accessing the files, please let me know and I can email them to you.
