results.description:
Location: 11th floor


The purpose of the event is to provide a common space to work on, help, and be helped by fellow coders on any topic or technology that is Javascript related. It will take place concurrently with the Saturday NYC Python Study Group in an adjacent area, and there will be ample opportunity for cross pollination between the two groups. **Note that ID is required at the door when checking in for the event with security**

More info about the Python study group: 
http://www.meetup.com/learn-python-nyc/events/mksjflytfblc
results.how_to_find_us: Sign in with security, head up to the 11th floor, walk through the heavy brown door, and go to the Deerbrook conference room
results.name: Study Group: Work on individual projects and help each other code

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.
results.name: American Meditation Society - Weekly Saturday Meetup in White Plains
Saturday Open Play 4s, all levels welcome!

results.description:
EXPERIENCE THE POWER WITHIN YOU!


Take A Hypnotic Trance Session with Qesankh Maa Kheperu

Change Your Life Forever!

Many of us face challenges in our lives. These challenges come in many forms and what is a challenge for one is not an issue for another. So everyone is unique and comes with their own set of experiences. But there are universal issues that we all face.  The principal ones are money, love, weight, health, and career. We are raised to believe that the way to face these challenges is through hard work and a little knowledge. But nothing could be further from the truth. This is because success is not a set formula that anyone can follow. Everyone must take their own path to getting what they want and there is no one-size-fits-all template to success.

Yet one thing is clear. Many go their entire lives working hard, waiting for their ships to come in yet with no or limited success.  Even worse, some seem to be magnets for money and success in life without putting in a hard day’s work.  But why? Is the universe unfair? On the contrary, there is rhyme and reason to the madness. First off, you must understand that to overcome challenges in your life you have to get right to the source. Unfortunately, our society is caught up in verbal trickery. What I mean by that is that many come along with PHDs at the end of their names and try to address your issues through a verbal discourse in the hope that through deductive reasoning you will come to an understanding of what is the root cause of your plight. Millions of dollars are spent on this type of discredited Freudian treatment.

But how many have been told to stop smoking, stop over-eating, stop taking drugs, stop dating that selfish person, yet they continue to do so knowing full well that what awaits them is likely to be pain and suffering. This is because verbal communication cannot change behavior no matter how passionate you are. How many preachers and ministers whose faith seems unbreakable are caught with their pants down in some type of indiscretion?

Let us examine slavery for example. Many of the chief architects of this horrible atrocity were Christians, Muslims and Catholics. But if they were holy men and women how could they have endorsed the capture and enslavement of an entire continent of people? This is because their religions relied on sermons and verbal language through scriptures as a means to try and spiritually uplift people. This simply does not work. Our ancient ancestors knew this simple truth. This is why most indigenous cultures practiced meditation and trance induction as a means to communicate directly with the subconscious mind, which is the seat of your power.  Now many are turning to hypnotherapy to control their weight, stop smoking or drug-taking, and to relieve pain from surgery or relationships.  These therapists and patients have finally realized that the power to effect change lies not in the conscious mind but rather the subconscious mind. We must realize that the conscious mind can only execute what the subconscious mind directs it to.  The effectiveness of this type of treatment has been proven in many scientific papers and studies. Yet still to this day many are unaware of the success rate of techniques such as hypnotherapy and trance induction. This is because those in control, the global elite, have imprisoned our minds in left brain externalized thinking.

HYPNOTHERAPY MADE A TERRIBLE MISTAKE


Although it’s on the cutting edge of mind therapy, hypnotherapists have made a critical error. They have treated the subconscious mind like a computer. Their psychology being what you put in is what you get out. This is untrue and demonstrates a true gap in their understanding of men and women. It was our ancient so-called primitive ancestors who referred to the subconscious mind as “the spirit” or “the indwelling intelligence”.  They knew early on that the subconscious was consciousness and was intelligent. Hence it is omnipresent and omniscient.  This indwelling intelligence doesn’t just serve to direct the conscious mind based on commands you program into it, this intelligence is responsible for everything that happens to you in the physical world. It creates the very reality you see before you.

This means it plays an active role in your life and is not just relegated to dreams, nightmares and subconscious thoughts and traumas. It is what some in the new age movement call your higher mind. It is all-knowing and connected to everything we experience.  If fact, there really is only one consciousness that we all share.  But we erroneously believe there is a division within consciousness. There is only division within our physical bodies, which separate us on this planet.

Treating the indwelling intelligence within you like a dumb computer that can only be programmed to accomplish the task it is given is to severely limit the power it can accomplish for you. Yes, it’s true you must either program it or command it to perform a task but because it is a super-intelligence it is one thousand steps ahead of your perception. In fact, when you are born it is already aware of your destiny and aligns circumstance to allow you to fulfill the objective of your new incarnation. If you do not program it, it will proceed on its own and lay the foundations for either your success or failure.  But in reality there is no failure, only experience, so what appears to you as a futile attempt is a great experience for the intelligence within. Remember, its goal is to experience reality based on the destiny you have agreed to prior to coming to this physical plane of existence.  So as it sees it there are no good or bad experiences, only information to help it grow in understanding. But this is a discussion for another time; for now we want to focus on empowering you.

YOUR SUFFERING IS A NEEDLESS ACT


We are taught that suffering is a natural part of life. In essence, no pain no gain. That we have to go through emotional ups and downs, pain and pleasure.  In most cases when adversities befall those who have tried to live a righteous life we are told that God will right the wrong done in his own time. Yet, we are never told the entire truth; that pain and pleasure are emotional states that can be triggered at will.  We simply, as a society, are ignorant of the fact that we, not some outside entity, have the ability to remove any physical or emotional pain troubling us. And also, that if needed we can summon such pleasure that it surpasses that of any drug.  These are techniques that can be learned by anyone!

Let’s look at the implications here so we can see a real picture of how society has screwed up our thinking and belief system:

·  A young man becomes addicted to drugs. His addiction causes him to lose his job, friends and the love of family members. He takes to stealing to support his habit. The urge for cocaine is so strong that he simply cannot resist it. In our society he is labeled a drug addict and ostracized. If he is lucky and not arrested for carrying the drugs he may go into a good and expensive treatment center, where they will talk him through a 12 step program.

·  A young woman suffers from poor grades in school. She tries just as hard as everyone else but can’t seem to keep up. Many of the subjects she studies are very intense such as biomechanics requiring many hours of study and research. She fails her final term paper and is forced to repeat the class. If she decides to seek help they will assign her a study buddy who will spend countless hours with her in the library coaching her through the dense material.  Her career is on the line and she must somehow pass this class while not neglecting her other classes.

·  A young man is motivated to start his own business. So he pays thousands of dollars to attend motivational seminars, business lectures and purchases all kinds of at-home programs on how to get rich. Yet, hard as he tries each business is a dismal failure.  He becomes more and more disenchanted. He watches TV or the internet and sees the success others are having and comes to the conclusion that he is just a failure in life.  Once more he dreams of meeting big investors who will fund his business. But he knows he has no such contacts in his Rolodex. He gets a regular 9 to 5 and calls it a life.

·  A man is physically abusive to his wife and daughter. He seeks help to manage his temper and the psychologist traces it back to when he was a child. They discover that he was physically abused by his father and neglected by his mother. In fact, as a child he was sent to the hospital a number of times for broken bones and open wounds inflicted by the violence. The psychologist uses talk therapy to help him realize the origin and resolution to his difficulties. But the man still has occasions or bouts of anger so he takes it one day at a time.

·  A violin player finds herself spending countless hours and thousands of dollars on training. She enjoys the music and the instrument. Through the tried and true practice of repetition she practices the same songs and notes over and over again until she has blisters on her fingers. She even forks over her life savings to hire one of the best violin coaches in the country. She dreams of being in the London Symphony Orchestra or perhaps being solo as a world-renowned player. But she knows full well that it may take years for her to get to master the instrument. And worse, she may discover that she just doesn’t have the talent for it and will have to make a decision to move on with her life. She fears being a housewife or working for corporate America. But the truth is the odds are not in her favor given the current paradigm of society and its failure on how to teach people to awaken their inborn talents. 

·  An aspiring actress looking for her big break attends casting call after casting call but doesn’t land that big role. She pays for acting classes and attends seminars on how to make it in Hollywood. She even moves to California and gets a job as a waitress so that she can have flexible hours and attend her auditions.  But the years pass and yet still no roles. Even worse with each audition she attends she is told she is not the right type. She is too old, too fat, too skinny, too short, too tall, too blonde, too ethnic looking, etc. All of this rejection takes a toll on her mindset. Where she was once a positive individual with hopes of movie fame she now realizes that success in acting eludes her. She gives up and gets a regular job, family and settles down to a normal life.

·  An attractive woman is plagued by relationship issues. She dates different guys looking for her soul mate but there seems to be no chemistry with these men.  Even worse, the guys are jerks, self centered and egotistical. She desires someone to compliment her and daydreams of the perfect mate and children. She realizes that her clock is ticking but there seems to be little that she can do. The club and bar scene is unrewarding as it only results in guys looking for one night stands. So too is the internet. She tries dating sites but the guys hype up their profile and are just looking for one thing. She has even prayed to God to help find her a good man but to no avail. She ends up becoming bitter and disenchanted. Finally, she adopts the belief that love is a myth.

·  A martial artist puts in hundred of hours of practice. She loves to spar and often travels the country competing in competitions. But she has reached a plateau and can’t seem to advance to the next level.  So she increases her efforts but can’t seem to perfect her kicks or her form. She looks around at other martial artists who perform their fights with ease, never forgetting one step. She notes that they are bigger and stronger than her and wonders if she’ll ever be at their skill level. She knows in her heart she has the fire of a lioness but something is holding her back.  Her 5th degree instructor just yells at her telling her to push, push, push! But the more she pushes herself the fewer results she sees. So she resigns herself to the fact that she just doesn’t have the natural ability that other martial artists possess.

·  A young woman finds herself in a terrible position. Everything she eats no matter how little increases her weight. She looks in the mirror and realizes she is severely overweight. However, she can’t stop eating. So in an attempt to handle the situation she tries several fad diets. At first she loses some weight, which makes her feel good. However, in almost no time she regains the weight again and her self-image and self-confidence plummet. Even worse she realizes that when she goes out with her girlfriends guys no longer approach her. She tries diet pills but they don’t work either. Finally, she takes out a gym membership but finds it hard to make the time to go to the gym after work. She knows that being overweight is a health risk but she feels there is nothing she can do. She wants to accept the notion that big is beautiful and accept her full-figured self. However, she often spends Friday and Saturday night at home in deep depression.

As you can clearly see all of the case studies above have two things in common: the reliance on verbal communication to get a person to change his or her behavior, and the dependence on physical means to address their problems. If one were to examine the statistics we would see that such treatments are a dismal failure. But then one may ask why is it that some people have effectively quit smoking, shed weight or stopped drinking? Is this not proof that verbal talk does work?  No, this is because the emotion and desire to change in those individuals penetrated the conscious mind and tapped directly into the subconscious mind effecting true change thus manifesting their desires.  But not everyone has the knowledge to be able to do this nor are people aware enough to be able to reproduce the formula or effects. In religious circles this change is often mislabeled as being born again or God saved me. In secular circles it is attributed to a person’s own drive to change all the while never realizing that the change came after they bypassed the conscious mind to communicate and commanded the subconscious mind to make the radical transformation.  What folks failed to realize is that the power was always within them and the reliance on outside entities such as pills, gurus and books only served to make things more difficult.

Now what I am advocating here is by no means a quick fix. But it is a lot easier than spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars trying to overcome a bad habit, emotional issue or learn something new. What we teach is so powerfully effective that you will notice the results overnight. We’re talking about giving you not only the ability to overcome what is currently challenging you but to empower you with the ability to succeed in any aspect of your life.

YOU’LL HAVE THE POWER


And do not forget that the net result of your efforts is not just the impregnation of information but the ability to tap into an awesome power that can align the forces of physical reality at your command. This is God’s true blessing and the reason why you don’t have to continually beg him for the things you need in life. He has given you the power to get them and more. Imagine if you will having the power to reshape the world to give you the things you need. This is why our approach is so different.

In this extraordinary program you will be taken into trance induction where we will remove any block, emotional fears, addictions, and provide you with powerful suggestions to get better grades or excel in your chosen career or sport.  Lastly you will learn how to perform miracles through synchronicity by attracting all the things you want in life. So powerful is this technique that you will never look at reality in the same way again. Stop trying to achieve your ambitions by physical means alone: let us show you a new world and reality where magic happens. Sign up for a free session to experience your power within!

Qesankh Maa Kheperu is known throughout the country. Here is what his technique can do for you:

·  Help you to overcome any bad habit

·  Eliminate addictions of all kinds

·  Overcome emotional trauma

·  Eliminate everyday stress

But that’s not all. Because your spirit is all power and connected to everyone and everything, Master Teacher Qesankh Maa Kheperu will work with you to tap into your power to accomplish the following:

·  Through synchronicity align circumstances to be at the right place at the right time

·  Miraculously attract resources for your business or personal life

·  Help you to discover you destiny

Experience the power within! Call for an appointment today:[masked]

results.description:
Let's check out The Cloisters on a summer day! I hear it's really nice there so there should be great photo opps!! We may grab lunch after.


What is it?
"The Cloisters museum and gardens, the branch of The Metropolitan Museum of Art devoted to the art and architecture of medieval Europe, was assembled from architectural elements, both domestic and religious, that largely date from the twelfth through the fifteenth century.

The building and its cloistered gardens—located in Fort Tryon Park in northern Manhattan—are treasures in themselves, effectively part of the collection housed there. The Cloisters' collection comprises approximately two thousand works of art."

Adults $25
Students $12
Met Museum Members -Free
Children under 12 (with an adult)- Free

Open Painting Meet-Up focuses on having a setting conducive to exploring your creative side through painting. We primarily meet in group organizer/artist Thomas Legaspi's Art Studio/School where artists can come and paint bathed in North Light from a wall of windows.  This Particular Beginners Open Paint focuses on painting for the first time and for those who want a basic training session. 

There are easels, slop sinks, painting racks, clean-up supplies, solvents, and soaps, provided. Artists should supply their own materials such as paints, brushes, and canvases, etc. Instruction and supplies are available for additional costs. $35 with instruction and your own materials, $45 with materials to be supplied as well as instruction.

Planned Meet-ups include outdoor plein air paintings, trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Bronx Botanical Gardens, painting from the live model in outdoor settings.

The Group meets up currently on Saturdays from 2:30 PM to 5:00 PM. Most Meet-up events have light refreshments and background music.

Please view the organizer's website for images of his work and more information- www.thomaslegaspi-art.com.

Thanks and Happy Painting!

results.description:
Japchae, jabchae, chapchae, chop chae, or chap chae (Korean: 잡채) is a Korean dish made from sweet potato noodles (called dangmyeon, Korean: 당면), stir fried in sesame oil with vegetables(typically thinly sliced carrots, onion, spinach, and mushrooms), sometimes served with beef, and flavored with soy sauce, and sweetened with sugar. It is usually served garnished with sesame seeds and slivers of chili. It may be served hot or cold.

This dish is served at Korean parties and special occasions, with seasonal vegetables added.

Japchae is most commonly served as a side dish, though it may be a main dish. It is often served on a bed of rice; with rice it is known as japchae-bap (잡채밥), bap (밥) meaning "rice."

***Please Note***

- We are cooking Japchae with Beef. Please message me if you can't eat beef we might be able to substute other ingredients.

- Please give me your email address and phone number right after RSVP then we will send you an invoice from Paypal when we can pay through that.

-Class will start at 3pm so please don't be late. please be in the class at least 10minutes early.

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.

results.description:
MAYOR BARAKA TO HOLD “OCCUPY THE CITY” ANTI-VIOLENCE WALK 

ALL FIVE WARDS ON SATURDAY, AUGUST 8, AT 4 P.M. 


Residents will meet at (5) rallying points in each ward and walk downtown to the historic “Four Corners” at Broad and Market for anti-violence rally.

They will meet at five rallying points at 3:30 p.m. in each of Newark’s five wards and walking to the City’s historic downtown “Four Corners” at Broad and Market Streets, for an anti-violence rally. 


The rallying points and contact organizers for each ward are as: 

• North Ward: Victoria Avenue and Cutler Street.

Contact: Daniel Figueroa (201) 566- 6097

• South Ward: Brunswick Street and Astor Street. 

Contact: Stacey Hillsman (973)[masked] 

• East Ward: Pennington Court. 

Contact: Ligia DeFreitas (201)[masked]

• West Ward: 15th Street and 15th Avenue. 

Contact: Marques-Aquil Lewis (201)[masked]

• Central Ward: Central Avenue and 9th Street. 

Contact: Al’Tarik Onque (201)[masked] 

City and community organizers from a variety of groups will join the walkers in the rally.

Building on the success and support from Newark residents during his “Occupy the Block events, Mayor Baraka decided to host an “Occupy the City” to unite residents from the entire City against despair, violence, and crime, and to promote love, hope, and empowerment. “Occupy the Block” is a community engagement tool modeled after the historic “Occupy” movement, which advocates social disruption of harmful or ineffective constructs.

#OCCUPYTHECITY

results.description:
Prague is one of Europe's most beautiful and romantic cities.  We'll be in the middle of it all in a tower loft located within the historic city center, just a short walk from the castle, the world famous astronomical clock

Whether you want to spend your days wandering the cobblestone streets, sipping coffee at one of the many cafes, or meandering on a cruise of the river that runs through the center of this magical city, you'll fall in love with the celebrated town and all it has to offer. 

The trip will feature three day trips to surrounding Bohemian towns such as Karlovy Vary, Pisek and Liberec... each day trip will alternate with a free day during which you can explore the city, hang out with other trip participants, or spend a lazy afternoon on our private roof deck...

The trip price includes 8 nights in this amazing city, as well as transfer from the airport to our loft apartment.  

Each bedroom has it's own bathroom, and we'll have regular maid service.  Breakfast will be provided daily, as well as staples such as water, wine and basic foods if you choose to eat in (though the restaurants are excellent and affordable in Prague... just saying').  

Trip price does not include airfare, though I'm happy to help you find a good one.  We only have one room left in our amazing City Center loft, so get a move on, and we'll see you in Prague. 

Book your trip before the end of May and you can gain an additional day in Prague at no extra charge...

Please click here to see that amazing loft style apartment...
results.name: 8 Nights in a Tower in Center of Magical Prague...

results.description:
There's already been two Fantastic Four movies within the past 10 years, so I'm sure everybody knows the deal, but if you want to hear the basics one more time, this is the summary, courtesy of 20th Century Fox...

"THE FANTASTIC FOUR, a contemporary re-imagining of Marvel’s original and longest-running superhero team, centers on four young outsiders who teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe, which alters their physical form in shocking ways. Their lives irrevocably upended, the team must learn to harness their daunting new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy."

The movie starts at 5:00 PM, but I'd like to try and meet up in the lobby around 4:30, just in case we need to wait in line for the theater. I doubt it's going to be that busy, but if it's a large group, we'll still want our choice of seats.

Tickets are available here:

Fandango

After the movie, we're going to be heading over to Benjamin's Restaurant & Bar, (located at 603 Second Avenue) for dinner and drinks. if you just want to meet us there, I'd expect that we'll be arriving around 7:15 PM. Please let me know when you RSVP if you'll be coming for the movie, dinner or both.

Thanks, and hope to see you all there!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll wait in the downstairs lobby until about 4:30, when we'll head up to the theater. If you arrive after that, you can try and find us in the theater or we'll meet up again downstairs after the movie, before heading over to  Benjamin's.
results.name: "Fantastic Four" - Movie and Bar Night

MEETING PLACES: 

4:45pm Manhattan: Whitehall Terminal by the bathrooms under the Phone Sign. 

5:30pm Staten Island: St. George Terminal at the bar in the River Dock Cafe (aka the only sit down restaurant in the terminal). 

TICKETS ARE PURCHASED:  But if you are just signing up you can get them online, or try your luck at the box office on Saturday. The stadium says it's close to sold out. 

This is not an "official" Smutty Book Club event.  We have so much planned during the next two weeks. I don't want to overwhelm anyone with things to do; however, this is kind of awesome. I'm definitely going and I tricked Helen into going too. It's not an official Smutty Book Club event - we might be only two people, or we might be 20. 

George RR Martin will be at the Staten Island Yankees Game on Saturday, August 8th. The SI Yankees will become the Staten Island Direwolves for the night, complete with a live wolf mascot at the ballpark. The opposing team (The Hudson Valley Renegades) will be the Lannister Lions. The teams will wear special jerseys to be auctioned off with proceeds going to Martin's favorite charity the Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary.

George RR Martin will be signing autographs for one hour. There is a book and a Direwolves Hat giveaway for the first 2,500 fans. The game is at 7, but we should be there early. 

Details on George RR Martin's event: 

http://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2015/07/27/george-r-r-martin-is-bringing-game-of-thrones-to-the-staten-island-yankees/
results.name: A Song of Ice & Fire & Baseball: George RR Martin at the Staten Island Yankees

venue.name: in front of St. Paul's Chapel

results.description:
There’s no doubt that the Irish have made a big green impact on New York City, but contrary to popular belief, some of the children of Erin got here long before the Potato Famine of the 1840s. Visit the still-standing Marble Palace of pioneering retail entrepreneur AT Stewart, and the monuments of exiled Irish patriots Emmet and MacNeven, who channeled their thwarted energies into their new country. Hear stories too of tempestuous Archbishop “Dagger John” Hughes, the famine that spurred massive emigration to New York, the Irish contribution to the building of the Brooklyn Bridge, the terrible Draft Riots (still the worst rioting New York City has ever known), and the infamous Five Points slum, which shocked even Oliver Twist author Charles Dickens.

Where to meet: Meet outside St. Paul’s Chapel, Broadway and Fulton Street. 

When to meet: 4:45 for a 5pm start. I will be holding a sign that reads, "Irish of Old New York".

Train: Take the A,C to "Broadway/ Nassau"; 2,3,4,5,J,M,Z to "Fulton Street".

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.  Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.

The tour will be approximately 2-2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event. 


The nearest restrooms to this location are inside St. Paul's Chapel itself, all the way to the back. However, the church may be closed by the time we meet at 4:45. In that case, try Starbucks at the bottom of the Woolworth Building.  Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a sign  reading IRISH OF OLD NEW YORK
results.name: The IRISH of Old New York!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Let's Explore: the Relationship between Happiness & Various Types of Consumption

results.description:
This group was initially created September 2014, and in April 2015 I had to close the group. At its peak, I believe this group had close to 200 members, but I was disappointed that some members would RSVP, and not show up to events. I was looking forward to meeting them, and I am sure the other members were looking forward to meeting them, as well. I removed, banned them, and addressed the behavior. However, it still persisted. I have noticed that many Meetup groups have this problem. We are all busy people, and sometimes things do not go according to plan, but we must try to fulfill our obligations. At the time that I closed the group, I had others things that required my time, and I did not want to leave my members without anything to do while I was working. I have since completed them, and I want to continue this group. I enjoy researching, planning, and leading events. I created this group to help others, utilize the opportunity to become a better photographer, and to make friends. Let's get together! 

*After the event, post your photographs in the appropriate folder for this specific event. Don't post everything; post your best work/what you want others to see!
results.name: Meet, greet, and let's have some fun!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level 
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active 
2. Spend more time socializing 
3. Be productive at meaningful work 
4. Get better organized and plan things out 
5. Stop worrying 
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations 
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking 
8. Become present oriented 
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality 
10. Work on a healthy personality 
11. Be yourself 
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems 
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness 
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change 
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions 
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress 
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Let's Explore: the Relationship between Happiness & Various Types of Consumption

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
We are so excited to announce that we will continue to hold beginner series in ASTORIA!!!  This month, we will focus on SIDE BY SIDE CHARLESTON!!


Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet!! We will meet every Saturday from 5pm to 6pm in August (8/8, 15, 22 and 29). We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!!  You will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic jazz music from 30s and 40s!!

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor.  Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it!!  $52 for 4 classes or $15 for single class.


Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot!  Please register in advance at QED website and get the discount!! 


http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa

Classes are taught by Michael Duke and Akemi Kinukawa, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.swingdanceastoria.com)


Here is a video from one of the workshops we had at QED:

https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=537214196418671&set=vb.395724470567645&type=2&theater

If you are interested in finding out what types of materials we cover in the beginner class, please go to Facebook group Swing Dance Astoria and check out the recap video!!  (and like us : )

https://www.facebook.com/swingdanceastoria

Register here:  http://nycgrace.org/pages/upcomingEvents.aspx?fsId=1&itemId=101&returnUrl=/pages/upcomingEvents.aspx

Not many songs are more cherished than Amazing Grace.  And yet, when you know the story behind the author, John Newton, and how he came “out of the depths” of despair, you will never sing this song the same again.  We invite you to join us for an evening with Newton; come and enjoy “Out of the Depths,” a drama performed by an excellent group of high school students. The drama will survey the life of John Newton and include several of his original hymns including Amazing Grace.  

Space is limited to these two performances. To ensure your seat, you can register ahead of time on our website (graceofforesthills.com).  If you are not able to register, seating/availability is on a first come first seated basis.  A nice meal will also be provided free of charge.

A Dinner Theater at Grace

Saturday, August 8th—5:00 pm

Sunday, August 9th—5:00 pm

Grace Baptist Church meets

every Sunday at 1:00 pm at

60 Greenway Terrace, Forest Hills

Pastor Tim

graceofforesthills.com www.graceofforesthills.com 
www.guineafield.blogspot.com

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Saturday evening with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour cocktail party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 101 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Sign up today and meet other fun people in our group while really getting a different perspective on one of  New York’s most famous landmarks and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Following the tour ( approx. 90 minutes )you are welcome to join the group at our Cocktails and Conversations Party at The Campbell Terrace at Grand Central for food and drink.

Meet at The Campbell Terrace at 5:30pm.  Dave Cervini is the tour guide and will have an NYSN/Meetup sign.  His cell is[masked] if you get lost

What to wear: Summer stylish (you will be outside)

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change: $15

Is there food?  Yes, Campbell terrace has a menu or you can eat at one of the Grand Central Food Court locations

What to expect: 20 -30 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.  Following the tour go to the party at The Campbell Terrace where there will be about 80 attending! There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Grand Central History Tour & Outdoor Lounge Party

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

results.description:
I just found out about this.

I am a huge Robert Davi fan. He is giving a free concert at the Lakeside Theatre in Eisenhower Park on Saturday evening at 7 PM. It's FREE!!!!!!! If anyone want to join me? We can leave from Patchogue; after our early dinner/late lunch at Meetballs; and carpool. I can fit 3 more people in my car.

Have to check if parking is free after 5:00 pm. I think it is.

I figure we'll be done with dinner by around 5:00 or 5:30; (our tummies will be full and happy), then carpool over to the park and wrap up the evening with what is sure to be a wonderful performance. If you only know Mr. Davi from his acting performances, and have never heard him sing; you are in for quite a treat.

Anyone else wanting to either meet us there or in Patchogue that is not attending the earlier day's event; that's fine too.

IF NOT CARPOOLING, WE WILL MEET AT HARRY CHAPIN LAKESIDE THEATRE AT 6:30.  WILL EMAIL MY CONTACT INFO THE MORNING OF.

Here's some info on the concert:

Davi Sings Sinatra
Saturday, August 8
The Harry Chapin Lakeside Theatre is an outdoor theater located within Eisenhower Park in East Meadow. Conveniently located near parking fields 6 and 6A
There is no formal seating at the Harry Chapin Lakeside Theatre so concertgoers are urged to bring folding chairs or blankets. Special accommodations are also available for disabled patrons, including reserved parking, easily accessible restrooms, and a convenient reserved location on the hill. If doubtful weather conditions arise, call (516)[masked] after 6:30 p.m. for updated performance information.
results.how_to_find_us: If carpooling, behind Patchogue Theater, or at Lakeside Theatre if not carpooling

results.description:
This past Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 19 women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking…


Let’s get together and give to the homeless. You can give money or food or clothes or whatever you want to give. While we're at it, we'll hold doors for people and be nice to tourists and be extra polite to everyone and smile and be happy. I dunno about you, but I'm already smiling. =)


Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

Now as you know, everything I do is singles-related and I do charge for my matchmaking services, but for every person who comes to this event, I will donate $2. So if 50 people come, I'll donate $100. If 100 people come, I'll donate $200, but I'm fairly certain I'll be the big spender on this day. I don't expect you to bring too much. You should bring 10 or 20 dollars in singles or if you don't want to give cash then make a couple of sandwiches to hand out or some socks or buy a pack or two of clean underwear, etc. Toiletries are good (ziplock bags with a travel toothbrush, toothpaste, etc). Travel packs of baby wipes are good and so on. If you want to pick up $1 slices of pizza as we walk and hand them out, that would be great. Give what you want, but please don't come empty-handed. We will give until we run out of things to give.

After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed.

results.description:
This past Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 19 women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking…

Let’s get together and give to the homeless. You can give money or food or clothes or whatever you want to give. While we're at it, we'll hold doors for people and be nice to tourists and be extra polite to everyone and smile and be happy. I dunno about you, but I'm already smiling. =)

Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 


Now as you know, everything I do is singles-related and I do charge for my matchmaking services, but for every person who comes to this event, I will donate $2. So if 50 people come, I'll donate $100. If 100 people come, I'll donate $200, but I'm fairly certain I'll be the big spender on this day. I don't expect you to bring too much. You should bring 10 or 20 dollars in singles or if you don't want to give cash then make a couple of sandwiches to hand out or some socks or buy a pack or two of clean underwear, etc. Toiletries are good (ziplock bags with a travel toothbrush, toothpaste, etc). Travel packs of baby wipes are good and so on. If you want to pick up $1 slices of pizza as we walk and hand them out, that would be great. Give what you want, but please don't come empty-handed. We will give until we run out of things to give.

After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Harlo! Ni-Hao! Konichiwa! Anyo haseyo!


It's summer time and you must have heard about the notorious night market that is happening over at Queens every Saturday night. With over 100 vendors and authentic asian night market food to choose from, you are surely in for a treat this summer! Starting from Hong Kong street eats to Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Korean Pancakes to Japanese Crepes, there is definitely a bit of something for everyone!

So come join us at the Night market on 08/08 (Saturday), sit under the summer night sky while we dine away within the festive ambient. There shall be food, there shall be drinks, and there shall be fun!
results.how_to_find_us: New York Hall of Science in Flushing Meadows Corona Park
results.name: Queens International Night Market

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The Campbell Terrace is a great covered outdoor patio at Grand Central Terminal. It is easy to get to, casual yet slightly sophisticated and the perfect place to start your Saturday Night with members and friends of NYSN and our other partner groups. The party is rain or shine.

It is a great way to start your Saturday Night!  We start early  at 6pm and the crowd usually hangs till about 9pm.


The night will feature:

-Free admission

-Drink  specials until 8pm

-A private area set aside just for our group

-Music played at conversational levels

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

This is the perfect night for new members to come out and meet others in the group.

Can I come alone? Yes! 95% of those attending usually come alone so don't be nervous if this is your first time out!

What to expect: 40-60 fun and friendly people

What to wear: be comfortable, not too dressy but leave the sneakers and t-shirt home

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
INSIDE SCOOP FOR A FREE CONCERT!

OPIUS BLISS LIVE @ THE 55 BAR

SATURDAY AUGUST 8TH 6PM - 9 PM


Opius Bliss, the powerful new blues fusion group, will be bringing their American Roots oriented Jazz-Blues Fusion project to the 55 Bar on Saturday August 8th.

"....with Michelle Walker's lush and smoky vocals, Opius Bliss is that perfect crossroad where Blues meets Jazz, Soul and Funk....supremely poised for stardom!" - The Jazz Perspective


OPIUS BLISS
Live @ The 55 Bar
55 Christopher Street (near 7th Ave South)
New York, NY 10014
(212)[masked]

https://www.facebook.com/events/1453358128299923/1453548348280901/

http://www.55bar.com/
NO COVER! $$ - 2 drink minimum


Michelle Walker - Vocals
Sean Fitzpatrick - Keyboard
Jason Ennis - Guitar
Michael O'Brien - Bass
Sean Dixon - Drums

55 Bar is a prohibition era dive bar with incredible live Jazz, Funk & Blues nightly in Greenwich village, Since 1919. One of the few original Speakeasies left in New York City!

Zero to Modest cover charges & some major talents make this cozy downstairs music club a local stalwart.

results.description:
Hello again, Rescuers! Let's game! And Linda, show us what you've got  ;)

Rules:

1) Please bring at least 1 multiplayer game for the PS2, Gamecube, Xbox 360 or Wii. If you cannot bring a game, please at least be willing and ready to play DDR (Dance Dance Revolution) with me. I love that game!

2) Bring whatever drinks (alcoholic or non-alcoholic) that you wish to drink. I will provide the food and ice and water, my treat. The rest is up to you!

See you then  :)

P.S.  If you were a No-Show at a previous Event, you will get banned from this Event and future Events with this Event Host. The moral of the story....please show up to an Event if you sign up for it! If something comes up or you change your mind, that is fine. Just cancel your RSVP before the Event, not during or after. Also, Rescuers that are more than 30-60 minutes late will be considered a No-Show.

results.description:
We're on the waterfront in Red Hook, Brooklyn tonight!

The Folk Music Society of NY leads a sing along during TankerTime.


Kick back and relax, make like the tanker is your own during TankerTime aboard MARY A. WHALEN. The deck is set with tables, chairs and hammocks for you to lounge, bring take-out or your favorite bottle. You can sketch, photograph- or sing along! 


We'll host a singalong on board the historic tanker Mary A Whalen at her new home in Atlantic Basin, Red Hook, Brooklyn.


it's FREE.   See www.portsidenewyork.org/portsidetanke/pow

for full details of this and other weekend events on this venerable work boat of times past.

Located on Pier 11, Atlantic Basin next to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal in Red Hook, Brooklyn.

venue.name: Beer Garden at Battery Gardens Cafe

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups including Quiet Clubbing.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

YOU MUST REGISTER AT WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM

When the sun goes down, turn the volume up!  Join us for another great mobile dance party tour with a splash of history!  Our night begins at The Beer and Wine garden at Battery Gardens Cafe.  We’ll kick off the night with specially-priced drinks and a bite to eat from the grill menu.  From there, we’ll head north along the Battery Park Promenade while we dance , sing, enjoy spectacular views, learn a little history and make our way to our next stop!

Over the course of the evening we’ll bar hop to 3 different bars.  The tour will end near the World Financial Center along the waterfront (subject to change and weather conditions).

With the amazing views of The NYC skyline and NY Harbor as the sun sets to the west, this is one night that you’ll not want to miss!  When you arrive you will get a pair of wireless headphones with 2 different channels of music to choose from.  You can take the headphones off at anytime to talk to others on the trip!

YOU MUST REGISTER AT WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM

COST $15 (INCLUDES TOUR ONLY)

Channel 1: 80′s & 90′s
Channel 2: Top 40′s & HipHop

Check in Location: The Beer & Wine Garden at Battery Gardens Cafe (inside Battery Park across from 17 State Street)
Check in time: 6:30pm
Leave at: 7:30pm
Party ends: ~11:30pm at World Financial Center

Registration is at The Battery Gardens Beer Garden located inside Battery Park across from 17 State Street 6:30-7:30pm

Can I come alone?  Yes 90% of those attending will register on their own.

What to expect:[masked] fun and friendly people looking to experience something a little different on a Saturday night. Age range will be 20's - 40's.

How do you socialize with headphones on?  You will not have them on 100% of the time.  When we stop at different bars you will likely take them off to chat with others.

Limited spots (100)

Age Restriction: 21+

What you need
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

YOU MUST REGISTER AT WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM

How it works
Arrive for check-in and happy hour drinks. A valid photo ID & credit card will be needed. In the event you do not return the headphone, $50 will be charged to your credit card. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling  in the streets through the city. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones to the organizer to check out.  We end at the waterfront location where the headphones will be returned.

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

YOU MUST REGISTER AT WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM

group.name: New York Social Network, Events and Adventure Group - NYC

results.description:
Every so often, I get the urge to showcase my amusingly awful singing ability to you all- and the urge has come again. 

And you're all going to do it along with me. We are going to sing our favorite songs (or the songs we normally reserve for singing in the shower) and have a blast doing it at the Karaoke Cave. I've been here several times before and it's got a pretty relaxed feel. There's enough space where you don't generally feel packed in. They have a pretty good song selection from oldies to current favorites and lots in between.You can either pay a dollar for a song, or get a song free with any drink purchase. Sounds like a pretty freakin' winning combination to me.

I hereby vow to you, I shall not take myself too seriously and will put on my best possible performance for a song or two. You may laugh, or you may cry, but this I promise- If I cause any tears, I'll buy a drink to make up for it.

There's a limited bar menu, just in case anyone feels like snacking, but I plan to get something to eat in the area afterward, and you are all welcome to join me, of course. Don't know what it'll be, but we'll cross that bridge when we come to it.

Just a few things you need to know:

Photo ID is required

No admittance under 21

No outside food and beverage
results.name: Karaoke!

results.description:
Our next Saturday Night Dance Social will be held on Saturday, August 8th!

Event Details:

The evening will begin with a fun absolute beginner Introduction to Dancing Class from 6:30-7pm, new dancers will be taught the basic steps to some of the most popular dances! We will also have a Practice Party from 7-7:30pm so that you can practice and socialize before the workshop class begins.

We will have an open level dance workshop from 7:30-9pm. The workshop this month will be Salsa Rueda, which is a fun Cuban style Salsa class that includes Salsa movements danced in a circle as a group! 

Here is a video of Rueda de Casino dancing! It is a lot of fun! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rvKBshCsOj4 

No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary! Come out and learn to dance in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!

After the dance workshop, you will be treated to an array of delicious snacks to keep you energized as we dance the night away! There will also be refreshments, including complimentary wine, and soft drinks.

We will have general dancing, so that we can continue to practice our new moves and dance the night away! We will play a mix of Salsa, Bachata, Cha Cha and Merengue, as well as some Rumba, Hustle and Swing, along with any other music requests!

Please contact Tiffinay at[masked] or at [masked] to RSVP, and with any questions about this event.

Saturday, August 8th-

6:30-7pm Absolute Beginners Introduction to Dance Class
7- 7:30pm Practice Party
7:30-9pm Special Salsa Rueda Dance Workshop with Fernando Polanco
9-12:30am Social dancing, refreshments and fun!

NEW Discounted Admission!

$15, with RSVP, will include your fun dance workshop lessons, refreshments and a night out social dancing!

$20 at the door

You can RSVP for this event below or visit our web-site or Facebook page to RSVP today!

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site,  Spirare Dance Studio. You can also find us on Facebook,  Spirare Dance.

You can also check out the event page on Facebook, Ballroom in Bayside!

results.description:
Harbor Light Cruise: Spark A Dreamy Romance With The NYC Skyline At Dusk!

Nothing quite compares to a NYC sunset cruise through city lights glistening like diamonds on the dark water. So grab some friends, family, coworkers or even a totally random stranger and enter the magical twilight scene of so many famous movies. Experience the Instagram potential as you watch the sunset and glide under the majestically lit Lady Liberty.  


With a drink in your hand, the breeze in your face and the NYC skyline shimmering before you, how could you possibly go wrong? It’s a happy hour (and a half) of sightseeing! And not only that, but they double your photo ops by turning their tour around so you can catch that perfect pic.

Child tickets are available for ages 3 - 12, adults are 13 - 64, and seniors 65+. For children/infants under the age of 3, please ask at the box office for an infant ticket; it is free of charge.

CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS:

Statue of liberty | USS Intrepid Pier | Hoboken Pier |Pier 54 (titanic Pier) | Jacob K. Javits convention center | battery park | Ellis island | Wall Street | South Street SeaportBrooklyn Bridge | Chrysler Building | Empire State Building | World financial Center | United Nations

Boarding Information

Boarding begins a half hour before departure. To ensure you get on the cruise at the time you are interested in, please arrive one hour to 45 minutes before the departure to allow yourself enough time to obtain boarding passes from the box office and to find seating on the cruise.

Public Transportation By Subway

A, C, E, 1, 2, 3, 7, S, N, Q, and R trains to Times Square 42nd Street. Walk or take the bus to 12th Avenue. 

Boarding Information:

Boarding begins a half hour before departure. To ensure you get on the cruise, please arrive one hour to 45 minutes before the departure to allow yourself enough time to obtain boarding passes from the box office and to find seating on the cruise.

Bus to your location:

From 42nd Street take the westbound M42 bus or from 49th Street take the westbound M50 bus. The buses will take you all the way to the Circle Line Pier. 

Adults $36 | Children $25 | Seniors $32

Things To Know

• Food and beverages available for purchase on board, including a full bar

• Onboard restrooms

• Narrated by professional guides

• Sail within 100 feet of the Statue of Liberty

• Great views of midtown and lower Manhattan at sunset and night time

Pass under Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Williamsburg bridges

Location:

Pier 83
West 42nd Street and 12th Avenue
New York, NY 10036
(212)[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: At the Box Office @ Circle Line Sightseeing Cruise @ Pier 85 West 42nd Street
results.name: Harbor Light Cruise: Circle Line Sightseeing @ 42nd Street!

Admission is by any Modern Myths Event Pass (Day Passes are $5 that you get back in store credit, Monthly and Yearly options are also available). Ages 13+, younger if parent is present at the event.

results.description:
GreenSpaceNYC Summer Showcase on Sustainability is a night of short films regarding sustainable causes and artistically conceived dire warnings. 

A team of GreenSpaceNYC judges will vote to award films in the following categories: Best Doc Short, Best Narrative Short, and Best Short. Attendees will be asked to vote for an Audience Choice Award.  After the judging, we will show an additional set of shorts, the Midnight Shorts Program,  that ranges from the alternative to the bizarre, within sustainability themes.

The first grouping of shorts are those nominated for Best Documentary Short. Film topics from this group range from fracking to international farming practices. 

The second group are those nominated for Best Narrative Short. Many of the films in this group deal with issues about environmental degradation and futures of hardship. 

Category: Best Doc

Cotton Dreams by Sandeep Balhara (14:30)

S: Himmel - The Norwegian Skyline by Greg Tomaszewicz (2:57)

Don't Frack Our Future by Mark Devlin (14:59)

S: ON/OFF by Kuesti Fraun (1:00)

Becoming Vegan: Alyssa's Story by Shannon R. Giedieviells (4:04)

S: Now We Are Taller Than Trees by Mehrdad Eghbali (2:00)

On.Off by 3lamp Productions (13:17)

S: Take It by Yasser Kassab (0:37)

Best Narrative Short:

S: The Survivor by Ahmad Mokari (2:00)

NO JILE by Carolina Davila (10:00)

S: HONORIO Two minutes of sun by Paco Gisbert (5:00)

Salvador by Sylvia Nicolaides and Nicolas Iordanou (20:20)

S: Gardenia by German Velasco (4:20)

The Field by Omer Sasson (10:37)

S: CAPACITIES by Kuesti Fraun (0:09)

Midnight Showing (Starting at 10:30)

Irrelevant by Ida Ayu Lestari (2:41)

Arcadia by Rick Fisher (4:49)

White Planet by Milos Bijanic (1:33)

Decadence of Nature by Olga Guse (7:00)

Natural Love by Kuesti Fraun (1:08)

The Ark by Olga Guse (5:00)

Ice is Melting by Helena Hufnagel (2:25)

Civic Art Lab is a summer-long storefront in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s Pop-up Program. This environmental, arts, and educational initiative calls on citizens to co-produce creative and open ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives happening locally in order to amplify the diverse voices and encourage future civic engagement. 

Our storefront is made possible by sponsors: Material for the Arts & Build It Green.
results.name: GreenspaceNYC Summer Showcase Films on Sustainability

We hope to have a new date secured from the venue by early next week.  The event will be at the same location:
