We will notify you by email as soon as we have the reschedule date.

Join us for Northern New Jersey's August Lock and Key Singles Party! A great non-intimidating way to meet singles in the Northern New Jersey area!

Lock and Key Events are the new, interactive and FUN way to network, meet your match, make new friends....or just to have a great time!

</a>

<a href="http://www.lockandkeyevents.com/NNJ">

Details of our next Meet-up:

August 8th, 2015

</a>

<a href="http://10thstreetlive.com/">

10th Street Live
104 N. 10th Street
Kenilworth, NJ 07083

Suggested Age range: 24-49 ( if you are a little younger or older...no biggie!!)

Check-in : 7:00-7:30pm
Mix and Mingle : 7:30-9:30pm
Prize drawing at 9:30pm
Done at 9:30pm and then stay & party until closing with no cover!!

INCLUDES:
- DRINK SPECIALS during the event *, AND FREE APPETIZERS (until 8:30 PM),
- Free admission into 10th Street Live (no additional cover if you stay afterwards)
- Great prizes, and the opportunity to massively mix, mingle, make new friends, and who knows what else!


How It Works
Every woman gets a padlock. Every man gets a key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. Every time you unlock you get a ticket that enters you into the drawing to win great prizes from our party sponsors. Prizes such as cold hard cash, hotel stays, dinners, tickets to popular things to do and more. After every unlock you get another lock or key so you can get back into the fray and meet more people!

Register at www.lockandkeyevents.com/NNJ!! Use the code CNJMEETUP to attend for ONLY $21 - OUR MEET-UP MEMBERS PAY A MUCH LOWER PRICE TO ATTEND THESE SUPER FUN EVENTS THAN ANYONE ELSE. Or, you can pay $27 CASH at the door IF you put in an RSVP. Otherwise, it's $32 at the door!!

PRIZES!

Every time you unlock, you can win prizes such as:

One $50 CASH Prize!

One - Pair of Tickets to see a Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($200 value/pair)

One - Pair of Tickets to see an Off-Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($110 value/pair)

One - Gift Certificate for 10th Street Live ($25 value)

Complimentary Admission tickets to  Pre-Dating Speed Dating Events ($35 Value)

Several Copies of the book "No More Dating Pigs - You Are What You Date" by Dating Author Norah Marler ($8.95 value each)

Complimentary Admissions into future Lock And Key Events

And more!

Please email or call me with any questions!!

See you there~
Marcy

results.description:
Chanting is used ancient cultures all over the world as a way of celebration.  The chanting that we do on Bhakti Nite is based in Sanskrit chants, which have a vibrational effect on the heart and mind.  If you enjoy music, meditation or just meeting new people come try it out.  The chants are simple and are repeated over and over so that anyone can join in, no knowledge of Sanskrit is necessary.

Cost: None, donations are happily accepted.

Bring yourself and a friend if you wish!
results.name: Bhakti Nite- Meditative Chanting (Kirtan/Satsang) at the Art of Living

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

results.description:
So I had a random thought pop in head while passing by an iHop this morning. Wouldn't it be fun to recreate some trademark foods like the iHop pancake? So I googled famous food recipes and long behold so many secret copy cat recipes popped up! And hence our next dinner party theme was born....lol

For this dinner you must pick one of your favorite famous foods. This can be anything from a well known packaged food item, to a copy of one of your favorite restaurant dishes. I have included some links to help you out. Feel free to use any of these recipes or you can track down one of your own. 

http://www.culinaryartscollege.org/100-famous-restaurant-recipes-you-can-replicate-at-home/


http://www.buzzfeed.com/keenan/42-home-recipes-of-famous-foods#.la5QP2lNY


http://www.sixsistersstuff.com/2013/04/100-of-best-restaurant-copycat-recipes.html


http://www.delish.com/restaurants/g2377/famous-restaurants-signature-recipes/?slide=1


To Participate you must make at least one food dish that is a copy of your favorite famous food. If you wish to drink with us please also contribute a cocktail or bottle of wine. 

This is a potluck party, but you may do finishing touches in the apartment. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

The fine print:

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of August 1sth  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
This event is open to all!

 THE PURPOSE OF SOUL COMMUNICATION, by Ravi Kaur

You and only you, the soul self has the true information

about you. Others can guide you hold your hand and show

you the way, but ultimate pure light the divine wisdom and

truth has been existing within you, so connecting to this

place within you could truly change your life.

Your journey after practicing certain meditations and

prayers, regularly through conscious constant connection to

this place within you will bring success and fulfillment in

your life.

I have been on quest since very young age, about the pains

and challenges of life, as I grew up with a sibling one and a

half year older to me and his pain was very profound. To

understand his pain I would very often walk in the house

with eyes closed. This search led me to meditate and pray a

lot during my childhood, Then with the experience of a very

challenging and abusive relationship in my own marriage, I was led

to the most amazing school in Florida. This school had a

lot to offer in my emotional, mental and spiritual as well as

physical healings, Barbra Brennan a scientist and sage and a

energy healer created a four years program where you heal

the self and connect very deeply to self and learn how to

relate to others. You learn the causes of how disease is

created in human energy field.

I graduated from this school in 2012.

My own search has not ended to add to

what I learned there, connecting and healing my own

ancestral wounds or beliefs and images, as well as the

HONORING OF THEIR JOURNEY, is my present focus.

Through this journey I realized how the soul communication

is an essential and powerful tool that already exists within

us.

 My passion and purpose at our Saturday, August 8th event, and in general, is to bring tools and techniques to all those seekers who are truly seeking to change their life for their own good, as well as teach the new

generation through the depth of their own experience.

I look forward to sharing this illuminating and fascinating journey to Soul with you!

Ravi Kaur

As noted, this beautiful event is open to all. Investment in your evolution: $25 if rsvp is received by Wednesday, August 5th and $30 thereafter. Thank you very much for honouring our time and commitment to you by rsvping as soon as possible! I can be reached at [masked] or at[masked] with any questions, and for rsvp's.

 I believe Ravi has some of the most information needed to transform our lives in a very deep and profound way. I am honoured to be able to offer you her incredible wisdom, insight, spirituality and compassion. Looking forward to seeing you next Saturday night!

Carol Leitner
results.how_to_find_us: Ravi and I will be welcoming you at the door.
results.name: Totally Transform Your Life By Deepening Your Connection to Soul

results.description:
Tickets Here! https://goo.gl/BsyYks

Have you ever wanted to create a painting on Canvas but lack the know how or tools to do so? This class is for you, Picasso! Each new artist is walked through, step by step a pre-selected painting. Each artist receives a 16x20 canvas and all supplies and materials. Everyone is encouraged to add their own spark to their painting!

I patiently help all of our artists as we break down each selected painting to make it easier for everyone to achieve results. All beginning artists are able to leave the day of the class with their very own paintings. Hang it on your wall, give it to a friend or make it a special gift - the choice is yours! Small snacks, beverages, wine and/or beer are welcomed during our classes. Lets have fun and get creative!

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the reception desk
results.name: Kirtan and Global Peace Meditation

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
Meet-and-Greet with entire cast of The Jackie Mason Musical following the show!

Come see the highly acclaimed musical comedy "The Jackie Mason Musical" (Now in it's 5th year!) and attend a meet-and-greet with the entire cast afterwards! Including the producer, director, writer, and composer! The Meet-and-Greet is held at Alphies which is just down the block from the theater on 53rd and 9th! This is a wonderful networking opportunity, and a perfect place to make new friends in the theater community. Feel free to ask the cast and crew any questions about their long-running Off-Broadway experience. Normally this show is $59.00 but if you mention the meet-up, you can get tix for less than half price! $25 for meet-up members!

check website for details:


http://www.thejackiemasonmusical.com/


What the show is about:

Regarded by some as one of the greatest comics of all time, everyone knows the name Jackie Mason. But have you heard the one about the belly dancer? For the first time, The Jackie Mason Musical lifts the lid on the true story of Mason and his decade long love affair with the young Ginger Reiter, and the child they shared, Sheba Mason. Written, composed and directed by Ginger and starring Sheba as herself and her mom, this peek into the strange double life of an American icon is a hit for fans, old and new.

It all began in Miami in 1977. When their eyes meet in a deli, Jackie and Ginger have no idea of the complicated and long-running love story ahead of them. Urged by her glamorous mother Mrs Oliver, Ginger falls completely in love and is happy to be wooed by Jackie whenever he finds his way to South Florida. Unbeknownst to Ginger, Jackie seems to have alot of young lady freinds all over the country and when she becomes pregnant, she's left to bring up young Sheba alone in the midst of heartbreak.

Hilarious and original and packed with unique songs such as "Just An Ordinary Man," "I Never Met This Yenta" and more, this critically acclaimed Off Broadway musical is an absolute gem!

Ian Wehrle as Jackie Mason and a cast of 8.

TheJackieMasonMusical.com

ShebaMason.com
results.name: Meet-and-Greet with entire cast of The Jackie Mason Musical following the show!

results.description:
Tom Doyle will speak and answer questions at the monthly General Meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County. Mr Doyle is the author of the novels AMERICAN CRAFTSMEN and the forthcoming THE LEFT-HAND WAY, as well as a smattering of shorter works. The novels form a secret history of the behind-the-scenes America, whose Founding Fathers included practitioners of the occult arts.  Their present day descendants continue to safeguard the nation from supernatural perils.

There is a discussion of science fiction / fantasy news at the store beginning at 7:00 PM.

This is one of a number of events sponsored each month by the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County, www.sfabc.org. We invite you to attend our book groups, movie nights, television gatherings and other events. Write to SFABCPhilmu (at) gmail.com for more information.
results.name: Meet Fantasy / Science Fiction Writer Tom Doyle

results.description:
** UPDATED 7/24/15 **

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION:

For all you nightcrawlers, here's another evening event to get some great photos within our fabulous New York City.

** Weather permitting, we will meet at the Christopher Columbus Statue across from the Time Warner Center at 10pm sharp!!  Nearest Subway Station is Columbus Circle (A, B, C, D, 1).

** We will break up into smaller groups, and take long exposures in Columbus Circle for around an hour or so.  Then regroup as a whole to walk to Rockefeller Center, break up into smaller groups, and take long exposures for around an hour or so.


  Then regroup as a whole and then walk to the final stop -- Times Square, break up into smaller groups and take long exposures for as long as you like -- and as long as you are not by yourself in the dark with expensive equipment.


Items to bring (pack light if possible): 


* Camera -- along with charged battery and empty memory card.  

* Tripod -- PLEASE READ THIS; IMPORTANT!!!! --  We've done long exposures in the past and so far we had no issues. Just bringing up the possibilities so that everyone is aware -- If you have a monopod, or a mini tripod, bring them as you could probably use those better than a regular size.  Keep in mind that these areas that we will be taking pictures may still be quite crowded with tourists, joggers and cyclists, so be aware of your surroundings. Also, you may be stopped by police or security for using a tripod & be asked for a permit.  Just move along.   So, you have been warned. 


* Remote -- this is OPTIONAL.  If you want to shoot longer than 30 seconds aka bulb mode, a remote is a good idea. 


* Bring snacks & water to stay hydrated. Pack light!!

***********************************

* Be on time! This event starts at 10pm sharp!! So give yourself plenty of time to travel. Check for service changes or delays. I will not wait for latecomers and I will not answer calls, emails and/or messages after 9pm.

* Dress appropriately for the weather and definitely wear comfortable shoes.

* Food and restrooms are located in Time Warner Center if you want to arrive earlier to eat and drink.  After that, you gonna have to hold it... :P

* DO NOT WANDER OFF IN THE DARK BY YOURSELF WITH YOUR EXPENSIVE EQUIPMENT!!!  YOU'LL JUST BE ASKING SOMEONE TO HURT YOU AND STEAL FROM YOU.  ALWAYS WALK WITH SOMEONE OR STAY WITH YOUR SMALL GROUP!!!!


Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are. 


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927) 

******************** 

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
UPDATE: THE CRUISE IS SOLD OUT. IF YOU RSVPED BUT DIDN'T PREPAY, I APOLOGIZE BUT THERE ARE NO MORE SPOTS LEFT.

THE PAYMENT LINKS WILL NO LONGER ALLOW YOU TO PAY.

THANK YOU.

Hey Everyone!


We're excited about organizing a Midnight Salsa Latin Dance Cruise With A Premixer For The Group. This will be a Summer Edition of "Latin Dancing On The Water" that starts boarding @ Midnight. Then sails from 12:30am to 3am.

To Get The Party Started, We're Going To Meet At 10pm @ Houlihans (Located Right At The Docks) For A Premixer To Enjoy Some Drinks And Appetizers, Or Just To Socialize Before We Get On The Boat!

We Leave From Lincoln Harbor In Weehawken NJ. NO TOLLS TO PAY & Free Parking Available Right On The Dock. :-)

We will be on a Gorgeous Party Boat On Spirit Cruise Line. We'll be doing sight seeing all around Manhattan's greatest attractions including the Statue Of Liberty! There is wonderful lighting all around and a very nice dance floor.

The DJ Will Be Mixing The Best Latin Hits Including Salsa, Bachata, Merengue, Top 40 & More! Join Us For A Special Evening Of Dancing & Fun. Food & Drinks Will Be Available On The Boat For An Additional Expense.

Ticket Price: $36 Per Person Prepaid

Prepay Online With A Debit Or Credit Card: www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=VQFM8AF47YWBG


Directions: http://files.meetup.com/6618712/NJDirections.pdf

It's the last exit on Route 3 In NJ before entering Lincoln Tunnel (Drive Slow). Please Arrive Early To Avoid Missing Boarding Time. Cruise Line Has Informed Me That All Sales Are Final.


Must Bring Official Photo ID To Board. No Exceptions. (Drivers License, Passport Etc.)


If Any One Is Interested In Carpooling With Other Members, Feel Free To Post A Comment. :-)

Looking forward to a great night!

Houlihans @ 1200 Lincoln Harbor Blvd In Weehawken, NJ 07086

Boat Is Right Across Street @ 1400 Harbor Blvd

Friends,

Join us this Saturday for our after party @ Slate NYC. We will be @ El Cid for our luau party in the early part of the evening after which we will continue the after party at Slate NYC.

Our members always have a fun time at that venue.

We will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from my other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.


It should be easy to spot members as many of us will be in leis.


Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
9:30am EST

See you at Sweet Revenge!

What is coffee chat?


#CoffeeChat is a time for us to meet while we're on your way to work in the morning or just about to get your day started. We come together for about an hour to share stories and find some common conversation with other people who are working to make positive things happen.

Over the years of attending #CoffeeChat events, we see that people have continued to come together; it's a little bit of networking and a little bit of inspiration. I hope wherever you are you will consider organizing your own morning meetup with like-minded (or different-minded!) people in your community.

When you raise the flag, and let people know what you are interested in (especially if that interest involves bringing like minded people together) you are well on your way to making a positive difference and a significant impact on your local community.

And, if you do schedule a coffee chat, please do let us know; we'll post the event here! I look forward to getting to spend more time with you and the community you surround yourself.

https://vimeo.com/97005023

Jason

PS: (the hashtag is how we promote on Instagram, Twitter, etc: #CoffeeChat)

results.description:
Host:   Mike Clancy  [masked]

Meet at the main parking lot adjacent to the Bear Mtn. Inn.  It's normally $8 to park but we may be entering before the attendant starts. 

We will be ascending the Major Welch Trail and descending on the AT.  People who have done the Breakneck Bypass Loop will find the ascent on Major Welch to be comparatively strenuous, but the descent on the AT to be much more pleasant.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2+ hours

Map:  http://www.visitbearmountain.com/files/603/BearMountainTrailMap.pdf

This hike offers  outstanding views up and down the Hudson River and the Bear Mountain Bridge.

*** possible parking fee *** It would be $8 if there's still an attendant at that hour, but that's doubtful

Please don't be late - we start on time.  We will meet in the main lot close to the Bear Mountain Inn.

+


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Bear Mountain hike - 4 miles - Hike early and beat the crowds

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
ok everyone , 

Do you feel  stressed out ! are you snapping at everyone ! do you feel tired and anxious do you feel like your just can't  handle one more thing !!.  Well enter "ME Time "   set your alarms to get up early this sunday and join me  in a little bit of just for you time  ..   wear your scrubby sweats /yoga pants , don't bother combing your hair  this is a no judgement zone .  stop and get a cup of tea  or coffee  Dunkin donuts is right off of the saw mill on your way to the garden. Meet me in the parking area  and we will go to sit ,sip , breathe & softly talk   you will be surprised  how fast  in only  a few minutes  you can start to reconnect with the envoirment   and feel calmer ! more joyous and  better able to handle you work week .. following our me time we will talk a short walk around  and if you want to take the real tour with the conservatory  it's $10  and starts at 11 am

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

Pool 1 

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course and a continuation of Lessons.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

The 3 Simple Steps to SCUBA Certification 


1. eLearning: Cyber Edu. Master the academic information. Traditionally, this required several hours of formal classroom training. Now, through on-line training, you can complete this phase through self-study, at your own pace, in the convenience of your home or office. 

Click to purchase Online academic only now $109.95

2. Pool Sessions: The next step will be to complete your in-water skill-development training. This takes place in a swimming pool or similar body of confined water, under the supervision of an Instructor.

3. Get Certified: Complete the required certification dives under the supervision of an Instructor. Here you will apply what you have learned during your academic and pool sessions, while learning practical lessons that can only be gained through real-world experience in open water


Get Started Now.

Enroll to start Step 1 "Online academics $109.95

If you have questionsd, please contact the Dive Center:[masked]

RSVP required 

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

• Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

• CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

A. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

• "Instructors": F. Ventura  &  C.K. Scharf, the 

• "Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

• "Agency" : SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, 

Sign and date at bottom

B. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

C. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session.
results.name: New SCUBA Class Starts

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Kayak the Hudson with Mountain Valley Guides

With the most tours, a variety of locations and the best kayak guides on the river, Mountain Valley Guides is the premiere kayak outfitter in the Hudson Valley.  The Hudson River offers fantastic kayaking opportunities, with open water, calm marshes, amazing sunsets, and beautiful scenery .  Our tours are open to people of all abilities...No experience needed, our guides will have you paddling in minutes.

NEW YORK CITY RESIDENTS - Our Hastings-on-Hudson location is only steps away from the Metro North Station (Hudson Line).  Hastings is a great place to spend the day with cool places to grab apres kayaking lunch/dinner and drinks.  Great views of the Palisades Cliffs and of the New York City Skyline.

Bannerman Island - Cornwall

Bannerman Island - Paddle along the foot of Storm King Mountain and the shadow of Breakneck Ridge as you make your way across the Hudson River to Bannerman Island. Our most popular paddle offers up close views of the castle as guides provide the history of this unique location.

After the kayaking, we can have lunch near the area.

Depart Date: August 9th Sunday (Event: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM). Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:15 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 


Depart 9:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 9th Ave & West 43rd St., New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back NYC around 3:30 PM  & Flushing at 4:00 PM

Includes: 15 seats luxury Benz van round trip transportation from Manhattan & 2 Hours guided kayaking tour with Mountain Valley Guides (Bannerman Island - Cornwall)

Cost: Early Birds $69 (Original $60 + $39 transport = $99) for first 8 spots or 14 days in advance; Afterward, Regular $79

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015Kayaking.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Items to Bring: Water bottle, hat, sunblock scream and clothes to change.

Maximum: 15

More Info: http://www.mountainvalleyguides.com/

Refund Policy:

* $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 14 days prior to the event date; 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

Video from Previous Kayaking Trip

http://youtu.be/7klYxMh0yvo

http://youtu.be/7klYxMh0yvo

Pictures from Previous Kayaking Trip

2011: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/1755101/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/23305412/

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details:
8:30am, Starbucks in Sunnyside; 10:00–11:00 minute pace.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short. If you're a faster runner, please study the route in case you wish to run ahead.

Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Final destination point is Seaside Heights

All day ride. Tolls are involved. 

There is also a meet up for this ride at Nathan's 1310 Surf ave at 10:30 kickstands up at 11 for our Queens,Long Island and Brooklyn People for the people coming with me there a second meetup spot in NJ exit 120 off the Garden state pkwy Pizza hut 343 Matawan road for our NJ people

1st meeting spot - Brooklyn; Atlantic Avenue and Columbia Street. The start of Atlantic Avenue below the BQE.... the bottom of the hill.

Meeting 9 am kickstands up by 9:30 am

Brooklyn Bridge to the Holland Tunnel. ...

2nd meeting spot - Manhattan; 
Washington Street.. 1 block parallel to the West Street between Vestry Street and Desbrosses Street. Turn off of West Street on Vestry and make that 1st left... by the garages.

Meeting 10 am kickstands up 10:30 am - through the Holland Tunnel

3rd meeting spot - Jesey City NJ;
Exxon Gas Station on the right outside of the tunnel @ Marrin Blvd.... Gas up... pulling out by 11:15 latest. Here we are meeting up with John Quinones. ..'John from Jersey'; and the tour begins. ...

We will be traveling through coastal towns: Long Branch, Asbury Park, Belmar, Point Pleasant.... Final destination Seaside Heights. ETA 1 pm. 

We will eat lunch at Stewart's Rootbeer at 63-69 Broadway in Point Pleasant Beach... The owner Don and staff welcomed us last year and are anxious to see us again.

Hope to see you all there...last year was a great day well spent - our rides are always epic with a good time had by all... 

Should anyone have any problems or questions feel free to call me Ronnie[masked] or Lew[masked] Lew.

results.description:
This is a Metro North Day Excursion on the Evening Star from Peekskill NY. We will meet at the big clock at Grand Cantral Station to take the take the 9:40 train to Peekskill NY, where will will board the Evening Star for a 3 hour Cruise thru a beautiful section of the Hudson River. We will be in a Canopy covered Open deck and we will return from Peekskill to NY around 4 or 7 PM depending if we wnt to spend time in Peekskill after the cruise. Bring Picnic lunch to enjoy during the cruise. There will only be soft drinks for sale on the boat. RSVP Necessary. Limit 15 people on MU and 5 from the Yahoo OC Hiking Group. Small boat only holds 30. Excursion for Trinity Hudson River Cruise. Cost, includes train on MN and boat ticket: Adults $40.25, Senior $31.
Sarina email preferred:[masked] Tel on day prior or same day[masked]-8412. Non Members $3 Fee for OC.

Visit <a>www.trinitycruises.com,</a> You MUST reserve by calling this number RSVP[masked] and tell them you are with Sarina's Group

If you have not reserved with Trinity you must do so by 8/4 or you will be removed from the list as there are people waiting and you are taking up spots. If you do not show you cannot attend any of my excursions again. I will coordinate with them tomorrow and I will open the wait list but if you are not reserved with Trinity, you will not get on the boat!!!!

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.
results.name: 2Hrs Co-Ed Pickup Soccer Games @ Riverside Park Soccer Field

results.description:
It has been a minute since I've done one of my favorite local hikes. I need to fix that. The Giant Stairs is a unique intermediate hiking experience in the Palisades Interstate Park, the natural area just North of the George Washington Bridge. This very scenic 3.5 mile loop hike descends the Palisades cliffs, follows a challenging, rocky path along the Hudson River, passes a scenic waterfall, and climbs to reach a panoramic viewpoint over the river. I estimate the hike will take about 4 hours depending on the length of our stops.

After, we'll be heading to nearby Englewood Cliffs to replace the calories we've burned with a Korean BBQ Buffet lunch at Picnic Garden.


The important stuff ...


• You should dress for physical activity and for the weather but in layers, preferably in non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion).

• Bring 1 or 2 liters of fluid and and/or snacks with you.

• This is an intermediate-level hike and I recommend that attendees be in decent cardiovascular shape -- being a triathlete isn't necessary but "exercise" shouldn't be a four-letter word to you. We'll be scrambling over every rock and boulder we see so if that isn't your thing, keep it moving.


• Rain cancels the hike. Check your email the morning of the meetup for any last minute updates.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

Directions ...

Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway North from the George Washington Bridge. Continue for 1.7 miles beyond Exit 2, and turn right at a sign for the State Line Lookout. Follow the access road for about half a mile until it ends at a large parking lot near the lookout. (If you are coming from the North on the Parkway, bear left just beyond Exit 3 and follow the signs for the lookout). We will all meet at 9:00 AM in front of the Lookout Inn refreshment stand to begin the hike (see photo below). 

Please post if you will be driving and can give a ride to how many passengers, and from where in the comments box when you RSVP

. Passengers, please contact your driver beforehand to work out the details and as a courtesy should pick up the tabs for gas/tolls.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Hike the Giant Stairs

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
This weekend should be in the 80's so it shouldn't be too hot. Come join us for a game. This will be the last meetup this month. We will start up sometime in September depending on the weather.

Please NOTE that 8:15AM will be the cut-off time to RSVP! As the weather gets hotter we get less players. It's unfair for those that travel from Queens or other further areas to arrive and not be able to play. We need a minimum of 12 players; otherwise, we will have to cancel.


Questions or problems then give me a call at[masked] but I usually won't be answering as I'll be setting up the field or playing...

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned, permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first two games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
「中央计划2015亚太裔职业日」将于8月9日在曼哈坦华埠的纽约中华公所大礼堂举行，包括联邦、州政府和市政府机构及知名企业单位，至少30馀家机构提供就业岗位，现场提供修改履历、面试技巧等指导，主办方纽约中华总商会鼓励求职者携带履历当场进行谘询和面试。

中华总商会与亚太公共事务联盟纽约分会举办的「2015亚太裔职业日」，由中央计划健保(Centers Plan)赞助。中华总商会表示，自金融危机爆发以来，美国经济陷入低谷，就业市场萎靡不振。近几年经济有所回升，就业形势有好转，但对华裔而言，碍于语言、文化的障碍，就业需要更努力地创造机会。相信举办职业日，能为亚太裔人士争取更多的就业机会。

目前已超过30个机构进场招聘，陆续还会有公司参与到活动的招聘行列，行业种类包括公职、企业和非营利机构，包括中央计划健保、纽约州国民警卫队、联邦调查局、纽约州劳工厅、布碌崙地区检察官办公室、纽约市消防局、纽约市惩教局、纽约市警察局、纽约市选举局、宾州州警、纽约市捷运局、海关及边境保护局、可口可乐、冠军停车场、雷光达保险、协和门窗和恆通银行等30多家政府及商业机构。

電話: [masked]

results.description:
Supposed to be another nice Summer day, so come out and play. Bring your racquet and some lightly used or new balls and we'll rally and play some doubles.

Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

Transit: 6 train to last stop at Pelham Bay Park and short walk. BX5, BX12 and BX29 within walking distance.

• Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Join us for a 45-minute cross-training workout designed to build strength, flexibility and endurance in your running fitness. Each of our workouts is created and led by a certified coach who will take care to ensure you have proper form and get the most out of every session. Best of all, this morning's session will be totally free-of-charge! 

The workout will consist of a fast-paced circuit of  movement exercises and short runs that will help you to develop specific muscles, leaving you with the capacity to be stronger, faster and less prone to injury after only a few sessions.

Pricing:
Your first session is always free to try - we want you to know what you’re signing up for.

**THIS SESSION IS FREE-OF-CHARGE! JOIN US AND ENJOY A GREAT WORKOUT**  

One month of unlimited cross-training workouts is available for $30. Two months of unlimited cross-training are yours for only $50.


Disclaimer:
All fitness programs come with some risk of injury. By agreeing to participate, you confirm that you’re of adequate fitness that you can comfortably run 3-4 miles at a time. Please let your coach know of any injuries or conditions that may limit your ability to complete this session safely - safety is of primary importance, and your coach will do everything possible to make the workout safe, fun and rewarding.

and connect with us on Google+

The road to our dreams becoming a reality is not all about large miracles or waiting for a windfall of luck. It is about the every day moments that take us much closer or lead us farther away to what it is we wish to become. Join Bonni, as she guides the 2015 “EVERYDAY ALCHEMY” Symposium Expo that will provide you with a life outline to gain the personal ability to witness whether you are moving backwards or forwards down the road to your happiness.


She is an internationally recognized psychic medium, speaker and author. When not appearing on television, conducting retreats; workshops, and writing, Bonni serves an internationally diverse client base that includes many celebrities and historically significant properties. She is widely known as a down-to-earth, inspirational messenger with incredible gifts and intuitive accuracy. (Psychicbonni.com)


We would like to offer an opportunity to be participant of the “Everyday Alchemy” Symposium Expo! (COSTS: $40.00 per person) The Symposium will host: Speaker: Bonni McCliss; Guest Speaker/Demo: Kristen Arnett, Organic Make Up Artist, Panelists: Dr. Boneva (Holistic Skin Healthcare), Dr. Robins (Ozone Therapy) and Special Appearances: Dr.Luccardi (Thermography Int'l), Dr. Raff (American Stem Cell Ctr.) and Dr. Steven Giron (Adv. Higher Brain Living).

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME WILD CREVICE EXPLORATION AT MINNEWASKA STATE PARK.

Though I've previously explored these spots there will be some route finding to get to the crevices so attendees should be prepared for whatever the day may bring.  Some of these crevices will be "cave-like" in nature.  Headlamps are mandatory and helmets are recommended to have on hand but will be left optional at the attendees discretion.

On this trip you can expect to encounter "Cave-like" Crevices.  You should have good balance and be prepared for a full body workout.  I will bring some webbing to use as a hand line to assist in some more difficult to negotiate areas.

WHERE TO MEET?

WE WILL START AT THE UPPER PARKING AREA ADJACENT TO LAKE MINNEWASKA ALL THE WAY UP THE HILL AFTER PASSING THROUGH THE MAIN ENTRANCE GATE.


Distance:  approx 8 miles

Hiking Pace:  Slow but physically challenging

Estimated Hike Time:  6-7 hours

Difficulty:  Intermediate - Rocky (possibly Slippery) Terrain and Crevices with possible exposures - I will bring a 50 ft. handline to help navigate any hard terrain.

Current Weather Forecast: Partly Sunny with a high of 84 Degrees

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Helmet (Bicycle helmet will do) - Not mandatory but rocks may get kicked loose!

• Gloves - Lightweight with good grip - Gardening gloves from Home Depot work great!

• Shoes with good grip

•Headlamp with spare batteries - Home Depot has a great 100 lumen headlamp for only $12.99!

• A Small Pack - nothing too large that will become a hindrance in the scrambles

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Bug Spray, Sunscreen, etc.


RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set



HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.
results.name: CREVICE EXPLORATION at Minnewaska + HIKE to Millbrook

results.description:
http://www.groundsforsculpture.org

Nestled in the heart of central New Jersey lies Grounds For Sculpture, a magical place where art and nature are always at play. At its core are more than 270 sculptures by renowned and emerging contemporary artists, each thoughtfully positioned on meticulously landscaped parkland full of thousands of exotic trees and flowers. It is a feast for the senses.

The works, many of them monumental, include those of such distinguished artists as Clement Meadmore, Anthony Caro, Beverly Pepper, Kiki Smith, George Segal, Magdalena Abakanowicz, and Isaac Witkin. 

----------------

Directions

126 Sculptures Way, Hamilton Township, NJ 08619

From New York City:
Take New Jersey Turnpike South to Exit 7A. Take Interstate 195 West (Trenton) to Exit 60B/I-295 North (Princeton). Take I-295 North to Exit 65B/Sloan Avenue West. After exit stay in right traffic lane for 2/10ths of a mile, following signs for Grounds For Sculpture, and take the jughandle to cross over Sloan Ave. Go through the traffic light onto Klockner Rd. Take Klockner Rd. to next traffic light and turn right onto East State St. Extension. Go 8/10ths of a mile and make second left turn onto Sculptors Way. Go 2/10ths of a mile and turn left into the main entrance of Grounds For Sculpture. Travel time is approximately 75 minutes.

From South Jersey:
Take I-295 North to Exit 65B/Sloan Avenue West. After exit stay in right traffic lane for 2/10ths of a mile, following signs for Grounds For Sculpture, and take the jughandle to cross over Sloan Ave. Go through the traffic light onto Klockner Rd. Take Klockner Rd. to next traffic light and turn right onto East State St. Extension. Go 8/10ths of a mile and make second left turn onto Sculptors Way. Go 2/10ths of a mile and turn left into the main entrance of Grounds For Sculpture.

From Philadelphia:
Take Interstate 95 North, across Scudders Falls Bridge (over Delaware River), to Interstate 295 South to Exit 65B/Sloan Avenue West. After exit stay in right traffic lane for 2/10ths of a mile, following signs for Grounds For Sculpture, and take the jughandle to cross over Sloan Ave. Go through the traffic light onto Klockner Rd. Take Klockner Rd. to next traffic light and turn right onto East State St. Extension. Go 8/10ths of a mile and make second left turn onto Sculptors Way. Go 2/10ths of a mile and turn left into the main entrance of Grounds For Sculpture. Travel time is approximately 45 minutes.

From Princeton:
Take Nassau St. and turn onto Mercer St. Mercer St. will change into Princeton Pike/583 after Province Line Rd. Continue on Princeton Pike to Interstate 295. Take I-295 South (Camden) to Exit 65/Sloan Avenue West. After exit stay in right traffic lane for 2/10ths of a mile, following signs for Grounds For Sculpture, and take the jughandle to cross over Sloan Ave. Go through the traffic light onto Klockner Rd. Take Klockner Rd. to next traffic light and turn right onto East State St. Extension. Go 8/10ths of a mile and make second left turn onto Sculptors Way. Go 2/10ths of a mile and turn left into the main entrance of Grounds For Sculpture. Travel time is approximately 15 minutes.

By Train:
From New York (Penn Station) or Philadelphia (30th St. Station) take New Jersey Transit to the Hamilton stop (stop closest to Grounds For Sculpture) or Amtrak to Trenton stop. Taxi ride is 5 minutes to Grounds For Sculpture. Travel time is approximately the same as by car. You may also choose to take NJ Transit bus #608 from the Hamilton Train Station. Check http://www.njtransit.com for up-to-date schedules.

Ваши знания  и дополнения будут очень полезны

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.
