6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
We are not taking RSVP anymore for this event. It will be sold out through my other group as there is limited space. If you prepaid already than you are good to go. If not, and want to discuss, you can email me.

We start our tour off at Eataly, Chef Mario Batali’s high-end, Italian mega gorgeous food-store, which incorporates lots of food shopping and mouth-watering dining in a massive space that’s brimming with energy. Here, we will taste espresso at Caffee Lavazza serving espresso in Italy since 1895. We will learn the history of Eataly, a little about the individual restaurants there as well as the bier garten on the roof. Then it’s off to Madison Park where along the way we learn the history of the Toy Building, The Flatiron building, the initial garment district and many of the surrounding buildings and history of the Park and Madison Square Garden. We will have a burger tasting at Shake Shack (if there is no line, otherwise Schnipper’s), and then head to an international Italian mozzarella restaurant, Obica, specializing in homemade mozzarella, buratta (cheese made from mozerella and cream) and Napoleon style pizza (we will have slices and sample both their Napolean Pizza and burratta). Next we head to Beecher’s Cheese factory, an artisanal shop where staff hand-make many of the cheeses right on the premises. After a cheese course/tour and a tasting of their amazing grilled cheese sandwich, we head to Union Square and its world-famous greenmarket, which has been bringing the best of local farms to the city since 1976. Finally we head for dessert and a private tour at Bread’s Bakery, an Israeli baking company opening up multiple locations this year throughout NYC. Here we get to sample NYC # 1 rated and best babka! The tour lasts around 3 hours. You won’t walk too far (less than 7 NYC blocks), but be sure to bring comfortable shoes and dress appropriately. RSVP early. Space will be limited and will sell out.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 11-11:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff?
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday.

What time does the run actually start? 
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer than 11:15am. 


After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food nearby. Our goto place is typically Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
The purpose of this meet-up is to bring local amateur brass instrument players -- trumpet, cornet, french horn, tuba, euphonium, baritone, trombone -- together to play classical, standards, and other arrangements musically as an ensemble. We are seeking to increase our musicianship and experience in group playing.

We meet in a professional studio space around Herald Square, Manhattan. Just bring your instrument! Sheet music is supplied in advance (print-your-own) on this website under More--->Files.

Your $5 admission covers (1) MeetUp.com fees, (2) studio rental, and (3) sheet music acquisition. After we play, those who are inclined may join us for coffee or a casual bite to eat at a local venue.

New Works:
Brass Sextet (Philip Glass)
I'll Build a Stairway to Paradise (Gershwin)

Judas Maccabeus Suite (Handel)
Gavotte (Bach) - Canadian Brass arr.

results.description:
These 12 short moving qigong come directly from the original Wutang Shan martial tradition, specifically (like everything else in the internal martial arts) from the 12 Qi Disruption Methods, which is from where everything in the Chinese internal martial arts stem. Each main channel has a specific qigong form that will work on the organ/meridian function, and its Shen function as well. They also train the practitioner on how to work on qi emission through the hands, both for medical and self-defense purposes. Information will be given on when is the best time to practice these forms, and to know which one to choose and do at any given time.

Note:
These series of free classes are intended to show the both sides of the original Yang style: the ‘softer’ and internal, and the ‘harder/martial’ and external. It will also elucidate the link between the both sides of the same coin - fajing. On one side, we train it slowly, in order to train the subconscious on how to recover that natural expression of energy, and to impart it with some sophistication that makes it more suitable for our higher-goals: self-healing and medical (healing others) work. On the other, we train on how to use it for self-defense purposes, and on how it can help give us the best chance of survival when our life is in true danger.

results.description:
In this interactive workshop, you will learn how to turn a conflict into a problem that both sides want to solve. Most conflicts start off as a clash of "positions". By understanding the underlying "needs ?behind these "positions" and then "reframing" the conflict as a problem that all involved want to solve collaboratively , conflict can bring us closer together rather than tearing us apart.
Ellen Raider is the former Training Director of the International Center for Cooperation and Conflict Resolution at Teachers College, Columbia University.

results.description:
We've been meaning to get the North Jersey tech & entrepreneur scene together for a fun day since last year, and the time is finally coming.  Join us for a relaxed day with food, drinks, merriment, giveaways and some Meetup-y activity at a really cool park on the Hudson. We'll supply a bunch of food and drinks, but we'd love for some people to also bring along some of their favorite dishes (no obligation of course). 

Some fun events we're planning: 

1) Startup pitches (If you're a founder and would like to be considered, fill out our Founder's Profile if you haven't previously done so). 

2) Awards for some of our most loyal followers 

3) Ultimate frisbee 

We'll be partnering with a number of other Meetup groups such as LaunchNJ, Scarlet Startups, GNEC and Montclair Entrepreneurs, so opportunities to meet some new people should be in abundance. 

Exact location and time has a chance to change slightly, so make sure to check back later on.
results.name: 1st Annual North Jersey Tech & Entrepreneur Cookout

venue.name: meet on the steps of the Alexander Hamilton Customs House

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up group reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions about this activity  contact the event host [masked].

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Socialize and get a great workout all with one of NYC's most unique and fun adventures! Our Manhattan Broadway Tour is one of our most popular events!

We'll begin the day at Bowling Green and work our way up historic Broadway all the way to Times Square! Along the way our tour guide will share with you the history of how New York City grew up along this old Native American Indian path that is now the most famous road in the world.

It is a great afternoon to meet other fun people in our group and experience the city in a way you never have before. So many of us take for granted the history, architecture, and diversity of the city we live in and this is a great way for native New Yorkers and those new to the area to really appreciate our magnificent city!

Along the way our guide will give you a detailed history of each part of the city and show amazing photo's from the 1800’s and early 1900’s that will show you many buildings and structures that are still here and incorporated into today’s landscape .

You will also see:

-The Customs House
-A fence from the 1600's
-Trinity and St Paul's Churches and grave stones dating back to 1600's
-Photo's of the 1920's Wall Street Bombing
-Park Row once “newspaper row” and the theater district.
-Union Square home of many social protests
-Madison Square, home of the first 2 Madison Square Garden's, the Flat Iron Building and much more!
-Herald Square site of the 6th ave Elevated train, Macy's and a rich history.
-Time's Square's seedy past and bright future.
-Plus: The Hippodrome, The African American Burial Ground and much more!

What to wear: Comfortable shoes

What to bring: 2 liters of water.

Walk Specifications: 5 miles, will take about 4 1/2 hours with a stop along the way for a rest, food and bathroom.

Can I come alone?

  Yes this is a great event to come on your own. 98% of those attending come alone.  There are always great conversations about the things you will be seeing.

Cost:  $25 includes the tour only.  Bring cash for lunch.  Please bring exact change

How many will be coming? We normally have 15-20 on the tour. Ages 20's-40's What if it rains? We will send a message to all who register by 9am Saturday morning
results.name: The Ultimate NYC Walking Tour For New Yorkers: Bowling Green to Times Square

results.description:
We love our friends over at CFI-NYC and we love brunch. So this is perfect! Every 2nd and 4th Sunday of the month.

From CFI-NYC Meetup:

Fancy a midday helping of open-ended intellectual exchange? Join a small group of aspiring critical thinkers for great, inexpensive food and lively discussion of topics relating to skepticism, secularism, science, philosophy, psychology, and other matters of the mind. We will meet outside, take a head count, and head inside as a group at 11 a.m. sharp. (If you arrive late, you're welcome to join us if sufficient seating is available, but there are no guarantees!) This event is tentatively scheduled for the second and fourth Sunday of each month.

results.description:
Ditch the sugar! Come learn how sugar is the real culprit leading to weight gain and diseases.

Are you ready to end your sugar cravings? Do you crave sweets and it’s getting the best of you?

 Are you the type of person who has cravings for sweets?  Do you have low energy in the middle of the day?  If so, then this workshop will be a turning point in your life.I’ve designed this class to permanently change your relationship with sugar. You will leave this class understanding the causes of your sugar cravings and you’ll receive practical tools for dealing with them.


 It’s not about depravation, it’s about freedom – the freedom to eat foods you love and have sweetness in your life without the side effects or the guilt.

Come join me for this free workshop. Samples will be served!

Change your Energy, Change your Life!

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
Reflective Circle Discussion: "Strangers"


Details: How comfortable are you with people who are different from you? With the internet and social media, we interact with more strangers and different points of view than ever before. Although we come across strangers on a daily basis, many in our society have persistent prejudice and lack compassion for those who are different from them. The beauty of our interactions with others are the opportunities for learning and self growth. Join us for this participative, guided sharing of feelings and thoughts in which we will ponder how we approach strangers. 

Sunday programs are held at 11:00 AM at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. For more information, please visit our website: <a>http://www.rysec.org</a>;

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).
Every third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.
This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is FREE.  There is a suggested donation of $10 or whatever you feel comfortable with, as I do expend fees for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
This form is the first self-defense form or training drill that we learn in the Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Chuan system. It is a form that covers every possible defense and counter attack we might find in a real confrontation, and trains our subconscious to react properly in such situations. It also strengthens our muscles, sinews and joints in order to be healthy to defend our life. The series of intricate and specific movements also trains the practitioner in the usage of the correct muscles to strike and to perform fajing (explosive energy). Needless to say, like any other training method in the system, it also improves our self-healing and our ability to heal others, by combining forcefully our mind’s intent with our qi, and teach them how to work together. This is a form that was developed by Yang Shouzhong, Yang Cheng-fu’s eldest son, in order to bring back the Yang energy element stripped in the simplifications made by his father to the original form. 

Note:

These series of free classes are intended to show the both sides of the original Yang style: the ‘softer’ and internal, and the ‘harder/martial’ and external. It will also elucidate the link between the both sides of the same coin - fajing. On one side, we train it slowly, in order to train the subconscious on how to recover that natural expression of energy, and to impart it with some sophistication that makes it more suitable for our higher-goals: self-healing and medical (healing others) work. On the other, we train on how to use it for self-defense purposes, and on how it can help give us the best chance of survival when our life is in true danger.

Now that the political season is starting, It's time to get out of our bubbles. Let's go and see "Public Enemies," a documentary on how two towering public intellectuals, William F. Buckley Jr. and Gore Vidal, debated each other in 1968 and started a new era in public discourse. It wasn't always civilized, but real issues were debated. We'll be catching the matinee at 12:15 on Sunday, August 9th, followed by lunch at the Belgian beer bar Vol de Nuit. Hopefully, we will not be talking politics but taking a skeptical look at what political discourse is and what it should be.

You will need to purchase your own movie ticket! We will meet in front of the IFC theater at noon on Sunday before proceeding inside for the matinee.

results.description:
Are You A Highly Sensitive Person or Empath?

An individual who is known to feel other people’s energy and emotions is known to be an empath. A highly sensitive individual has spiritual, emotional and energetic perceptions. This physical and emotional trait is inherited. One out of five Americans has the trait of sensitivity. All sensitives aren't empaths but all empaths are sensitive. In this workshop we will learn the differences between sensitivity and empathy. We will also explore some of the physical, emotional, spiritual and mental manifestations which come from being born sensitive.

Can you identify with the following?


Being labeled as too emotional or sensitive?
Are your feelings hurt easily?
Do you get overstimulated when under pressure?
Do you feel nervous or anxious around loud noises, weird smells or textures, and bright lights?
Do you find that you eat, drink, smoke or use recreational drugs to turn yourself off, emotionally and mentally?

In this workshop we will learn how to manage our sensitivity through learning about the spiritual gift of sensitivity and empathy. We will also learn about highly sensitive people and empaths through my personal teachings and the teachings of Dr Elaine Aran, the author of the Highly Sensitive Person and Dr. Michael R. Smith the author of the Empath Connection.

To REGISTERon line please click on the link.
http://flowlifenyc.com/event/empath-and-sensitive-beginners-workshop-laura-schwalm/?instance_id=11258

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate 
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

All are welcome to come out and play during these pick-up games whether you are a current player or have never picked up a broom. The Badassilisks will gladly teach you the game so that you can get on the pitch and have some fun!


We look forward to seeing you!

Note: there are always a bunch of people who come who don't RSVP, so we'll have a good crowd.
results.how_to_find_us: When you enter the park the team will be in the open clearing on your left.
results.name: Badassilisks Open Summer Pick-Up Matches!

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
In house expert Dave Brusca discusses how to improve your filmmaking technique in this intermediate workshop. Speaking from years of broadcast and independent filming experience, Dave will touch on working with your camera and lenses, basic camera motions, basic audio tips, and using the right light.

His seminar will discuss how focal length and aperture affect your shot; the advantages of different lenses; the proper use of tripod, slider, and stabilized shots; when to use different types of microphones and how their pick up patterns will affect your recording; and differences in lighting fixtures and color temperatures.

Breakdown for this event:

1) Working with your camera and lenses

  a. How focal length and aperture affect the shot

  b. Advantages of different lenses

  c. Log, raw, and Rec. 709

   d. Exposure tools and white balance

2) Basic camera motion

  a. Tripod, slider/dolly, steadicam, electronic stabilizers

  b. How shot framing affects the mood

3) Basic audio tips

a. When to use different types of microphones (lavalier, shotgun, handheld)

  b. Mic pickup patterns and audio recording tips

4) Using the right light

  a. Differences in lighting fixtures (tungsten, LED, fluorescent, HMI)

  b. Color temperature, light spectrum, CRI

Bring a notebook and your eagerness to learn! This seminar will run from 12 noon to 3:30 PM with breaks.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/DavidBrusca_HEAD.jpg?itok=df01uSbS David Brusca is a NYC based Director and DP, with over a decade of experience in film making and ENG video production. He has worked in TV broadcasting, for local film festivals, and freelance production. Dave can be seen assisting Daniel Norton every Thursday, with the FREE weekly in-store trainings.
results.name: SEMINAR: Film Making with David Brusca

results.description:
This weekend Flushing Meadow, the fourth largest park in NYC, hosts the annual Hong Kong Dragon Boat festival, featuring rowing races on the city's biggest lake; music and dance; and ethnic food. But first we'll we'll view the inspiring remnants of the 1939 and 1964 World's Fairs, then visit the Queens Museum of Art (pay what you wish), featuring a 9300 square-foot scale replica of every single building in NYC built before 1992 as well as Citifield, the Mets' new baseball stadium. After lunch and the races, we'll walk around the lake, where we'll see shore birds and wild plants seldom seen in the city. Finally, we may take the subway one stop to the big Asian food court in Flushing, if enough of us have the time and energy. 


PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 4-5 miles

FINISH AT: Around 5 PM though you can leave earlier, of course.


COST: Pay what you wish for the museum; $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup’s recently increased organizer fee; and whatever you spend for lunch

LUNCH: Bring your own or be prepared for possibly long lines at the Asian food court. We'll start our late lunch at around 2:30 PM.

TRANSPORTATION: Number 7 train to Mets-Willetts Point Station. Consult hopstop.com, tripplanner.mta.info, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Also check http://web.mta.info/weekender.html for weekend service changes on your trains.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. Long wait lists have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. And you can come if you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer--not an app or mobile device) at any time before the walk starts. If you can't come, no need to let me know. But please change your RSVP online. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up.

results.description:
There is always high demand for figure sessions, but I don't have the time to organize more. So my friend (artist extraordinaire) Simon has offered to host some weekly sessions. These events won't impact the regular schedule of the group; they're additional. Hope to see you there! - Jesse

Join us for Saturday figure sketching, at a beautiful space conveniently located in Union Square! We'll be in Suite 505.

Unlike our outdoor Meetups, this one costs money so we can pay for the space and models. It's $15 per person, pay at the door. These sessions tend to be in high demand, so only RSVP if you are pretty sure you will attend! If not, please open the spot for someone else.

Any problems on the day of the event, Simon can be reached at [masked]. 

Looking forward to sketching with you!


What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!


• We sketch for a bit, and then take a break and share our drawings. Then we sketch some more, etc.

• Feel free to bring any media you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos (not of the model) to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• The event will last three hours.

• Everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to the attending list.


Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Weekly Figure Drawing in Union Square

Hey guys! We've had some really awesome games recently. It's so great to see everyone improving together, and also really nice to meet all the new members! As a thank you, I may be baking some treats for you guys :) 

Let's keep the momentum going and return to our home courts at Chelsea Park! I picked Sunday because there's a slightly higher chance of rain on Saturday, but it will be humid and very sunny. Please please bring extra water, dress lightly, and be ready to kill some shots :p

Directions: C or E train to 23rd St. Or 1 train to 28th St. Or N or R train to 28th St. When you get off either train just walk to West 28th St & 9th Ave. The park is located on West 28th between 9th and 10th ave. ave. Feel free to message me if you have issues finding us!


Weather Notice: Right now, the weather forecast predicts temperatures to be in the mid-80s. The chance of precipitation is 9% so *fingers crossed*. 

Cancellation Notice: Meetup cancellations only happen upon bad weather or low RSVP count. Hope to see you guys there!

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of Union Square.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  


• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Sunday, August 9th @ 1 PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday.


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.

August 9, 2015

Magickal Record Keeping of a Witch

Grimoire Dream Journal Personal Journal Phases of Your Book of Shadows Working Book of Shadows Your Charmed Book of Shadows Dream Workings

Dreaming meanings Interpretations Dream Journals $25 in person/$27 via paypal - PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

 

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.  Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

Hey all - below are two photos for getting to the meeting area. Please give Daniel a call/text at[masked] if you have any questions. As always with park events, feel free to bring a picnic blanket or lawn chair to get comfortable.

The first image below is the view of St. Nicholas Park from 135th Street and St. Nicholas Ave, in front of the 135th street subway station (trains B & C). You want to take the right-side staircase, as pointed by the red arrow.

Next, continue to follow the path to another short flight of stairs. A several steps past this next flight of stairs, you'll see three large trees - one v-shaped and two straight trees. To the left of the v-shaped tree, in the main grass area - that's where we'll meet. See the photo below:


Of course, you don't have to sit with the group - you are welcome to go anywhere you'd like in the park to enjoy the festivities. Have a great day!


-Daniel 

Harlem enjoys a rich history of music, culture and community that connects all people from all corners of the globe. Sundae Sermon seeks to continue this tradition with a simple and soulful day of dancing under the Uptown sun.

Sundae Sermon is an afternoon in the park of music, dancing, family and community commerce.

http://youtu.be/oVQ92iAcjLk

The foundation of the sound of Sundae Sermon is positive house music and peaceful tribal vibes. The spirit of house music comes from the church; so it's only befitting house music should be the cornerstone of this public dance-party. New and old house, blended with classic R&B (Barry White, Stevie Wonder), Disco (Thelma Houston), Funk (Parliament), Soul (James Brown, TSOP), Afro-Beat (Fela) and Salsa/Boogaloo (Oscar De Leon). All musical genres that cross generations and borders. This is music that makes people feel good! Beautiful Morningside Park is the perfect location for a diverse audience of all ages and cultures to enjoy a fun afternoon of music and relaxation. To learn more, please visit www.sundaesermon.com for more info!

http://youtu.be/QHjFgtT74Po

Our Meetup

The Sundae Sermon starts at 1pm, but we'll meetup at 1:30pm to get a good spot on the hill (in the shade) like you see in the videos above. More information will be posted closer to the date.

Directions to St. Nicholas Park (the main entrance):
Subway: The C or B local trains to 135th Street and St Nicholas Avenue. That's it - the main entrance and the setup will be right there near the park entrance.
Bus: Take the #M3 bus to 135th Street & St. Nicholas Ave, or take the #M10 to 135th Street and Frederick Douglass Avenue (8th Ave) and walk one avenue west (toward the park) to St. Nicholas Avenue.

Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event: 

http://nyadventureclub.ticketmob.com/event.cfm?id=106789&cart

Join New York Adventure Club on Sunday, August 9th, for a special-access tour through the abandoned bunkers of Fort Tilden, a former WWI & WWII U.S. Army Coast Artillery Post, and Cold War Nike Missile Installation.

Our behind-the-scenes tour throughout this historic fort will include a walk around the former military fortifications, and an exclusive visit to military bunkers normally closed to the public. 

Afterwards, we'll grab some sun, beach, food, and drinks at Rockaway Beach!


What to Expect

Established in 1917, Fort Tilden is named for Samuel Tilden, who served as Governor of New York from 1875 to 1876. It was the most modern addition to the fortifications of New York Harbor intended to defend the city from attack by sea and air. Through four decades the fort's defenses were upgraded with the technologically advanced weaponry of succeeding generations, including smooth-bore cannons, sixteen inch naval rifles, and Nike Ajax and Hercules air defense missiles.

Eventually its weaponry became obsolete, and the fort was decommissioned as a military installation in 1974. It was then transferred to the control of the National Park Service.
results.name: NYAC Experience: Special Access Bunker Tour @ Fort Tilden

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

The evening's focus will be on "older," "more popular" games (such as Catan, Carcassonne, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Ticket to Ride, Power Grid, etc.) so that newer players can get a solid introduction to these new styles of board games. results.description:
This month's book is Assassin's Apprentice by Robin Hobb.

In a faraway land where members of the royal family are named for the virtues they embody, one young boy will become a walking enigma.

Born on the wrong side of the sheets, Fitz, son of Chivalry Farseer, is a royal bastard, cast out into the world, friendless and lonely. Only his magical link with animals - the old art known as the Wit - gives him solace and companionship. But the Wit, if used too often, is a perilous magic, and one abhorred by the nobility.

So when Fitz is finally adopted into the royal household, he must give up his old ways and embrace a new life of weaponry, scribing, courtly manners; and how to kill a man secretly, as he trains to become a royal assassin.

This book is available at Amazon, Barnes & Noble, or Kobo, digital or otherwise.

* * *


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY

If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:
http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/


* * *


Questions and answers!

Where will we be meeting?

We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There's an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labeled.

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the atrium.

There is a lift down the stairs on the right side of the corridor as you're coming from the fountain.

There's also free wi-fi and restrooms if you need them.

How will I recognize the group when I get there?

We're generally pretty easy for newcomers to recognize--if in doubt, look for paper copies of the book on tables, or a group of excited-looking people with lots of electronic reading devices. We'll try to recognize you from your picture; if in doubt, feel free to walk up and ask people!

Do I need to finish the whole book?

Nope! You're welcome to come either way. However, the whole book is fair game for discussion, including the ending!

How are the books chosen?

We try to select the next book and date of the meetup after we're finished discussing the book. We sometimes do this by poll, selected from the attendees' suggestions -- if so, the attendees will be invited to vote on the website by email. Sometimes we'll all jump on an appealing suggestion, or sometimes I'll get bored of posting polls and just pick one by fiat.

What books has the club read in the past?

We've compiled a list. (Thanks to Sarah for compiling this for us!)

I have another question!

You're welcome to message me through the website, or comment here. 

Thanks for signing up, and I hope to see you there!

Also, join our Goodreads group!

http://www.goodreads.com/group/show/57070.NY_Fantasy_Book_Club
results.name: Fantasy Book Club: Assassin's Apprentice by Robin Hobb

This will be an easy breezy slow and easy hike about 1.5 miles to top of the hill to the lake; round trip 3 miles total. We are heading out to the lake for a relaxing swim picnic!!! Remember the hottest part of the day is at 4 o'clock by the time we get to the top it will be 3 o clock Dont forget a swimming suit, goggles, snorkel, kickboard, pull buoy,...lol towel, sun screen, yoga mat or a pad for sitting, food & shades. I plan on spending a few hours at the lake Before heading back down to the bar one half a mile from where the car is parked for some refreshing beverages socializing and good lakefront food, there are a couple of good places to choose from right on Greenwood Lake. the trailhead and parking lot is just across the street from this address up the hill to the end of the lot by the trailhead sign in the porta potty.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Beginner hike & Swim to surprise Lake!!!!

You'll get plenty of playing time with people willing to give you pointers and let you do your thing on the field. Play as much or as little as you like and get some throwing practice in.

Bring a white and dark shirt and water and whatever else you might need to rock socks at frisbee.

See you there,

tim

results.description:
For our next book event, we will be covering Ira Levin's The Stepford Wives. If you prefer short stories, this one is a quick read. It's only 144 pages. Love Cafe has comfortable seating with couches in the back area. We look forward to hearing your opinion and interpretation of the story. 

Story line: For Joanna, her husband, Walter, and their children, the move to beautiful Stepford seems almost too good to be true. It is. For behind the town's idyllic facade lies a terrible secret -- a secret so shattering that no one who encounters it will ever be the same.
results.name: Book Discussion - The Stepford Wives
