results.description:
Hello everyone! My friend Marisa recently started a weekly food social event in NYC, and I would like to help her to look for people to attend her event. I don't know if this is the right place to post, if you don't like my suggestions, I can stop posting here. But you might think this is something you would be interested :D

Below is more detailed info:

Dear Friends of Tagine Join us for a delightful cooking class and dinner in our favorite Moroccan Restaurant. Now that you had a chance to taste our exotic authentic Moroccan cuisine, we would like to invite you to participate in the preparation of this delicious meal. Our beloved and cheerful chef Hamid, will guide us through preparing homemade bread, two appetizers, three entrées as well as dessert. After we have sliced, diced and mixed, the entire group will sit down together and enjoy the delicious multi course dinner we have created. At the end of the evening you will return home with a full belly and wonderful new recipes in hand! Each class will be 3 hours long and will include: 
A verbal introduction to Moroccan food 
Note-taking is recommended, and we welcome photos and video. 
Moroccan mint tea will flow throughout the event.

Includes Moroccan Wine or Sangria 
Gratuity is not included and tipping is optional.

More Info by Clicking Here!

Hi all!! we invite you to Join us this Sunday afternoon August 9 at House of Brews from  3-5PM for a great painting event.

Instruction, a pre-sketched canvas, unlimited acrylic paint (water based) is the medium and painting supplies, brushes, aprons, easels and  are all included. Student will learn the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques from an accredited artist. 

NYC Tipsy Painters is a painting party class where students enjoy a cocktail or 2, enjoy some backround music as they participate in an instructional painting event. This class is appropriate for beginners, intermediate and advanced artists! 


To view past parties please go to our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Painting-Party-with-StelnikArt-Soirée/[masked] 

A very small pre-payment R.S.V.P. and a 2 drink minimum is required in our private lounge environment

Staten Island Beach Fest, 2015- an 8 weekend summer festival beginning July 18 and ending September 6, designed to highlight the recovery of Staten Island's beaches and waterfront parks following Super Storm Sandy. 


SIBF will offer family friendly activities in five locations South beach, Midland Beach, Ferry Promenade, Borough Hall Park, and the Conference House, simultaneously so no one will have to travel far and everyone will have something interesting to do in their backyard.

• lose weight while having fun

results.description:
The skill level will vary, we all want to have a good time and enjoy our beautiful afternoon.  Bring a fun , positive, enthusiastic attitude.  


We will have 3 teams, 21 players.Teams rotate after 2 goals or 10 minutes of playing time. The game is 7-a-side: 6 outfield players and a keeper. Players are expected to take turns in goals unless someone chooses to play as a designated  keeper. 

Bring a dark and white shirt.

Turf shoes  and shin guards are important. 


We'll play for 10 minutes before switching. Teams will then be mixed up to allow you to play with others and keep balanced teams

venue.name: Packanack Lake Tennis Club, Clay Courts

results.description:
Hello Everyone!

ALL LEVELS WELCOME


Also check out my website www.tennis-buffs.com



Packanack Lake Tennis Club (only 20-30 min from the GWB)

9 Osborne Terrace, Wayne 07470

10 outdoor red clay and hard courts

$40 includes tennis, balls and BBQ

 

All levels welcome


IF YOU'RE SIGNING UP THROUGH MEETUP AND IT'S YOUR FIRST TIME -- YOU MUST CALL OR EMAIL ME.  I would like to stagger players to come different hours.

Spend Sunday afternoon with old and new friends playing tennis and having BBQ at Packanack Lake!  For those who haven't been to the Lake, it's like being at a resort or in your own backyard with a nice deck, overlooking clay courts.  When you are there, you will not think about anything else except fun and relaxation.  All levels are welcome.  You will play 3 hours of tennis depending on how many people sign up.  Bring your friends and families.  The More the Merrier!


 

GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENTS
RESPECT FOR SPACE WE SHARE
Please pick up after yourself when you finish eating.  It spoils the environment for everybody else while they're sitting out and socializing during their off hour, sharing the same area.  It's nice to have respect for the space we all share.  Please help me, as I'm juggling many things to create a fun evening for everyone.

BALLS ON COURT
A friendly reminder, please find the 3 balls that you played with and place them by the net for the next group of players.  Often people cannot find the balls or they are mixed in with old balls, not ones from the night's party.

HAND BALLS TO SERVER
Be considerate and wait for the server or the partner to turn around before sending balls over the net.  It's safer, saves time and just good court etiquette.

BE SUPPORTIVE OF YOUR PARTNER
Every once in a while we need to be reminded that we keep a positive attitude on the court.  People come for the enjoyment of the game and to meet other people in a social setting.  Please be a sportsman and be supportive of your partner.  It isn't fun for anyone on the court to see discontent being shown through facial expressions, body language or even scolding.  Let's keep the parties fun and enjoy the evening.

 


Look forward to meeting old and new friends at the next parties!

Thanks,
Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com - website
[masked] - email address
<a>[masked]</a> - Home/Office
<a>[masked]</a> - Cell
results.name: Outdoor Tennis Social at Packanack Lake Tennis Club in Wayne

results.description:
No experience necessary for this friendly afternoon workshop, where you'll learn how to rest your body and mind through calm awareness techniques and mindful movement.    Break the cycle of worrying about the future and regretting the past and learn to truly relax. 


"Yoga For Tired People", is our studio's motto, and this special event will be taught by experienced yoga instructor, Kim Stetz, and meditation teacher, Kim Brown. 


Savasana Station is located on 13th Street between Avenues A & B.  Our entrance is on 13th Street next to the large mural of Robin Williams. The building is on the south east corner of Ave B and 13th.

We're offering this 2-hour introductory class for only $30.  You must pre-register to save your spot:


http://www.savasanastation.com/workshops/2015/6/25/intro-to-your-mind-and-body

results.description:
Hello World Citizens,

NYC WORLD Tournament 2015!!

How do I join the tournament?

There are 3 ways to join the tournament:

1. First way to join is by clicking on any of the links below and join the listed team (if the team does not have a captain, you can become the captain. Please e-mail Aia to become a captain. All teams must have a captain. If you don't see your country email Aia and she will open the team.

UNITED NATIONS (NOW OPEN) (OFFICIAL)

SWITZERLAND (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

NETHERLANDS (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

UNITED STATES (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

CHINA (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

VENEZUELA (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

VATICAN CITY (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

SPAIN (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

TREATY SYSTEM OF ANTARCTICA (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

ITALY (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

CROATIA (1 Spot left) (OFFICIAL)

PHILIPPINES (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

GREECE (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

ICELAND (2 Spots left) (OFFICIAL)

GRAN COLOMBIA (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

TURKEY (FULL) (OFFICIAL)

2. The second way to join is as an individual player. To join as an individual player please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)


3. The third way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please contact Aia or Paul for a special team discount. Thank you!

How will the tournament work?

- We are looking to register 16 or 24 or 30 teams.

- Once teams are registered, we will have a team draw to create groups.

- The first round consists of 3 games.

- The top 2 teams in each group will make it to the knockout round (sudden elimination round)

What's the cost and what is the refund policy?

- $47 dollars for individual players. If you join as an individual player, we will place you on a team.

- If you have a team already please contact us for our special reduced team fee.

- The deadline to receive a refund is July 1st.

What's included?

- 3 first round games (half of the teams will move to the next round).

- Hired referees

- Permit fees

- FIFA match balls 

-League and website administration

- Trophies and metals for first and second place winners

When do we play?

See schedule on this link: SCHEDULE 

Where will we play?

Riverside Park & 103d St, New York, NY, New York, NY

What are the rules and level of play?

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper)

- Co-ed.(no minimum women required on the field) 

-Full size goals.

- Two 30 minute halves.

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level, you would be considered Advanced.

- No sliding. You must wear turf shoes or running shoes. NO CLEATS ALLOWED. YOU WILL NOT BE ALLOWED TO PLAY WITH CLEATS OF ANY TYPE. YOU MUST WEAR TURF OR RUNNING SHOES.

- For the full set of rules follow this link: RULES

Here are some pics of our NYC WORLD CUP 2010 final between United Nations and Colombia: NYCWC 2010 Final Pics

** PLEASE NOTE: You cannot RSVP until you have paid here via PayPal. Once the tournament is full, we will open up a waiting list for those that didn't get a chance to register.**
results.name: NYC WORLD CUP TOURNAMENT 2015- July 11 to August 9

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we play...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!

results.description:
Multi-language picnic! PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY, READ all of description below so you're informed!  :)

We will meet BY THE BENCH at park entrance with FLAGS or a MEETUP SIGN from 3:50-4:10 PM.

If you would like to attend, you must bring either:

a) FOOD (would be great if relevant to your language but not necessary)!
b) DRINK with plenty of disposable cups (2 large bottles at least)!
c) SUPPLIES, paper plates, napkins, forks (& knives, spoons) trash bags!

If you do not bring food you must contribute $5. It is $1 to attend. This is a picnic! the idea is to share! Bring food, so you don't have to pay the $5!

You can either make or buy something but whatever you bring should be able to be shared with your language group. GUYS especially, you should spend at least $5 on something, it's totally not enough to just bring a bottle of water or a roll of napkins, (or 3 old bananas!), if you don't know what to bring follow the "abc" choice list above! Please be considerate to other members.

We will be mostly sitting on the grass. Bring a sheet to sit on & proper attire, forecast says 75! We will split off into small groups by language and spread out into conversational language practice groups of Spanish, English, French, Portuguese, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Hebrew, German, Arabic & Russian.

You will have option to meet us at a specific corner between 3:50 and 4:10 (20 minutes). If you're not familiar with Central Park, please be on time, and meet us at corner, otherwise it will be difficult to find us!

IMPORTANT RULES
1. Please CHECK-IN with us as soon as you get in for a name tag!

2. We are asking all members to spend at least 1/4 of their time HELPING out in their native language! That way we all help each other, you meet people interested in your culture and you make more friends!

3. Please CLEAN UP after yourselves! (coffee cups, papers, etc) Members who don't will be removed from our group!

4. Fee will be charged $1 for the event

5. If you bring nothing you must pay $5 to attend.

6. If you can't come to the event please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come. (members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group)

7. If you come to this event is because you agree to our rules above. We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members. 

*BRINGING KIDS: Due to some experiences and comments we had in previous events. We don't encourage anyone to bring kids to the picnic. You can bring them only if:

1. They are also learning a language.

2. You will have your attention on them 100% of the time. If you just sit in your language group and let them unattended you will be removed from the group.
results.name: Language Exchange Picnic! 10+ Languages!

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

The Making of Spell Candles

Adding Colors                                                                      

Tools needed

$25 + $15 supplies

Sometimes one needs to create a spell that needs to be done more than once or you may wish to make and prepare a candle to honor deity or an ancestor. This class will teach you just that.  From the history of using candles, color usage, what tools you will need and how to make your own spell candle from scratch using paraffin wax, herbs, oils etc.  You will go home with a completed small uncrossing spell candle and the knowledge on how to create other types of candles at home.

Vortex Healing® is a energy therapy modality that works with divine healing energy and divine consciousness that is channeled through my being into the client. When this happens a form of multi-dimensional healing occurs that becomes literally, spiritually, emotionally, physically, and even karmically transformational. Vortex Healing® works directly from the realm of divine consciousness. When you receive a healing you receive from a multitude of energetic and divine frequencies simultaneously. There are many levels to our consciousness, some containing the deepest and hardest to reach levels of negative conditioning, karma, and trauma. Vortex Healing® reaches all these levels. Vortex Healing® creates powerful and accelerated healing for the deepest of blocks, negative patterns and emotional trauma. It heals and transforms the very fabric of your reality. All negativity, disharmony, struggle, and even negative karma fall away to bring about incredible breakthroughs, freedom from the deepest of trauma, and a great opening to the flow of fulfillment and abundance. The divine frequencies used can reprogram core belief systems and negative emotional patterns that will bring more harmony and fulfillment both in your inner and outer reality. It also releases the illusion of separation consciousness, so each healing session brings you even deeper into your most highest divine expression. My Certification level is Merlin’s Grace, one the most powerful levels of the Vortex Healing®. I have been practicing in the West Village for 14 years.

On my level of certification I can heal up to 30 people at once. During the group healing I will introduce the many different healing frequencies to your system starting with: deep relaxation, energizing, healing structures, then the very profound core healing. Core healing will include a very intense karmic healing that afterwards will bring very powerful and magical transformational resolve of issues in ones inner and outer reality.

http://www.simondeacon.com/

Admission - $35

results.description:
On Aug. 9th we will be holding an open house for our Shamanic training program. Come explore what the year will be like.

Our intention for the evening with be to discuss Shamanic meditation, ceremony and Journeys. We will talk about the philosophy of shamanic practice and do a Journey to find our Sacred space and our animal totem. If you have already done these journeys you can still come and sharpen your relationship with these guides.

Finally we will open it up to questions regarding the training program. We hope to see you there.


September 2015 we will start our 2nd year long shamanic training program at Neolyth. The facilitators will be Brian McGuire, Karuna Ma and Leigh Higgins. The first of 4 intensive weekends will kick off our training program near the autumn equinox. What comes after will be an amazing year full of love, light and connection for you, your soul and a deeper understanding of your path in life. If you are interested in the program or know of someone that would be, please contact me to find out more and register. [masked]
This training may challenge you in your life as it shakes up our perspective and gets us more in tuned with our selves. Throughout the year we work with our integrity and our intentions and search for that place of authenticity. Here are the details that may help you decide if this is the right program for you.
1. We will start the program close to the Autumn Equinox and will continue for 12 months full circle with a final initiation ceremony at the end of our cycle.
2. Your commitment to the program will be $1200 for the full year and this fee will include the following.
• 4 Intensive weekend workshops ending with a final Rites of Passage event. These events will also follow the equinoxes and solstices. The weekends will be held from 6:00PM - 10:00PM on both Saturday and Sunday of each of the weekends.
• You will also have access to a web based discussion group for you and the other participants to comment on your path through the teachings.
• Individual mentoring by our Neolyth teaching staff and with in-depth feedback based on the options you choose to explore as they relate to your personal path of discovery and healing.
• A monthly meeting either in person at Neolyth or as a discussion group via the Internet.
• You will get free admission to any of the Hoboken Shamanic Drum Circle events as well as Montclair Shamanic Circle events (with the exception of events not run by me or the other Neolyth staff) and hopefully take on a more active role in growing our community.
• You will also have the opportunity to help setup and prepare the space with us before the sacred ceremonies to also learn and work with these rituals. Knowledge and experientially-based topics and practices to be explored:
• Shamanic Lore
• Sacred Preparation Work
• Shamanic Journey Experience
• Sacred tool crafting
• Rites of Passage
• Journal work
• Glossary work
• Finally, a deep connection to your soul. A 50% deposit is due on registration. If you want to join the program and feel that you may not be able to for financial reasons, please contact us to see if we are able to work out an alternate payment schedule or possibly a barter arrangement in lieu of some of the fees.
Please be in touch to ask any questions about the program. Best,
The Neolyth shamanic training team
results.name: Introduction to Neolyth Shamanic Training

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson for this second chapter of Wildpig Exclusive "Sailing Against the Wind" for PCs of level 4! This free character building session is so that you can ask Noah questions, become acquainted with the environment, and meet your fellow players. New players are welcome and encouraged! Returning players, bring your character from last chapter to this character building session to level up.

The battle ended poorly. Terrible beasts and deadly magic set both Pirate and Navy adrift. Now, with only wreckage between them and open ocean around them, two foes must become one crew. Perhaps then, they may survive. Will you find salvation... or ultimate sacrifice?

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Let's get together and talk about poly, our poly lives, support each other in dealing with poly issues, and above all, have fun. We meet between 5:00 and 7:00 If enough folks are interested, we can continue the discussion after the meeting over dinner at a nearby restaurant. Potluck snacks are welcome. We ask a donation of $5 to help cover room rental costs, but no one is turned away because they can't afford it. We want you there more than we want the money.

Note that this meetup is announced here and in several other places, and people sometimes come without signing up, so the signup list bears little resemblance to the actual attendance. All poly, poly curious, and poly friendly people are welcome regardless of sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, or any of the other things some groups use to discriminate.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the 2nd Floor in Room #2

results.description:
Register here:  http://nycgrace.org/pages/upcomingEvents.aspx?fsId=1&itemId=101&returnUrl=/pages/upcomingEvents.aspx

Not many songs are more cherished than Amazing Grace.  And yet, when you know the story behind the author, John Newton, and how he came “out of the depths” of despair, you will never sing this song the same again.  We invite you to join us for an evening with Newton; come and enjoy “Out of the Depths,” a drama performed by an excellent group of high school students. The drama will survey the life of John Newton and include several of his original hymns including Amazing Grace.  

Space is limited to these two performances. To ensure your seat, you can register ahead of time on our website (graceofforesthills.com ).  If you are not able to register, seating/availability is on a first come first seated basis.  A nice meal will also be provided free of charge.

A Dinner Theater at Grace

Saturday, August 8th—5:00 pm

Sunday, August 9th—5:00 pm

Grace Baptist Church meets

every Sunday at 1:00 pm at

60 Greenway Terrace, Forest Hills

Pastor Tim

graceofforesthills.com

www.graceofforesthills.com 
www.guineafield.blogspot.com

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the TOEIC test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Sundays from 5:00pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後5時～7時 (毎週二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。
results.name: TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop ・ TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

Not many songs are more cherished than Amazing Grace.  And yet, when you know the story behind the author, John Newton, and how he came “out of the depths” of despair, you will never sing this song the same again.  We invite you to join us for an evening with Newton; come and enjoy “Out of the Depths,” a drama performed by an excellent group of high school students. Space is limited to these two performances. To ensure your seat, you can register ahead of time on our website (graceofforesthills.com ).  If you are not able to register, seating/availability is on a first come first seated basis.  A nice meal will also be provided free of charge.

A Dinner Theater at Grace

Saturday, August 8th—5:00 pm

Sunday, August 9th—5:00 pm

Grace Baptist Church


60 Greenway Terrace, Forest Hills

Pastor Tim

graceofforesthills.com


www.graceofforesthills.com 
www.guineafield.blogspot.com 

[masked]
[masked]
results.name: Free Dinner Theater - "Out of the Depths," John Newton, Arthur of Amazing Grace

venue.name: Bayonne Park Wooden Gazebo Lower Level By the Water (48th St.)

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.
results.name: Sunday Walk Around Bayonne and Rutkowski Parks

It will include summer wines and yummy appetizers.

$30 payable at the door.

I hope you will join us as this is a fantastic spot!

Regards, 

John.

results.description:
What's a better way to start off the beginning of your work week (and the end of the weekend) with a trio of Sukana Bay Salmon crudo, pistachio crusted crispy Blue Point oysters, or some tamarind glazed beef short ribs? All that - and more - are on the Restaurant Menu at Sarabeth's this Restaurant Week. So, join us for some amazing food and even better conversation.

As always, take your RSVP seriously. We will be reaching out 24 - 48 hours before the event to confirm your attendance.

results.description:
Please join several dozen professionals for the weekly Sunday 5:30 Contemporary Mass at Holy Trinity Church conveniently located on the upper west side of Manhattan!  This mass is a great way to top off your week with relationship building with God and your peers.

Holy Trinity Church

213 West 82nd Street

Between Amsterdam and Broadway

Every Sunday after mass we gather in front of church for some socializing before heading over to a pre decided venue.  Why not become part of a growing, warm, welcoming and cohesive community!

venue.address_1: 2430 FDR Dr, East Service Road (at E. 23rd St & FDR Dr - New York Skyport Marina)
venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
For 1 night only, we're combining 2 of our most popular events (Quiet Clubbing & Yacht Cruises) for the ultimate Meetup!

This will be the best of both worlds. If you want to dance & party, you can listen to 3 DJs on our wireless headphones. And when you want to have a quiet conversation & enjoy the sights, just take the headphones off.

Mix, mingle & dance the night away with a panoramic view of the NYC skyline on a 100 foot long, 2-deck private yacht.  

*Tickets start at just $20 w/ discount code "QUIET" at checkout (goes up to $40 as event gets closer) - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/t/mic89/ 

Our past cruises have all sold out so don't wait to get tickets! Tickets must be purchased in advance (no tickets sold at the door). Pic below taken from recent cruise -  

What's included:

• 3 DJs (spinning 80s, 90s, 00's & Today)

• 2 floors & 2 bars 

• Free Snacks 

• Ice Breakers

• Prizes

• 200+ singles 

MUST PREPAY HERE (NO tix sold at door) -

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/t/mic89/ 

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels with both enclosed and outdoor areas. 

• Boarding begins at 5:30pm. The boat will depart at 6pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". It is a 21 and older event. Not meant be age/ethnic specific.

• You must get your ticket in advance. RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event. We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending. We have 20+ groups co-organizing with 200+ will be attending - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/t/mic89/
results.how_to_find_us: Private Event For Members & Their Friends, optional name tags will be provided
results.name: "QUIET YACHT PARTY" (4 HR CRUISE, 3 DJS, 2 FLOORS, 1 NIGHT) PRE PAY ONLY

This will be the best of both worlds. If you want to dance & party, you can listen to 3 DJs on our wireless headphones. And when you want to have a quiet conversation & enjoy the sights, just take the headphones off.

Mix, mingle & dance the night away with a panoramic view of the NYC skyline on a 100 foot long, 2-deck private yacht.   

*Tickets start at just $20 w/ discount code "QUIET" at checkout (goes up to $40 as event gets closer) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/

Our past cruises have all sold out so don't wait to get tickets! Tickets must be purchased in advance (no tickets sold at the door). Pic below taken from recent cruise -  

What's included:

• 3 DJs (spinning 80s, 90s, 00's & Today)

• 2 floors & 2 bars 

• Free Snacks 

• Ice Breakers

• Prizes

• 200+ singles 

MUST PREPAY HERE (NO tix sold at door) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels with both enclosed and outdoor areas. 

• Boarding begins at 5:30pm. The boat will depart at 6pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". It is a 21 and older event. Not meant be age/ethnic specific.

• You must get your ticket in advance. RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event. We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending. We have 20+ groups co-organizing with 200+ will be attending - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quietcruise/
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: 'Quiet Clubbing' YACHT Party (4 Hr Cruise, 3 DJs, 2 Floors, 1 Night Only) Prepay

results.description:
SECOND SUNDAYS is a monthly series of open studios, live music, and site-specific interventions presented by Pioneer Works the second Sunday of every month. The series showcases artists in residence along with musical performances and DJs, curated by Olivier Conan.

LIVE MUSIC:

THE WESTERLIES
6:30pm
The Westerlies re-imagine the chamber music experience through boldly personal performance, recording, collaboration, education, and outreach. Since their inception in 2011, they have cultivated a new brass quartet repertoire featuring over 50 original compositions as well as adaptations of Ives, Ellington, Bartok, Ligeti, Stephen Foster and numerous traditionals. Their music exudes the warmth of their longstanding friendships, and reflects the broad interests of its members.

JANKA NABAY
8pm
The king of Bubu – Sierra Leone’s brand of electro-pop. Back in his hometown of Sierra Leone, Janka electrified traditional Bubu music by adding drum machines and synthesizers and giving it a frantic edge that made him a national hero. Now based in the US, Janka has hooked up with musicians from Brooklyn and DC (where he lives) who call themselves the Bubu Gang. Janka and his musicians share a similar fascination with the old and the new, mixing modern beats and analog keyboards with call and response vocals, improvisation and touches of 70’s psychedelia. The collaboration seems to capitalize on the best of all worlds and the result is musically stimulating and just as danceable as Janka Nabay’s early hits. David Byrne’s label Luaka bop released their first full-length album a little while back.

FOOD:

LA NEWYORKINA
Selling paletas, Mexican ice pops, in the garden throughout the evening. All products are handmade from scratch in small batches, using the locally sourced ingredients. La Newyorkina donates a portion of their sales to Crea, an organization that helps generate employment opportunities in Mexico for low-income women.

LOCAL ORGANIC MARKET
A Red Hook Community Farm pop-up market with fresh seasonal vegetables and herbs.

EXHIBITS:

Z, by Robyn Renee Hasty, a new series of glass plate portraits created during her year long residency at Pioneer Works. Working with transgender, cisgender and a spectrum of genderqueer and gender non-confirming individuals, Z is collection of images that challenges our expectations of how gender is expressed, embodied and perceived.

NOMAD NO-MAD, by Hyon Gyon, brings together a grouping of the Korean artist’s large-scale canvases. Appropriating finely-shredded cloth, fabric scraps, wax, and other objects – such as shards of glass and fur forming snarled teeth– many of Gyon’s paintings depict a fearsome Korean shaman, while others more abstractly evoke a kind of existential, debris-ridden dread. One work features a vortex of childhood playthings; flattened stuffed animals revolve around a pseudo-face of sticky gold leaf, while a cheap, plastic doll is attached to the painting – rather brusquely – by its head, limbs hanging limply in the air. Both frightening and funny, Gyon’s work looms existentially in No-Mad Nomad, vacillating between representation and abstraction, the mystical and the everyday.

FROM WALDEN TO SPACE CHAPTER II/ THE HUT, 2015, by Stéphane Thidet, stages the collision between the book Walden or life in the Woods by Henry David Thoreau (1854) and the mission Mercury Seven (1958) sending men to space. It is a polymorphic work, with several chapters, evoking the questions of autonomy, isolation, solitude, but also contemplation and enlarged perspectives through music and live performance with modular synthesizers ( Ciat-Lombarde, Grendel Drone Commander…).

THE FOREST, by Andy Cahill, 2nd Floor Gallery,[masked] each panel 30×40 inches, acrylic on canvas

TRAINING SESSION, by Mathilde Roussel, 3rd Floor Gallery, discarded paper from everyone working at Pioneer Works to create paper pulp. After being grinded, the various stratums of paper will have slightly different grey tints and build historical layers that overlap, similarly to skins or rocks. This both practical and sym- bolic process will intrinsically link my sculptures to the community of Pioneer Works.

OPEN STUDIOS: Carmen Bouyer, Clocktower Radio, Robyn Hasty, Nanotronics Imaging, Paul Korzan, Janna Levin, Long Distance Poison, Ido Michaeli, Azikiwe Mohammed, Jesse Moretti, Mathilde Roussel, Chris Woebken, and Antonia Wright

INTERVENTIONS:

LONG DISTANCE POISON
It Sounds Like Time Inside is a short film presented by Clocktower artists-in-residence Long Distance Poison, depicting experiments in candle making, modular video synthesis, and meditations on narrative and time. The evening begins with a short experimental candle and incense workshop. This workshop demonstrates the process behind the materials used in the film.  Something seems to be revealed but then suddenly is concealed. A relation to Being flickers.  During the opening of the video installation, Long Distance Poison hosts an experimental candle and incense workshop, forging material for their culminating A/V performance, Sound and Time. Come observe their process and ask questions, dip your own candle, and experiment with your time.  And a repeat performance of Long Distance Poison’s modular video/analog sound event Rumkala Malantara will take place in the Pioneer Works recording studio at 9pm.

BORDER CROSSERS
Chico MacMurtrie/Amorphic Robot Works premier the first version of Border Crosser, a lightweight inflatable robotic sculpture, which poetically explores and questions the notion of borders and boundary conditions. Inflating from a dormant organic heap of fabric into a form resembling a communication tower. It begins to arch toward the other side of the border as a peaceful metaphor.  Its actions allude to the equality of humanity against a backdrop of tensions and conflicts over national and cultural identity. Technology comes to the fore in this questioning of the boundaries placed upon trans-border cultures and ecologies.  Border Crosser provokes investigation of borders as constructed entities, expressing a utopian desire to live in a world without borders.

Second Sundays starts at 4pm

Meetup begins at 6pm

$10 Suggested Donation

http://pioneerworks.org/events/
results.name: Second Sundays @ Pioneer Works

results.description:
Yup, that's right, as part Lincoln Center OutofDoors, Lyle Lovett and his Large Band will be performing at Damrosch Park, one of the open areas that is part of the Lincoln Center complex.

Lyle is from Texas and has won many Grammy awards for his music, bridging, the genre gap between big-band jazz and the Grand Ole Opry.  His style includes bits of blues, bluegrass and grassroots folk and with a unique voice,he and his band will sure be a crowd pleaser.  He's all Americana, a la Stetson.  

I'll be looking forward to his cross-over cover of Tammy Wynette's "Stand By Your Man". 

If you have read this far, you know you want to go, so hit "Yes" under "Are you going?" and we'll see you at the Fountain at 6:00pm.   And yes it's Free, so it's going to be Friggin'BigBand-tastic.

Note that the show starts at 7:00pm but we will want to secure some relatively good seats, so bring some food (your dinner perhaps), some soda pop and we can chat and eat while we wait for the show to start.
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet at the fountain in the middle of Lincoln Center (which is actually at 64th St and Broadway - bring a packed dinner if you would like!
results.name: An Evening with Lyle Lovett and his Large Band
Meet Sunday to Play Some Footy

results.description:
Want to make a quantum leap in your singing?


Singers, voice teachers, actors and speakers are invited to come and experience Diaphragm Target Training with Steven Flam, the developer of The BreathingRx for Singers System. Come and gain an appreciation about why this work is setting a new standard for vocal support. Every aspect of your singing profile will improve, including your expressiveness and joy!


Meet Your Soulful Singing Diaphragm / 6 Workshop Series[masked] / Take any, or all six! (best value for all six) / $35. per session / Come to the first one for free!*

All Six Workshops: $150 Registration is limited. Book your seat now by clicking here that you will attened. The system will lead you through registration.
*Deposit of $35 required to attend the first session, (will be applied to the series if you continue, or refunded if you choose to attend only the first one).

Workshop #1: August 9th / In And Out: Breathing and Movement:
In this first workshop of the series you will open up to a world of awareness that will allow you to release tension on a whole new level. You will then learn the secrets of diaphragm target training. In the Cue Game you will integrate this deeper release awareness and diaphragm training skill.

All Workshop Dates, (all on a Sunday and from 6-8pm):

August 9th: In And Out: Breathing and Movement
October 11th: DTT: Getting To Know Your Diaphragm
November 8th: Up And Down: Balance
December 13th Jaw Up: Tongue, Jaw, Head Position
January 10th: Loosen Up: Tension Release
February 21st: Looooonnnnng Phrases

There will be a special surprise at the end of the workshop series. So, stay tuned!
results.name: Meet Your Soulful Singing Diaphragm

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <" class="linkified">http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>;; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

results.description:
This is a MultiGroup event. You can see the combined event post at:

http://www.multigroupevents.com/events/cup-and-cake-a-tasting

Treat your taste buds to a unique foodie experience by two of NYC's top specialty shops. For one day only, indulge in 5 delectable cupcakes paired with 5 terroir-sourced teas in an intimate, hour-long exploration of aroma and taste. Join the celebration of East Village's diverse food culture at Butter Lane Cupcakes and Tea Drunk's first-ever collaboration.  We just married artisanal teas and buttery cupcakes!

We have a tasting reserved just for our group at 6:30PM, so you will be meeting up with others from our group exclusively. 

The cost for this event is $29.00.  You must Pre-pay to attend .  This event has seats for 8 people and they are available on a first pay first served basis. You can cancel and get a full refund up 48 hours before the event. You can sign up for this event by paying on-line with any credit or debit card by:

======> Clicking here! <======

About Tea Drunk (www.tea-drunk.com)

Tea is in so many ways like wine. Terroir matters a lot. Every tea season, founder Shunan Teng treks for three months through the back country of China to source our collection from 20+ historically famous tea mountains. Hailed by tea geeks around the world, Tea Drunk is a destination for those seeking exceptional tea and tea knowledge.

Tranquil and romantic, Tea Drunk serves in the brewing style that is true to the region where the tea comes from. Even if guests walk in knowing nothing about tea, they will have an unforgettable experience watching the tea prepared at table and opening their taste buds to the possibilities of terroir sourced tea, in the company of a tea pet – a clay drinking buddy.

About Butter Lane

At Butter Lane, our mission is to make you the perfect cupcake. With a focus on high-quality ingredients such as vanilla beans, pure cocoa, dark chocolate, and never any additives or artificial flavors, we're giving real food lovers something to sink their teeth into. We offer 16 different American buttercream icing flavors, plus a French buttercream in either chocolate or vanilla. We've won a cult following from Manhattan to Park Slope. Professionals have taken notice too: Ted Allen nominated the cupcakes on the Food Network Show as The Best Thing I Ever Ate!

There will be many tastings all day that you can attend on your own. If you would like to go another time on your own, you can sign up at:

https://teacupcake.eventbrite.com

-Mike
results.name: Tea and Cupcake Tasting

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

Lets’ bring the weekend to an end with a  BEAUTIFUL SUNSET WALK along the  Hudson River! THE DAYS ARE GETTING SHORTER SO LETS' MAKE THE MOST OF THESE SUMMER NIGHTS BEFORE THEY;RE GONE! The Flywheel Creamery ice cream shop across from the gazebo is open until 9 tonight for those interested. 

We will do the Pier loop which is about a one hour moderate paced level, paved walk so walking shoes, supportive sandals or sneakers are all you need, along with sun protection, water, bugspray and Cameras of course!

MEET US BY THE GAZEBO ALONG THE PIER. THERE IS PLENTY OF PARKING ON THE SQUARE, BY THE LIBRARY and IN THE BIG PARKING LOTS BEHIND  CONFETTIS RESTAURANT  ACROSS FROM THE LIBRARY.  INCLEMENT WEATHER CANCELS SO ALWAYS CHECK THE DAY OF AN EVENT, FOR ANY CHANGES.

Try to AVOID THE THRUWAY GOING SOUTH late Sundays in the summer as it gets backed up.  Use Route 59 east to and 9w south as alternates. SCROLL DOWN FOR DIRECTIONS TO THE LIBRARY: MEET AT GAZEBO ALONG THE PIER.

Getting to the Library

Driving directions & bus information. 

Find the Library on Google Maps

Driving from North via River Road: From the River Road (a.k.a. Piermont Avenue), which is the main street in Piermont, coming from the North make a left turn on Ash Street to Flywheel Park. The Library is the yellow building on the left behind the bank. 

Driving from South via Piermont Avenue: From the River Road (a.k.a. Piermont Avenue), which is the main street in Piermont, coming from the South make a right turn on Ash Street to Flywheel Park. The Library is the yellow building on the left behind the bank. 

Driving from I-287 East/I-87 South:Take Exit 11 Toward US – 9W/Nyack/S NyackAt traffic light, turn left onto NY-59 EAt traffic light, turn right onto US – 9WContinue on 9W for approximately 3.5 milesYou will see a Business District sign on the rightTurn slightly left onto Broadway St.Take the first left onto Ash St.The road will curve to the left at Hudson TerraceTurn sharply right to stay on Ash St.Proceed down Ash St. across Piermont Ave. and past M & T BankTurn left onto Flywheel Park W.The library is the yellow building on the leftDriving from I-287 West/I-87 North:Take Exit 10 to merge onto 9WContinue on 9W for approximately 3 milesFollow directions aboveGetting to Piermont by Bus: Red and Tan Line bus #9A stops in the heart of Piermont at the intersection of Piermont Ave. and Ash St., only a few yards away from the library.

The 9A bus operates between New York City and Stony Point, NY, with stops in nearby villages and towns including Nyack, South Nyack, Upper Nyack, Grand View, Piermont, Sparkill, Tappan, and Palisades. Please see the bus schedule for details.

results.description:
In the event that you’ve just picked up this book, and know little or nothing about it, and are unsure whether you should read it, I want to urge you with all my being that you must read The Executioner’s Song. I want to further guarantee that you will finish it. It’s the fastest 1,000 pages you will ever know.

It’s necessary to say, up front, that whatever you might know or think about Norman Mailer, or whatever you might assume about the man, his work, his personality or his sociopolitical views, none of that information (or misinformation) applies here. This is a story that bears no markings of what we presume to be Mailer’s prose style or point of view. The Executioner’s Song is completely something other. Mailer once said that the book was given to him, whole and complete from God, and it’s difficult to argue with that. the Executioner’s Song cannot be improved. Mailer did not write a better book and I'm not sure anyone of his generation wrote a better book.

I urge you to read this book without knowing anything more about the story it tells, By now, in 2012, the vast majority of readers new to The Executioner’s Song will have little to no knowledge about Gary Mark Gilmore, the book's central figure, where he came from, what he did. that is to be expected and perhaps even embraced for our purposes here. Reading his story with our knowing the outcome will only enhance the experience - it gives the book unimaginable tension and scope-- and so I urge you to read nothing more of this introduction, which will discuss some to the issues the book raises and will reveal too much.

David Eggers - Introduction from the 2012 printing

As always, we'd love to have you join us, even if you haven't read the whole thing, if you've never come before, or you haven't been here in months. We don't care. We're not one of those clique-y groups. Come on by and pull up a chair.

Come join us on Monday, August 10th!

Happy reading, 
-Joe

P.S. #1: Oh, about the $1 fee: Meetup charges $15+/month to maintain a Meetup group, so this is just an attempt to defray that cost. 

P.S.#2: If you do need to cancel for some reason, please do so with as much advance notice as possible. We’ve now have more than 300 members and we may well have a waiting list for our events. By canceling as soon as you can, you enable others to participate as well, which is nice for all.
results.name: 1980 THE EXECUTIONER'S SONG by Norman Mailer (BOOK TWO)

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to either end your week or begin your week (or both!) with others similarly-minded, those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

Mt Rainier - вулкан расположенный южнее Seattle, WA
Индейцы Якима называют вулкан Tahoma (Огромный Снежный Пик)
Гора покрыта ледником.
Первое подтвержденное восхождение зарегестрированно в 1870( General Hazard Steven)

План маршрута включает акклиматизацию - мин. 2 дня.
Для того что бы принять участие желательно пройти совместный зимний маршрут.
Необходимо совместно отработать хождение в связке,  технику crevasse rescue
Предполагается популярный маршрут через Camp Muir.

Возможно зайдем на вулкан St. Helens 8,365 ft (2,550 m)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_St._Helens

Маршрут не представляет технический сложности.
Вы увидите впечатляющие последствия извержения 1980 г.
Если Вы не заглядывали в жерло вулкана - это Ваш шанс.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_St._Helens

Когда: Июнь - Июль 2015

от 8 до 10 дней
