results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Shadows.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

My passion is CrossFit and Spartan Obstacle course racing and helping people improve their health and wellness. With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

results.description:
Who is ready to step up their workout routine, burn more calories, build more muscle and endurance and have a little fun with a great group of members who will help motivate you.  As an Instructor I will help you progress your fitness level after each workout.  This workout is suitable for all fitness levels. I will show you how to start out with modifications and work your way up to a more advanced level.  If you are a warrior and prefer the advance then this is for you!!! ALL LEVELS WILL BE DEMONSTRATED.  This is fun, it's challenging and you will feel GREAT by time you get through with your workout.  Please bring water, and a yoga mat and a positive attitude.  And get ready to WORK!  

Now you can take a live Insanity class at Zion Lutheran Church by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie. Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

"The CityParks PuppetMobile’s original production, Tales of Brier Rabbit, follows the adventures of notorious trickster Brier Rabbit, who is once again up to no good. Deceiving and stealing from his fellow animal friends, Brier Rabbit thinks he’s much too clever to ever get caught. However, in this modern adaptation of the American folk tale, Brier Rabbit’s pals are on to his tricks, and set out to teach him a lesson he won’t soon forget! CityParks PuppetMobile, one of the only traveling puppet theaters in the country, brings Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre productions and puppet making workshops to all corners of the city, free of charge. Traveling the five boroughs in a PuppetMobile equipped with a stage and staff of professional puppeteers, the CityParks PuppetMobile brings entertainment to 50,000 children and families each year. Performances are held in parks, playgrounds and recreation centers from April to October."

We can watch the puppet show and then go on the carousel after or head to the playground :)

results.name: Puppet mobile: Tales of Brier Rabbit

results.description:
Join us for an informational panel to learn key steps life science entrepreneurs must take to execute successful connections from conceptualization of an idea on the benchtop to partnering with investors or funding sources.  Luncheon provided by Eisner Amper to follow.  

Agenda

I.  Obtaining the Asset – Out-licensing Challenges;

a.  When to consider if it is an important step and if you are ready for this

b.  What are the key pieces to consider in doing this (who will pay for patent filing fees, who will pay for lab space, etc.) 

c.  Challenges if you don’t do this/Importance of doing this 

d.      Summarizing points from panelists' perspectives (an accounting perspective, team building and strategic market assessments, execution, etc)

II.  Funding Early Stage Initiatives – Early Initiatives: Prototype Development, Pre-Clinical, and Clinical Research;

a.  Adding a scientific advisory board 

b.  Non-dilutive grant funding options: foundations, the government, partnering R&D initiatives 

c.  Most important piece of the financial model at this point and contracting with these groups  

III.  Initial Engagement and Preparing for Outside Equity Financing

a.      What are investors thinking when they evaluate your deck? (What risks are being faced at this stage? Can this team overcome the risks? How much is time and money is required to overcome these risks? Is this a good investment (not “is this a good idea?” or “is this a good company?)  

b.      The need for cross functional teams/executive management/ and due diligence preparation 

c.      Partnerships with outside firms: legal, accounting and how they help

d.      How equity financing works, and what to expect in future rounds (aka Venture Math) 

 Panelists

Rick Colosimo:   Rick’s diverse legal practice ranges from providing complex, “bet-the-company” transactional and corporate governance advice to independent directors and stakeholders in closely held businesses to structuring new businesses for startup founders positioning themselves to raise capital.

Haro Hartounian: From Chemical Engineering PhD and academic roles Haro translated science to successful founding role for a series of medical companies:  Diavacs, Protagenic Therapeutics, and Microislet.

Caroline Hoedemaker:  The Founder of the tTAp: a Life Science Accelerator.  Caroline’s career has branched from engineering to marketing to CEO – all focused on the execution delivering results translating early innovation to the marketplace and the work that needs to be done:  both within early startups through Fortune 100 companies. 

John Pennett: Eisner Amper’s Partner-in-Charge of the Life Sciences Group and Technology Group. He has 30 years of public accounting experience with a strong emphasis on public and private life science and technology companies - See more at:http://www.eisneramper.com/about-us/professional-directory/John-Pennett.aspx#sthash.qUYpN59Y.dpuf

Moderator

Sam Kongsamut: Experienced Entrepreneurial Scientist with multiple roles from large pharma to entrepreneurial company

FAQs

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

For those coming by car, parking is available at NJIT Lot 16 located on 269 New Street. Please park in Lot 16 and walk to the entrance of the EDC at 211 Warren Street, approximately .1 mile and 2 mins from Lot 16.
results.name: Real Stories about Entrepreneurs’ Challenges at Various Stages of Funding

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

results.description:
Let's enjoy restaurant week the way we were supposed to, a 25.00 USD pre'fixed menu at this amazing restaurant

Since first opening its doors in 1984, Gotham Bar and Grill has epitomized New York City dining at its finest, serving Executive Chef Alfred Portale's sublime and refreshingly accessible Contemporary American Cuisine in a dining room that is consistently packed with sophisticated diners from all over the country and the world.

One of the secrets of Gotham's success is that it is an institution that has never become institutional. The unparalleled quality of the food and service are constants, but the rest of the Gotham experience is constantly updated to keep the restaurant feeling as fresh as the day it opened. New menu items are introduced each season, the wine list is always evolving, and the dining room is regularly revamped.

Gotham Bar and Grill has been honored as Most Outstanding Restaurant in the nation by the James Beard Foundation, which named Chef/Owner Alfred Portale Most Outstanding Chef in the nation for 2006.

How it works, I have made a reservation for 4 people, including myself, they only offer Lunch from monday to friday. I realize this might be hard for most of you to make it, but if you can, please RSVP responsibly!!!


Only 3 people can RSVP, but there will be a waiting list, so If your plans change and there are people waiting please change your rsvp.

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RendezVousnyc"></a>

results.description:
Hey builders!


We're doing a workshop on speakers again. If you went to the last one, this will be the same but better! This one will be in Queens, Long Island City.

Marc, BS/MS in EE from Tufts, will be instructing the course. He will give a lesson on physics and basic components. We will finish off by experimenting with the components and then make your own flashing speaker.

The workshop is $20 with all materials provided. Please RSVP so I can get the number of materials ready. 

Ask for the Conference Room. See you then!


Jaime

results.name: Basic electrical engineering

results.description:
Thinking in Events

Scripts are fabulous for automation, but they're not always the best solution, especially when you need to delegate tasks to people who don't know PowerShell. June will lead a hands-on lab where you'll create a GUI app based on Windows PowerShell, write handlers for Windows Forms events, and package your GUI app in an executable file for distribution. To participate in the lab, bring a laptop (or VM) with Windows PowerShell 3.0 or later, or just come and enjoy the fun. June will provide everything else you need, including a 30-day full license for PowerShell Studio.

Bio


June Blender is a technology evangelist for SAPIEN Technologies, Inc., a Windows PowerShell MVP, an honorary Scripting Guy, and a PowerShell Hero. In a previous life, she wrote the Get-Help content for Windows PowerShell 1.0 - 3.0. She blogs, writes scripts and help, talks to conferences and groups, and teaches PowerShell at all levels. She's is a frequent contributor to the Hey, Scripting Guy! Blog and PowerShell.org. She lives in magnificent Escalante, Utah, where she works remotely when she's not out hiking, canyoneering, or convincing lost tourists to try Windows PowerShell. She believes that outstanding solutions are a collaborative effort, and she welcomes your comments and contributions. You can follow her on Twitter at @juneb_get_help.
results.name: June Blender - Thinking in Events

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
We are officially at 5 years old and it's looking great. Volunteer events, great happy hours, fun-filled dinners, single events and outdoor fun. So we are getting to the big 5 and I wonder, "How can we make it special?"

I know we can pick anywhere, but I want it at the funnest bar we've been to. I want it near  all transportation. I know, we always pick places with no music, but it's our party I want to hear music. I want friendly bartenders and unique drink menu.


Come and join us. It's a great way to tell you Manic-Monday, We're having fun today. No limit on this event regards attendees

This class will have fewer people and those who have learned the ropes will be able to jump right in with a lesson. The newcomers will get more of an evaluation. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, pizza, etc.

I have been asked to post this policy statement:

[[[ "Dear Members: This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.

For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...

Michael T. Harvey" ]]]

Nyeek Drinks are our game nights at Amity Hall.  They're pretty regular, but always check the listings before coming in case we have to cancel or change dates.

Most of the places we play at don't charge us a rental fee.  So please keep in mind not to bring outside food or drink, to purchase something from the establishment and to be respectful of the space in general.

Amity Hall runs a special for people with the Beer 101 Passport where beer and appetizers are 50%.  For people there for game night this special applies from 4-10 as opposed to 4-8 as advertised outside.

MONDAY NIGHTS, TAROT SALON WITH THE TAROT SCHOOL

Forest Hills, 6-9:30pm, 

includes delicious light dinner and dessert!

$20 Pre-register online or cash, check, card at the door 

RSVP REQUIRED TO THE TAROT SCHOOL because space is limited!

(also RSVP here at Meetup, please!)

THERE IS ONLY ROOM FOR 15 PEOPLE!

LOCATION PROVIDED WHEN YOU CONTACT THEM,

at[masked] or  http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html

Every week, The Tarot School in Forest Hills offers a valuable, interactive Tarot class in the home of the founders, Ruth Ann & Wald Amberstone. Intimate, playful, and loaded with great new techniques and knowledge-based Tarot details, each class gives attendees a chance to both learn and practice.

This Meetup can only hold 14 people, and is held in a private home, so:

1st ~  Click this link http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html
and RSVP to The Tarot School, to receive your email about location

2nd ~ RSVP here at Living Tarot Meetup so that others will know you are coming. More's the merrier!

I look forward to seeing you in Forest Hills 

to throw the cards,  learn lots, and make new friends!

Warmly, 

Ferol

http://www.ferolhumphrey.com

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising. 

Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Monday & Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Trading Pit aka

‘The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares’

Bitcoin Center NYC

40 Broad Street

New York, NY 10004


 For a map of Bitcoin Center NYC, click here. 

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].

results.description:
We'll do two things - first a short version of show and tell, and then break up into smaller group for discussion. 

Show And Tell Talks: 

Talk 1 - Evolving infrastructure with legacy constraints by Alex Lo.  Alex Lo is tech lead of the developer infrastructure team at Flatiron Health, previously director of engineering at Nomi.


Talk 2 - People-focused engineering culture by Photis Patriotis, Director of Engineering at Prolific Interactive. 

Talk 3 - Introduction to Program Management by Jean Barmash

Talk 4 -  Using breath and movement to help regain focus and make better decisions.  By Wendy Closson.  

We haven't done this in about a year, so time to bring back Open Spaces. 

This will be a more relaxed session this time focused on people meeting each other and sharing expertise in a semi-structured setting.

Instead of having a formal speaker, we will do several mini-workshops on several topics.  We will split up into several groups, based on a particular topic.   Each group will bring up some issues / challenges that some of the people are interested in, and discuss it for 20-25 minutes.   Every 25 minutes a new topic will be picked, and new groups are formed.

Topics to be decided / voted on, here are some potential ideas (we will probably end up doing three topics):

Topics to be decided / voted on, here are some potential ideas (we will probably end up doing three topics):

• Process - Lean, Agile, QA, UX, Product

• Managerial - Managing, Hiring, Motivating, Networking

• Management - growing people, hiring, motivation, org structure

• Size-based challenges - Army of One, Scaling, Big Data

• By Stack - Ruby, LAMP, .NET, Java, Python

• By Industry - eCommerce, AdTech, Analytics, Content

We've done this format a couple of times over the last few years and had a really great time. 

Please come with some of your challenges or areas you' like to learn more about.

A group of us will hang out afterwards at a bar nearby.  


We like to hang out at Rye, which is at 11 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, between Avenue of Americas and 5th.   They have both drinks and food.   http://ryehousenyc.com/
results.name: Show and Tell and Open Spaces

results.description:
*THERE IS A MANDATORY $15 MINIMUM PURCHASE OF FOOD OR DRINK AT THIS EVENT*

*

Let's grab a bite to eat, maybe some drinks, and play some games! Yes, there are games you may never have heard of ... Splendor, Cash and Guns, Age of War, Imperial Settlers, Upon a Fable and many many more!! Not to worry!  People who bring the games will teach you how to play.  If you have a game you want to play, bring it along! 


We will get there between 6 and 6:30, have a bite to eat and then bring out the games!!  But, if you can't get there until later, no problem.  We'll be there for several hours.   Don't want to eat dinner there?  No problem, you can order some drinks.  Just keep in mind ... each attendee is required to purchase at least $15 of food or drinks.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  And again, if you want to bring one of your own games, that's cool too!

Welcome to Aces to Deuces outdoor Hitting sessions. These are free play sessions, typically for doubles play. However if court space allows, singles play is also an option. These sessions are an opportunity to shake off the rust, meet players that are at your level of play and for those that are league participants an opportunity to hit against potential opponents. For more about the league visit us @ AcestoDeuces.teamopolis.com. So come on out for a fun tennis filled session!!!

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly/Scrabble/Risk/etc. Be adventurous and come learn some new games that will change the way you think about board games!

We begin gathering around 6pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!

results.description:
Join us for an advance screening of THE MAN FROM U.N.C.L.E. 

For free ticket information and entry PLEASE READ IN FULL THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW.

Henry Cavill ("Man of Steel") stars as Napoleon Solo opposite Armie Hammer ("The Social Network") as Illya Kuryakin in director Guy Ritchie’s action adventure "The Man from U.N.C.L.E.," a fresh take on the hugely popular 1960s television series.

Set against the backdrop of the early 1960s, at the height of the Cold War, "The Man from U.N.C.L.E." centers on CIA agent Solo and KGB agent Kuryakin.  Forced to put aside longstanding hostilities, the two team up on a joint mission to stop a mysterious international criminal organization, which is bent on destabilizing the fragile balance of power through the proliferation of nuclear weapons and technology.  The duo’s only lead is the daughter of a vanished German scientist, who is the key to infiltrating the criminal organization, and they must race against time to find him and prevent a worldwide catastrophe."The Man from U.N.C.L.E" also stars Alicia Vikander ("Anna Karenina"), Elizabeth Debicki ("The Great Gatsby"), with Jared Harris ("Sherlock Holmes: Game of Shadows"), and Hugh Grant as Waverly.

The screenplay was written by Guy Ritchie & Lionel Wigram, who previously collaborated on re-imagining the classic detective Sherlock Holmes in two hit films. The story is by Jeff Kleeman & David Campbell Wilson and Guy Ritchie & Lionel Wigram, based on the television series "The Man from U.N.C.L.E."

This film has been rated PG-13 for action violence, some suggestive content, and partial nudity.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4K4Iv_N9Nno&index=1&list=PLVfin74Qx3tWppsBfFawjW7DWX6imjhp3

"bring with them the printed pass that they download from WB Tickets (link below, while supplies last). Talent will be in attendance and all pertinent details (dress code, arrival, etc.) will be on the ticket under SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS."

DO NOT SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO ATTEND OR YOU THINK SOMETHING WILL COME UP. The promo company receives the names of all who sign up and can see who does not use their ticket. Your no-show can affect future free movie offers and we don’t want to mess that up!

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 90 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

When: Mondays 6:30pm-7:45pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbees

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)

Come out and share some of your best material, or just be in the crowd and have a great night in the city with us! If you want to perform, or even just take part in the lightening round, there are limited spots remaining, so please reply to this email as soon as possible.

We are going to sell this event out ~ 125 people fit upstairs 
Music and bar ongoing after and throughout the night! 

Plus we have an amazing DJ spinning all night!

Atwood is a cool and comfortable chill but welcoming bar featuring craft beers, seasonal cocktails, and a loaded kitchen with a deep menu

Sets are 5-7 minute spots & we're featuring a 1 minute Comedy Lightening Round!!!! 

Invite your friends....or even your co-workers for this awesome night out in the city!


Performers welcome at 6 to meet & tweet out day of show.


This event WILL SELL OUT. We have 125 total tickets available. Must be 21+ to enter. This event is being held in a new partnership with SuccessWithTeamwork .com, Umbrella Network Group, and LaughNYC!!!

Table / bottle reservations are available - Midtown Manhattan on 52nd Street and 2nd Avenue at ATWOOD.
52nd & 2nd - 986 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10022

results.description:
We will be ascending Major Welch, taking in the sunset, socializing at Perkins Tower and then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to  enjoy during the break. There are still AT through hikers so if you would like to spread trail magic, bring a hiker-friendly treat to share. You will certainly put a smile on their face.

We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels (?) and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Relationships that are filled with drama drain our energy and make us feel terrible. So if they make us feel so bad, why do we keep attracting them and why do we stay in them? Join The Love Guru for this hour long event where you'll uncover deeper reasons as to why you keep attracting drama-filled relationships that don't make you happy and learn how to start attracting healthier relationships.

MORE DETAILS / PURCHASE YOUR TICKET :
http://www.loveguru.net/nycspiritualevents

ABOUT THE LOVE GURU'S EVENTS

The Love Guru works with angels, guides, archangels, ascended masters, fairies, ancestors, her star family and other galactic beings.  At each event she will channel a message on the related topic that is specific for those who sign up and attend.  It may not be what you are expecting to hear, but it is what your Soul wants you to know. The Love Guru will channel information and talk on the topic for the first 20-30 minutes of the event and then open up the class to answer your questions about the topic.  Feel free to come with pre-prepared questions and ask what your heart desires.  It's suggested that you take notes throughout the event as they are great to review after the class and in the days and weeks that follow.  Each time you read what you've written, new information will pop out to you.  The Love Guru's teachings and healings connect and shift you on many different layers.  The more sensitive you are and the more sensitive you become to energy, the more you will see, experience and feel when you attend.  But don't worry, regardless if you can see/feel/hear the many things happening in other dimensions at the events, you'll still have mindshifts and new awarenesses that come to you that will empower you in your life.  At each event, you'll receive teachings, heart healings and practical exercises.  Get ready and enjoy.  We're looking forward to you attending and being part of the group!


ABOUT THE LOVE GURU:

The Love Guru Blaire is a Spiritual Teacher, Intuitive Heart Healer, Psychic/Medium, Shaman, Visionary, Love Expert, and Marriage and Family Therapist.  Ever since she was young, she always wondered "What's the secret formula to find "The One?"  In 2004, The Universe guided her to that answer.  One soulmate easily attracted into her life after the next , she then married her Twin Flame (the ultimate spiritual partnership).  Now she teaches this easier, more natural, flowing way to attract love to her clients -- it's called "The Spiritual Way To Attract The One®"   Over the years, The Love Guru has gone deeper into spirituality, studying shamanism, kabbalah, energy healing and much more.  In 2013, Blaire became enlightened when she healed her childhood wounds and in 2014, The Love Guru re-connected with her star family.

The Love Guru is an Intuitive Heart Healer, which means she has the gift to open and heal your heart so you can attract the love and have the relationship and the life you desire. Her specialty is emotional healing, being able to clear and heal your your anger, anxiety, sadness, loneliness, frustration and pain.  She's able to release you from old programming and outworn thoughts and behaviors that no longer serve you or your life.  The Love Guru works with high powered executives, entrepreneurs and celebrities to help them clear their blocks and take them to the next level.  Featured in The New York Times, LA Times, CNN, MSNBC, Montel Show, Glamour Magazine and much more.  If you would like to work privately with The Love Guru, contact her through <a>www.loveguru.net </a>

results.description:
Join host Gilbert Cruz and many other long-time "regulars" not listed here for the latest installment of The INTAR Salon. 

Come and watch or come and work --- or both!

What to perform?  Whatever you want.  

Something "perfected" or a work in progress; something original or something well known; an excerpt from a one-person show or a scene with numerous characters; it can be anything.  (Within reason. :))  The stage is yours for ten minutes. 

If you intend to perform:  Be sure to check in between 6:30 and 7:00; the action starts at 7:00.

Try not to be late, after 7:30 we may not be able to hear the buzzer..and sign up is officially closed at 7:30

If you come in purely audience mode:  Just sit back and be inspired and entertained.  (You're never obligated to perform.)

All followed by an informal soiree centered in the theater's bar/lounge area.  (Feel free to bring any beer, wine, or other drinkables or eatables you'd like to share.)  

Don't forget to "RSVP"!

results.description:
Fifty years ago they were paid by Big Tobacco to convince us that “all the facts weren’t in” on the links between cigarettes and cancer. Today many of the same people and companies are doing the same dirty work for climate-change deniers. This revealing 2014 documentary examines the network of scientific “experts” paid by major corporations to spread disinformation about looming environmental threats, including chemical pollution and global climate change.

SHSNY Movie Night is FREE.

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Movie Night - "Merchants of Doubt"

results.description:
Need to learn Docker? This is the course for you! This course provides a soup-to-nuts learning experience for core Docker technologies, including the Docker Engine, Images, Containers, Registries, Networking, Storage, and more. All of the behind the scenes theory is explained, and all concepts are clearly demonstrated on the command line. No prior knowledge of Docker or Linux is required.

About the Author: Nigel Poulton is a popular figure in the tech industry, renowned for his love of storage and deep technical knowledge. Nigel writes a popular long-running storage blog as well as having hosted many popular technology podcasts, all of which are which are known for their excellent treatment of technical topics. Nigel has worked in technology for 15 years with nearly 10 of those years spent designing and managing solutions in some of the most demanding corporate IT environments in the world. Nigel has worked his way up from changing tapes and resetting passwords, all the way up to designing resilient, high performance, petabyte scale solutions, as well as owning and managing production storage environments, predominantly in the financial services sector.
results.name: Docker Deep Dive Week 3 of 5

results.description:
The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has always been committed to strengthening the patent system and fostering innovation.  Independent inventors and small businesses sometimes struggle with how to file and prosecute a patent application to protect their invention, due, for example, to unfamiliarity with the patent system. Furthermore, independent inventors face a unique set of challenges, such as a lack of resources, which may unnecessarily disadvantage them.  The nationwide implementation of the Patent Pro Bono Program is far-reaching, ambitious and another tool of opportunity.

Jennifer McDowell of the USPTO will present the details of the program and help you understand if it is available and appropriate for you.

Please join us for an informative session and networking.
results.name: The Ultimate Inventor Assistance--Pro Bono Program from the USPTO

results.description:
NYC Data Science Academy is offering a new course focus on Intensive Data Science Toolkit(Linux, Git, Sql)  to help Data Scientists and Business Analysts' work more productive and effective!

18 Seats only!  Register the classes from Eventbrite!

Dates & Hours

Aug 10, 12, 17, 19, 24, 26(Monday - Wed) , 6:30-9:30pm 

What is this class about?

This class is about the basic tools to work in a Unix setting. It includes:

Aug 10 and 12: Typical usage of git, a version control system, and online version github

Aug 17 and 19: Common shell command to achieve daily tasks, include filesystem, job management, standard IO and pipe

Aug 24: In-depth usage of vi and markdown SQL database access(1 night)


Aug 26: Advanced Linux usage -- Grep, Sed, Awk, Csvkit(1 night)

Why take this class?

Unix environment is widely used in data science field. So be familiar with the common tools is required to carry out further data analysis. This class enables students to communicate with computer via command line environment. And it also introduce the SQL database, which is the traditional database widely used in the enterprise setting.

Expected Learning Outcomes

After successful completion of this course, you will be able to:

Linux 

• Comfortable with Linux environment 

• Able to use Linux commands 

• Familiar with IO redirection and Pipe 

• Able to connect and work from remote server 

Git 

•  Adopt to modern source code management 

• Able to use common git operations 

• Able to setup github and create personal portfolio page

SQL 

•  Able to build relational database for data storage 

• Able to access relational database and query for data

Course Logistics

Prerequisites

Basic knowledge of computer components. Basic knowledge of internet

Recommended Materials

Linux command line

git book 

Online Discussion Platforms

Piazza is our online class room. All class content and schedule will be posted there.

Course Components

Lectures

18 hours lectures

Homework

There are three main homework assignments:

1. git & github 

2. SQL 

3. Create personal setting on Unix server

Course Policies

Assessment Procedure

Course performance will be evaluated on a pass/fail basis based on completion of homework. Homework assignments will be handed out in class along with due dates.

Students will gain a certificate upon successful completion of this course.
results.name: Popular Data Science Toolkit(Linux, Git, Sql) course

results.description:
This is a joint event with The British Film and Television Meetup.

http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/corporate2/images/width/live/p0/1y/yg/p01yyg1z.jpg/624

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=edINDeJ65ns

Narrated by Emmy® nominated and Golden Globe award-winning actor Idris Elba (Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom, American Gangster, Luther) and executive produced by Mike Newell (Great Expectations, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, Donnie Brasco), Enchanted Kingdom is a jaw-dropping, immersive family cinema experience set to take audiences on a cinematic trip of a lifetime through seven distinct realms - Mysterious Forest, Fiery Underworld, Alien Sands, Scorched Plains, Fantastical Seas, Frozen Spires and the Mercurial Waters - in the wildest continent on Earth. Go on an astounding exploration through an enchanted land where nature weaves its incredible magic.

You may want to bring your older kids.  You will never get this close to a lion or an elephant!

Tickets are $18.  3D glasses will be provided at the theatre.  Purchase at this link or at the box office.  If you are an AMC Stubs Program member, there is no transaction fee.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.

If you are a member of both groups, please RSVP only once.

Originally posted on 7/18/15

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
